Name: ABERCROMBIE, Neil
Bio:
['a Representative from Hawaii; born in Buffalo, Erie County, N.Y., \r', 'June 26, 1938; graduated from Williamsville High School, Williamsville, N.Y.; \r', 'B.A., Union College, Schenectady, N.Y., 1959; M.A., University of Hawaii, \r', 'Manoa, Hawaii, 1964; Ph.D., University of Hawaii, Manoa, Hawaii, 1974; \r', 'unsuccessful candidate for United States Senate in 1970; member of the Hawaii \r', 'state house of representatives, 1974-1978; member of the Hawaii state senate, \r', '1978-1986; elected as a Democrat to the Ninety-ninth Congress in a special \r', 'election to fill the vacancy caused by the resignation of United States \r', 'Representative Cecil Heftel (September 20, 1986-January 3, 1987); unsuccessful \r', 'candidate for election to the One Hundredth Congress in 1986; member of the \r', 'Honolulu city council, 1988-1991; elected to the One Hundred Second and to the \r', 'nine succeeding Congresses until his resignation on February 28, 2010 (January \r', '3, 1991-February 28, 2010); Governor of Hawaii, 2010-2014. \r', '


\r', '

Bibliography

Abercrombie, Neil, and Richard Hoyt. \r', 'Blood of Patriots. New York: Forge, 1996; Abercrombie, Neil. \r', '”Mumford, Mailer, and Machines: Staking a Claim for Man.” Ph. D. Diss., \r', 'University of Hawaii, 1974.\r']

Name: ACKERMAN, Gary Leonard
Bio: ['a Representative from New York; born in Brooklyn, Kings County, N.Y., November 19, 1942; graduated from Brooklyn Technical High School, Brooklyn, N.Y., 1960; B.A., Queens College, Flushing, N.Y., 1965; attended, St. John’s University, Jamaica, N.Y., 1966; teacher; member of the New York state senate, 1979-1983; business owner; unsuccessful candidate for city council, New York City, N.Y., 1977; elected as a Democrat to the Ninety-eighth Congress, by special election, to fill the vacancy caused by the death of United States Representative Benjamin Rosenthal, and reelected to the fourteen succeeding Congresses (March 1, 1983-January 3, 2013); was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Thirteenth Congress in 2012.\r']

Name: ADERHOLT, Robert
Bio: ['a Representative from Alabama; born in Haleyville, Winston County, \r', 'Ala., July 22, 1965; B.A., Birmingham Southern College, Birmingham, Ala., 1987; \r', 'J.D., Samford University, Birmingham, Ala., 1990; lawyer, private practice; \r', 'Haleyville, Ala., municipal judge, 1992-1995; staff, Alabama Governor Fob \r', 'James, 1995-1996; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Fifth and to the \r', 'ten succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1997-present).\r']

Name: AKIN, W. Todd
Bio: [' a Representative from Missouri; born in New York, N.Y., July 5, \r', '1947; B.S., Worcester Polytechnic Institute, Worcester, Mass., 1971; M.Div., \r', 'Covenant Seminary, St. Louis, Mo., 1984; United States Army, 1971-1980; member \r', 'of the Missouri state house of representatives, 1988-2001; elected as a \r', 'Republican to the One Hundred Seventh and to the five succeeding Congresses \r', '(January 3, 2001-January 3, 2013); was not a candidate for reelection to the \r', 'One Hundred Thirteenth Congress in 2012, but was an unsuccessful candidate for \r', 'election to the United States Senate. \r']

Name: ALLEN, Thomas H.
Bio:
['a Representative from Maine; born in Portland, Cumberland County, \r', 'Maine, April 16, 1945; graduated from Deering High School, Portland, Maine, \r', '1963; B.A., Bowdoin College, Brunswick, Maine, 1967; Rhodes Scholar, B. Phil., \r', 'Oxford University, Oxford, England, 1970; J.D., Harvard University, Cambridge, \r', 'Mass., 1974; lawyer, private practice; staff, Governor Kenneth B. Curtis of \r', 'Maine, 1968; staff, United States Senator Edmund S. Muskie, 1970-1971; \r', 'Portland, Maine, city council, 1989-1995; mayor of Portland, Maine, 1991-1992; \r', 'elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Fifth and to the five succeeding \r', 'Congresses (January 3, 1997-January 3, 2009); not a candidate for reelection in \r', '2008, but was an unsuccessful candidate for the United States \r', 'Senate.\r', '


\r', '

Bibliography

Allen, Thomas H. \r', 'Dangerous Convictions: What’s Really Wrong with the U. S. \r', 'Congress. New York: Oxford University Press, 2013.\r']

Name: ANDREWS, Robert Ernest
Bio: ['a Representative from New Jersey; born in Camden, Camden County, \r', 'N.J., August 4, 1957; graduated from Triton High School, Runnemede, N.J., 1975; \r', 'B.S., Bucknell University, Lewisburg, Pa., 1979; J.D., Cornell Law School, \r', 'Ithaca, N.Y., 1982; freeholder, Camden County, N.J., 1986-1990; freeholder \r', 'director, Camden County, N.J., 1988-1990; elected as a Democrat by special \r', 'election to the One Hundred First Congress, to fill the vacancy caused by the \r', 'resignation of United States Representative James Florio and reelected to the \r', 'twelve succeeding Congresses until his resignation on February 18, 2014 (November 6, 1990-February 18, 2014).\r']

Name: ARMEY, Richard Keith
Bio:
['a Representative from Texas; born in Cando, Towner County, N. Dak., \r', 'July 7, 1940; graduated from Cando High School, Cando, N. Dak., 1958; B.A., \r', 'Jamestown College, Jamestown, N. Dak., 1963; M.A., University of North Dakota, \r', 'Grand Forks, N. Dak., 1964; Ph.D., University of Oklahoma, Oklahoma City, \r', 'Okla., 1968; professor, University of Montana, Missoula, Mont.; assistant \r', 'professor, West Texas Agricultural and Mechanical University, Canyon, Tex.; \r', 'assistant professor, Austin College, Sherman, Tex.; faculty and administrator, \r', 'University of North Texas, Denton, Tex.; distinguished fellow of the Fisher \r', 'Institute, Dallas, Tex.; elected as a Republican to the Ninety-ninth and to the \r', 'eight succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1985-January 3, 2003); majority leader \r', '(One Hundred Fourth through One Hundred Seventh Congresses); not a candidate \r', 'for reelection to the One Hundred Eighth Congress in 2002. \r', '


\r', '

Bibliography

Armey, Richard K., and Matt Kibbe. \r', 'Give Us Liberty: A Tea Party Manifesto. New York: William \r', 'Morrow, 2010.\r']

Name: BACA, Joe
Bio:
['a Representative from California; born in Belen, Valencia County, \r', 'N.Mex., January 23, 1947; B.A., California State University, Los Angeles, \r', 'Calif., 1971; United States Army, 1966-1968; member of the California state \r', 'assembly, 1992-1999; member of the California state senate, 1999; elected as a \r', 'Democrat to the One Hundred Sixth Congress, by special election, to fill the \r', 'vacancy caused by the death of United States Representative George E. Brown, \r', 'and reelected to the six succeeding Congresses (November 16, 1999-January 3, \r', '2013); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Thirteenth \r', 'Congress in 2012; unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One Hundred \r', 'Fourteenth Congress in 2014; unsuccessful candidate for election as Mayor of \r', 'Fontana, Calif., in 2014; unsuccessful candidate for nomination as a Republican \r', 'to the One Hundred Fifteenth Congress in 2016.\r', '


\r', '

Bibliography

”Joe Baca” in \r', 'Hispanic Americans in Congress, 1822-2012. Prepared under the \r', 'direction of the Committee on House Administration by the Office of the \r', 'Historian and the Office of the Clerk, U.S. House of Representatives. \r', 'Washington: Government Printing Office, 2013.\r']

Name: BACHUS, Spencer T., III
Bio: ['a Representative from Alabama; born in Birmingham, Jefferson County, \r', 'Ala., December 28, 1947; B.A., Auburn University, Auburn, Ala., 1969; J.D., \r', 'University of Alabama School of Law, Tuscaloosa, Ala., 1972; National Guard, \r', '1969-1971; lawyer, private practice; member of the Alabama state senate, \r', '1983-1984; member of the Alabama state house of representatives, 1984-1987; \r', 'member, Alabama state board of education, 1987-1991; chairman, Alabama \r', 'Republican executive committee, 1991-1992; elected as a Republican to the One \r', 'Hundred Third and to the ten succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1993-January 3, \r', '2015); chair, Committee on Financial Services (One Hundred Twelfth Congress); \r', 'was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Fourteenth Congress in \r', '2014.\r']

Name: BAIRD, Brian
Bio: ['a Representative from Washington; born in Chama, Rio Arriba County, \r', 'N.Mex., March 7, 1956; B.S., University of Utah, Provo, Utah, 1977; M.S., \r', 'University of Wyoming, Laramie, Wyo., 1980; Ph.D., University of Wyoming, \r', 'Laramie, Wyo., 1984; clinical psychologist; professor, Pacific Lutheran \r', 'University, Tacoma, Wash., 1986-1998; unsuccessful candidate for election to \r', 'the One Hundred Fifth Congress in 1996; elected as a Democrat to the One \r', 'Hundred Sixth Congress and to the five succeeding Congresses (January 3, \r', '1999-January 3, 2011); was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred \r', 'Twelfth Congress in 2010. \r']

Name: BAKER, Richard Hugh
Bio: ['a Representative from Louisiana; born in New Orleans, Orleans \r', 'Parish, La., May 22, 1948; graduated from University High School; B.A., \r', 'Louisiana State University, Baton Rouge, La., 1971; member of the Louisiana \r', 'state house of representatives, 1972-1986; elected as a Republican to the One \r', 'Hundredth and to the ten succeeding Congresses until his resignation February \r', '2, 2008 (January 3, 1987-February 2, 2008). \r']

Name: BALDACCI, John Elias
Bio: ['a Representative from Maine; born in Bangor, Penobscot County, \r', 'Maine, January 30, 1955; graduated from Bangor High School, Bangor, Maine, \r', '1973; B.A., University of Maine, Orono, 1986; member of Bangor, Maine, city \r', 'council, 1978-1981; member of the Maine state senate, 1982-1994; elected as a \r', 'Democrat to the One Hundred Fourth and to the three succeeding Congresses \r', '(January 3, 1995-January 3, 2003); not a candidate for reelection to the One \r', 'Hundred Eighth Congress in 2002; Governor of Maine, 2003 to 2011. \r']

Name: BALDWIN, Tammy
Bio: ['a Senator and a Representative from Wisconsin; born in Madison, Dane \r', 'County, Wis., February 11, 1962; graduated from Madison West High School, \r', 'Madison, Wis., 1980; A.B., Smith College, Northampton, Mass., 1984; J.D., \r', 'University of Wisconsin Law School, Madison, Wis., 1989; lawyer, private \r', 'practice; Dane County, Wis., board of supervisors, 1986-1994; member of the \r', 'Wisconsin state assembly, 1993-1999; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred \r', 'Sixth and to the six succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1999-January 3, 2013); \r', 'was not a candidate for reelection to the House of Representatives but was \r', 'elected as a Democrat to the United States Senate in 2012 for the term ending \r', 'January 3, 2019; Democratic Conference secretary (2017-).\r']

Name: BALLENGER, Cass
Bio: [' (great-great-grandson of Lewis Cass), \r', 'a Representative from North Carolina; born in Hickory, Catawaba \r', 'County, N.C., December 6, 1926; graduated from Episcopal High School, \r', 'Alexandria, Va., 1944; attended University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill, \r', 'N.C., 1944-1945; B.A., Amherst College, Amherst, Mass., 1948; United States \r', 'Naval Air Corps, 1944-1945; member of the North Carolina state house of \r', 'representatives, 1974-1976; member of the North Carolina state senate, \r', '1976-1986; elected as a Republican to the Ninety-ninth Congress, by special \r', 'election, to fill the vacancy caused by the resignation of United States \r', 'Representative James Broyhill, and at the same time elected to the One \r', 'Hundredth Congress and reelected to the eight succeeding Congresses (November \r', '4, 1986- January 3, 2005); not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred \r', 'Ninth Congress in 2004; died on February 18, 2015, in Hickory, N.C.\r']

Name: BARCIA, James A.
Bio: ['a Representative from Michigan; born in Bay City, Bay County, Mich., \r', 'February 25, 1952; B.A., Saginaw Valley State College, University Center, \r', 'Mich., 1974; staff, United States Senator Philip A. Hart of Michigan, 1971; \r', 'community service coordinator, Michigan Blood Center, 1974-1975; administrative \r', 'assistant to Michigan state representative Donald J. Albosta, 1975-1976; member \r', 'of the Michigan state house of representatives, 1977-1983; member of the \r', 'Michigan state senate, 1983-1993, 2003-2011; elected as a Democrat to the One \r', 'Hundred Third and to the four succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1993-January 3, \r', '2003); not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Eighth Congress in \r', '2002. \r']

Name: BARR, Bob
Bio: ['a Representative from Georgia; born in Iowa City, Johnson County, \r', 'Iowa, November 5, 1948; graduated, Community High School, Tehran, Iran, 1966; \r', 'B.A., University of Southern California, Los Angeles, Calif., 1970; M.A., \r', 'George Washington University, Washington, D.C., 1972; J.D., Georgetown \r', 'University Law Center, Washington, D.C., 1977; Central Intelligence Agency, \r', '1970-1978; United States Attorney for the Northern District of Georgia, \r', '1986-1990; anti-drug coordinator for Department of Justice, Southeastern United \r', 'States, 1986-1990; head, Public Corruption Subcommittee for United States \r', 'Attorney General, 1987-1988; president, Southeastern Legal Foundation, \r', '1990-1991; unsuccessful candidate for nomination to the United States Senate in \r', '1992; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Fourth and to the three \r', 'succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1995-January 3, 2003); one of the managers \r', 'appointed by the House of Representatives in 1998 to conduct the impeachment \r', 'proceedings of President William Jefferson Clinton; unsuccessful candidate for \r', 'nomination to the One Hundred Eighth Congress in 2002; unsuccessful Libertarian \r', 'Party candidate for election for President of the United States in 2008; \r', 'unsuccessful candidate for nomination to the One Hundred Fourteenth Congress in \r', '2014.\r']

Name: BARRETT, Thomas M.
Bio: ['a Representative from Wisconsin; born in Milwaukee, Milwaukee \r', 'County, Wis., December 8, 1953; graduated from Marquette University High \r', 'School, Milwaukee, Wis.; B.A., University of Wisconsin, Madison, Wis., 1976; \r', 'J.D., University of Wisconsin School of Law, 1980; clerk to United States Judge \r', 'Robert Warren of the Eastern District of Wisconsin, 1980-1982; lawyer, private \r', 'practice; unsuccessful candidate to the Wisconsin state assembly in 1982; \r', 'member of the Wisconsin state assembly, 1984-1989; member of the Wisconsin \r', 'state senate, 1989-1993; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Third and to \r', 'the four succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1993-January 3, 2003); not a \r', 'candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Eighth Congress in 2002, but was an \r', 'unsuccessful nominee for Governor of Wisconsin; mayor of Milwaukee, Wis., \r', '2004-present; unsuccessful candidate for Governor of Wisconsin in 2010. \r']

Name: BARTLETT, Roscoe Gardner
Bio: ['a Representative from Maryland; born in Moreland, Jefferson County, \r', 'Ky., June 3, 1926; B.S., Columbia Union College, Takoma Park, Md., 1947; M.S., \r', 'University of Maryland, College Park, Md., 1948; Ph.D., University of Maryland, \r', 'College Park, Md., 1952; faculty, University of Maryland, College Park, Md., \r', '1948-1952; faculty, Loma Linda School of Medicine, Loma Linda, Calif., \r', '1952-1954; assistant professor, Howard University Medical School, Washington, \r', 'D.C., 1954-1956; unsuccessful candidate for election to the Ninety-eighth \r', 'Congress in 1982; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Third and to the \r', 'nine succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1993-January 3, 2013); unsuccessful \r', 'candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Thirteenth Congress in \r', '2012.\r']

Name: BARTON, Joe Linus
Bio: ['a Representative from Texas; born in Waco, McLennan County, Tex., \r', 'September 15, 1949; graduated from Waco High School, Waco, Tex., 1968; B.A., \r', 'Texas A&M University, College Station, Tex., 1972; M.S., Purdue University, \r', 'West Lafayette, Ind., 1973; business executive; White House Fellowship, served \r', 'as aide to Secretary of Energy James B. Edwards, 1981-1982; elected as a \r', 'Republican to the Ninety-ninth and to the sixteen succeeding Congresses \r', '(January 3, 1985-present); chair, Committee on Energy and Commerce (One Hundred \r', 'Eighth and One Hundred Ninth Congresses).\r']

Name: BASS, Charles Foster
Bio: [' (son of Perkins Bass), \r', 'a Representative from New Hampshire; born in Boston, Suffolk County, \r', 'Mass., January 8, 1952; graduated from Holderness School, Plymouth, N.H., 1970; \r', 'A.B., Dartmouth College, Hanover, N.H., 1974; staff for United States \r', 'Representative William S. Cohen of Maine, 1974; staff for United States \r', 'Representative David F. Emery of Maine, 1975-1979; unsuccessful candidate for \r', 'nomination to the Ninety-seventh Congress in 1980; delegate to New Hampshire \r', 'constitutional convention, 1984; member of the New Hampshire general court, \r', '1982-1988; member of the New Hampshire state senate, 1988-1992; elected as a \r', 'Republican to the One Hundred Fourth and to the five succeeding Congresses \r', '(January 3, 1995-January 3, 2007); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the \r', 'One Hundred Tenth Congress in 2006; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred \r', 'Twelfth Congress (January 3, 2011-January 3, 2013); unsuccessful candidate for \r', 'reelection to the One Hundred Thirteenth Congress in 2012.\r']

Name: BECERRA, Xavier
Bio: ['a Representative from California; born in Sacramento, Sacramento \r', 'County, Calif., January 26, 1958; B.A., Stanford University, Stanford, Calif., \r', '1980; J.D., Stanford University, Stanford., Calif., 1984; lawyer, private \r', 'practice; staff, California state senator Art Torres, 1986; deputy attorney \r', 'general, Office of the Attorney General, State of California, 1987-1990; member \r', 'of the California state assembly, 1990-1992; elected as a Democrat to the One \r', 'Hundred Third and to the twelve succeeding Congresses until his resignation on \r', 'January 24, 2017 (January 3, 1993-January 24, 2017); chair, House Democratic \r', 'Caucus (One Hundred Thirteenth and One Hundred Fourteenth Congresses); attorney \r', 'general of California, 2017-present.\r']

Name: BENTSEN, Kenneth E., Jr.
Bio: [' (nephew of Lloyd Millard Bentsen), \r', 'a Representative from Texas; born in Houston, Harris County, Tex., \r', 'June 3, 1959; graduated from Deerfield Academy, Deerfield, Mass., 1977; B.A., \r', 'University of St. Thomas, Houston, Tex., 1982; M.P.A., American University, \r', 'Washington, D.C., 1985; staff, United States Representative Ronald D. Coleman \r', 'of Texas, 1983-1987; associate staff, United States House Committee on \r', 'Appropriations, 1985-1987; investment banker; elected as a Democrat to the One \r', 'Hundred Fourth and to the three succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1995-January \r', '3, 2003); not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Eighth Congress in \r', '2002, but was an unsuccessful candidate for nomination to the United States \r', 'Senate. \r']

Name: BEREUTER, Douglas Kent
Bio: ['a Representative from Nebraska; born in York, York County, Nebr., \r', 'October 6, 1939; attended St. Paul’s Lutheran School, Utica, Nebr.; graduated \r', 'from Utica High School, Utica, Nebr., 1957; B.A., University of Nebraska, \r', 'Lincoln, Nebr., 1961; M.C.P., Harvard University, Cambridge, Mass., 1966; \r', 'M.P.A., Harvard University, Cambridge, Mass., 1973; United States Army, \r', '1963-1965; urban planner, United States Department of Housing and Urban \r', 'Development, 1965-1966; division director, Nebraska Department of Economic \r', 'Development, 1967-1968; director, Office of Planning and Programming, Nebr., \r', '1968-1970; Federal-State Relations Coordinator for Nebraska state government, \r', '1967-1970; member of the Nebraska Crime Commission, 1969-1971; member of the \r', 'Nebraska unicameral legislative, 1975-1978; elected as a Republican to the \r', 'Ninety-sixth and to the twelve succeeding Congresses and served until his \r', 'resignation on August 31, 2004 (January 3, 1979-August 31, 2004). \r']

Name: BERKLEY, Shelley
Bio: ['a Representative from Nevada; born Rochelle Levine in New York, \r', 'N.Y., January 20, 1951; graduated from Valley High School, Las Vegas, Nev.; \r', 'B.A., University of Nevada, Las Vegas, 1972; J.D., University of San Diego Law \r', 'School, San Diego, Calif., 1976; member, Nevada state assembly, 1983-1985; \r', 'member, Nevada University and Community College System Board of Regents, \r', '1990-1998; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Sixth and to the six \r', 'succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1999-January 3, 2013); was not a candidate \r', 'for reelection in 2012, but was an unsuccessful candidate for election to the \r', 'United States Senate.\r']

Name: BERMAN, Howard Lawrence
Bio: ['a Representative from California; born in Los Angeles, Los Angeles \r', 'County, Calif., April 15, 1941; graduated from Hamilton High School, Los \r', 'Angeles, Calif., 1959; B.A., University of California, Los Angeles, Calif., \r', '1962; LL.B., University of California School of Law, Los Angeles, Calif., 1965; \r', 'lawyer, private practice; VISTA volunteer, 1966-1967; member of the California \r', 'state assembly, 1973-1982; delegate, Democratic National Convention, 1968, \r', '1976, and 1984; elected as a Democrat to the Ninety-eighth and to the fourteen \r', 'succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1983-January 3, 2013); chair, Committee on \r', 'Foreign Affairs (One Hundred Tenth and One Hundred Eleventh Congresses); \r', 'unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Thirteenth Congress in \r', '2012. \r']

Name: BERRY, Robert Marion
Bio: ['a Representative from Arkansas; born in Stuttgart, Arkansas County, \r', 'Ark., August 27, 1942; graduated from DeWitt High School, DeWitt, Ark.; B.S., \r', 'University of Arkansas for Medical Sciences, 1965; farmer; Gillett, Ark., city \r', 'council, 1976-1980; Arkansas Soil and Water Conservation Commission, 1986-1994; \r', 'White House Domestic Policy Council, 1993-1996; special assistant to President \r', 'William Clinton for Agricultural Trade and Food Assistance, 1993-1996; elected \r', 'as a Democrat to the One Hundred Fifth and to the six succeeding Congresses \r', '(January 3, 1997-January 3, 2011); was not a candidate for reelection to the \r', 'One Hundred Twelfth Congress in 2010.\r']

Name: BIGGERT, Judy Borg
Bio: [' a Representative from Illinois; born in Chicago, Cook County, Ill., \r', 'August 15, 1937; attended New Trier High School, Winnetka, Ill.; B.A., Stanford \r', 'University, Stanford, Calif., 1959; J.D., Northwestern University School of \r', 'Law, Evanston, Ill., 1963; clerk to Judge Luther M. Swygert, U.S. Court of \r', 'Appeals, 7th Circuit, 1963-1964; president, board of education, Hinsdale \r', 'Township High School district 86, Hinsdale Township, Ill., 1983-1986; member, \r', 'Illinois state house of representatives, 1993-1998; elected as a Republican to \r', 'the One Hundred Sixth and to the six succeeding Congresses (January 3, \r', '1999-January 3, 2013); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One Hundred \r', 'Thirteenth Congress in 2012.\r']

Name: BILIRAKIS, Michael
Bio: [' (father of Gus Bilirakis), \r', 'a Representative from Florida; born in Tarpon Springs, Pinellas \r', 'County, Fla., July 16, 1930; attended public schools in Clairton, Pa.; \r', 'graduated from Douglas Business College, McKeesport, Pa., 1949; B.S., \r', 'University of Pittsburgh, Pittsburgh, Pa., 1959; attended George Washington \r', 'University, Washington, D.C., 1960; J.D., University of Florida, Gainesville, \r', 'Fla., 1963; United States Air Force, 1950-1954; steelworker; engineer; college \r', 'instructor; lawyer, private practice; municipal judge, city of Tarpon Springs, \r', 'Fla., and city of New Port Richey, Fla.; elected as a Republican to the \r', 'Ninety-eighth and to the eleven succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1983-January \r', '3, 2007); not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Tenth Congress in \r', '2006. \r']

Name: BISHOP, Sanford Dixon, Jr.
Bio: ['a Representative from Georgia; born in Mobile, Mobile County, Ala., \r', 'February 4, 1947; graduated from Central High School, Mobile, Ala., 1964; B.A., \r', 'Morehouse College, Atlanta, Ga., 1968; J.D., Emory University, \r', 'Atlanta, Ga., 1971; lawyer, private practice; United States Army, 1969-1971; \r', 'member of the Georgia state house of representatives, 1977-1991; member of the \r', 'Georgia state senate, 1991-1993; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Third \r', 'and to the twelve succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1993-present).\r']

Name: BLAGOJEVICH, Rod R.
Bio: ['a Representative from Illinois; born in Chicago, Cook County, Ill., \r', 'December 10, 1956; attended Foreman High School, Chicago, Ill.; B.A., \r', 'Northwestern University, Evanston, Ill., 1979; J.D., Pepperdine University, \r', 'Malibu, Calif., 1983; lawyer, private practice; Assistant State’s Attorney, \r', 'Cook County, Ill., 1986-1988; member of the Illinois state house of \r', 'representatives, 1993-1996; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Fifth and \r', 'to the two succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1997-January 3, 2003); not a \r', 'candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Eighth Congress in 2002.; Governor \r', 'of Illinois, 2003-2009; impeached on January 9, 2009, by the Illinois house of \r', 'representatives and subsequently removed from office by the decision of the \r', 'Illinois state senate on January 29, 2009. \r']

Name: BLUMENAUER, Earl
Bio: ['a Representative from Oregon; born in Portland, Multnomah County, \r', 'Oreg., August 16, 1948; graduated from Centennial High School, Portland, Oreg., \r', '1966; B.A., Lewis and Clark College, Portland, Oreg., 1970; J.D., Lewis and \r', 'Clark Law School, Portland, Oreg., 1976; assistant to the president of Portland \r', 'State University, Portland, Oreg., 1970-1977; member of the Oregon state house \r', 'of representatives, 1973-1978; member of the board of directors, Portland \r', 'Community College, 1975-1981; Multnomah County, Oreg., commissioner, 1978-1985; \r', 'Portland, Oreg., city commissioner, 1986-1996; served on the Governor’s \r', 'commission on higher education, 1990-1991; elected as a Democrat, by special \r', 'election, to the One Hundred Fourth Congress to fill the vacancy caused by the \r', 'resignation of United States Representative Ronald Lee Wyden, and reelected to \r', 'the eleven succeeding Congresses (May 21, 1996-present). \r']

Name: BLUNT, Roy
Bio: ['a Senator and a Representative from Missouri; born in Niangua, \r', 'Webster County, Mo., January 10, 1950; graduated Southwest Baptist University, \r', 'Bolivar, Mo., B.A., 1970; graduated Missouri State University, Springfield, \r', 'Mo., M.A., 1972; high school history teacher; clerk and chief election officer, \r', 'Greene County, Mo. 1973-1984; Missouri state secretary of state 1984-1993; \r', 'president, Southwest Baptist University, Bolivar, Mo. 1993-1996; elected as a \r', 'Republican to the One Hundred Fifth and to the six succeeding Congresses \r', '(January 3, 1997-January 3, 2011); majority whip (One Hundred Eighth through \r', 'One Hundred Ninth Congresses); acting majority leader (One Hundred Ninth \r', 'Congress, September 28, 2005-February 2, 2006); minority whip (One Hundred \r', 'Tenth Congress); was not a candidate for reelection to the House of \r', 'Representatives but was elected as a Republican to the United States Senate in \r', '2010; reelected in 2016  for the term ending January 3, 2023; vice-chair, Republican Conference \r', '(2012-); chair, Committee on Rules and Administration (One Hundred Fourteenth \r', 'Congress, One Hundred Fifteenth Congress [January 3, 2017-January 20, 2017]). \r']

Name: BOEHLERT, Sherwood Louis
Bio: ['a Representative from New York; born in Utica, Oneida County, N.Y., \r', 'September 28, 1936; B.A., Utica College, Utica, N.Y., 1961; United States Army, \r', '1956-1958; staff for United States Representative Alexander Pirnie of New York, \r', '1964-1979; elected, county executive, Oneida County, N.Y., 1979-1982; delegate, \r', 'New York state Republican convention, 1980; delegate, Republican National \r', 'Convention, 1980; elected as a Republican to the Ninety-eighth and to the \r', 'eleven succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1983-January 3, 2007); chair, \r', 'Committee on Science (One Hundred Seventh through One Hundred Ninth \r', 'Congresses); not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Tenth Congress \r', 'in 2006.\r']

Name: BOEHNER, John Andrew
Bio: ['a Representative from Ohio; born in Cincinnati, Hamilton County, Ohio, November 17, 1949; graduated from Moeller High School, Cincinnati, Ohio, 1968; B.S., Xavier University, Cincinnati, Ohio, 1977; United States Navy, 1968; businessman; business executive; member of the Union Township, Ohio, board of trustees, 1981, and president, 1984; member of the Ohio state house of representatives, 1985-1990; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Second and to the twelve succeeding Congresses, and served until his resignation on October 31, 2015 (January 3, 1991-October 31, 2015); House Republican Conference Chairman, 1995-1999; chair, Committee on Education and the Workforce (One Hundred Seventh through One Hundred Ninth Congresses); majority leader (One Hundred Ninth Congress); minority leader (One Hundred Tenth and One Hundred Eleventh Congress); Speaker of the House (One Hundred Twelfth through One Hundred Fourteenth Congresses). \r']

Name: BONILLA, Henry
Bio:
['a Representative from Texas; born in San Antonio, Bexar County, \r', 'Tex., January 2, 1954; graduated from South San Antonio High School, San \r', 'Antonio, Tex., 1972; B.J., University of Texas, Austin, Tex., 1976; journalist; \r', 'broadcasting executive; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Third and to \r', 'the six succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1993-January 3, 2007); unsuccessful \r', 'candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Tenth Congress. \r', '


\r', '

Bibliography

”Henry Bonilla” in \r', 'Hispanic Americans in Congress, 1822-2012. Prepared under the \r', 'direction of the Committee on House Administration by the Office of the \r', 'Historian and the Office of the Clerk, U.S. House of Representatives. \r', 'Washington: Government Printing Office, 2013.\r']

Name: BONIOR, David Edward
Bio: ['a Representative from Michigan; born in Detroit, Wayne County, \r', 'Mich., June 6, 1945; graduated from Notre Dame High School, Pontiac, Mich., \r', '1963; B.A., University of Iowa, Iowa City, 1967; M.A., Chapman College, Orange, \r', 'Calif., 1972; United States Air Force, 1968-1972; member of the Michigan state \r', 'house of representatives, 1973-1977; delegate to the Michigan state Democratic \r', 'conventions, 1972-1977; elected as a Democrat to the Ninety-fifth and to the \r', 'twelve succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1977-January 3, 2003); majority whip \r', '(One Hundred Second and One Hundred Third Congresses); minority whip (One \r', 'Hundred Fourth through One Hundred Seventh Congresses); not a candidate for \r', 'reelection to the One Hundred Eighth Congress in 2002, but was an unsuccessful \r', 'candidate for nomination for Governor of Michigan. \r']

Name: BONO, Mary
Bio: [' (wife of Sonny Bono and Connie Mack IV, daughter-in-law of Connie \r', 'Mack III, elected under the name Mary Bono Mack in the One Hundred Eleventh and \r', 'one succeeding Congress), \r', 'a Representative from California; born Mary Whitaker in Cleveland, \r', 'Cuyahoga County, Ohio, October 24, 1961; B.A., University of Southern \r', 'California, Los Angeles, Calif.; restaurant business manager; personal fitness \r', 'instructor; board of the Palm Springs, Calif., International Film Festival; \r', 'elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Fifth Congress, by special election \r', 'to fill the vacancy caused by the death of her husband, United States \r', 'Representative Sonny Bono, reelected to the seven succeeding Congresses (April \r', '7, 1998-January 3, 2013); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One \r', 'Hundred Thirteenth Congress in 2012.\r']

Name: BOOZMAN, John
Bio: ['a Senator and a Representative from Arkansas; born in Shreveport, \r', 'La., December 10, 1950; graduated from Northside High School, Fort Smith, Ark.; \r', 'attended the University of Arkansas, Fayetteville, Ark., 1969-1972; graduated \r', 'Southern College of Optometry, 1977; optometrist; business owner; rancher; \r', 'member of the Rogers, Ark., school board; elected as a Republican to the One \r', 'Hundred Seventh Congress by special election to fill the vacancy caused by the \r', 'resignation of United States Representative Asa Hutchinson; reelected to the \r', 'four succeeding Congresses (November 20, 2001-January 3, 2011); was not a \r', 'candidate for reelection to the House of Representatives but was elected as a \r', 'Republican to the United States Senate in 2010; reelected in 2016  for the term ending January 3, \r', '2023.\r']

Name: BORSKI, Robert Anthony, Jr.
Bio: ['a Representative from Pennsylvania;  born in Philadelphia, Philadelphia County, Pa., \r', 'October 20, 1948;  graduated from Frankford High School, Philadelphia, Pa., 1966;  B.A., University \r', 'of Baltimore, Baltimore, Md., 1971;  stockbroker;  member of the Pennsylvania state house of \r', 'representatives, 1976-1982;  elected as a Democrat to the Ninety-eighth and to the nine succeeding \r', 'Congresses (January 3, 1983-January 3, 2003);  not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred \r', 'Eighth Congress in 2002. \r']

Name: BOSWELL, Leonard L.
Bio: ["a Representative from Iowa; born in Harrison County, Mo., January 10, 1934; graduated from Lamoni High School, Lamoni, Iowa, 1952; B.A., Graceland College, Lamoni, Iowa, 1969; United States Army, 1956-1976; farmer; board of directors of the local farmer's cooperative, 1979-1993, president for thirteen years; member of the Iowa state senate, 1984-1996, president, 1992-1996; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Fifth and to the seven succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1997-January 3, 2013); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Thirteenth Congress in 2012; died on August 17, 2018, in Des Moines, Iowa. \r"]

Name: BOUCHER, Frederick C.
Bio: ['a Representative from Virginia; born in Washington County, Va., \r', 'August 1, 1946; graduated from Abingdon High School, Abingdon, Va., 1964; B.A., \r', 'Roanoke College, Salem, Va., 1968; J.D., University of Virginia School of Law, \r', 'Charlottesville, Va., 1971; lawyer, private practice; member of the Virginia \r', 'state senate, 1974-1983; elected as a Democrat to the Ninety-eighth and to the \r', 'thirteen succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1983-January 3, 2011); unsuccessful \r', 'candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Twelfth Congress in 2010. \r']

Name: BOYD, F. Allen, Jr.
Bio: ['a Representative from Florida; born in Valdosta, Lowndes County, \r', 'Ga., June 6, 1945; graduated from Jefferson County High School, Monticello, \r', 'Fla., 1963; B.S., Florida State University, Tallahassee, Fla., 1969; United \r', 'States Army, 1969-1971; farmer; member of the Florida state house of \r', 'representatives, 1989-1996; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Fifth and \r', 'to the six succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1997-January 3, 2011); \r', 'unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Twelfth Congress in \r', '2010.\r']

Name: BRADY, Kevin Patrick
Bio: ['a Representative from Texas; born in Vermillion, Clay County, S. \r', 'Dak., April 11, 1955; graduated from Rapid City Central High School, Rapid \r', 'City, S. Dak; B.A., University of South Dakota, Vermillion, S. Dak., 1990; \r', 'member of the Texas state house of representatives, 1990-1996; elected as a \r', 'Republican to the One Hundred Fifth and to the ten succeeding Congresses \r', '(January 3, 1997-present); chair, Joint Economic Committee (One Hundred \r', 'Thirteenth Congress); chair, Committee on Ways & Means (One Hundred \r', 'Fourteenth and One Hundred Fifteenth Congresses); chair, Joint Committee on \r', 'Taxation (One Hundred Fifteenth Congress).\r']

Name: BRADY, Robert A.
Bio: ['a Representative from Pennsylvania; born in Philadelphia, \r', 'Philadelphia County, Pa., April 7, 1945; graduated from St. Thomas More High \r', 'School, Philadelphia, Pa., 1963; union official; sergeant-at-arms, \r', 'Philadelphia, Pa., city council, 1975-1983; chairman, Philadelphia, Pa., \r', 'Democratic Party; member of the Pennsylvania Democratic state committee and \r', 'Democratic National Committee; member of the Pennsylvania turnpike commission, \r', '1991-1998; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Fifth Congress, by special \r', 'election, to fill the vacancy caused by the resignation of United States \r', 'Representative Thomas Foglietta, and reelected to the ten succeeding Congresses \r', '(May 19, 1998-present);chair, Committee on House Administration (One Hundred \r', 'Tenth and One Hundred Eleventh Congresses).\r']

Name: BROWN, Corrine
Bio: ['a Representative from Florida; born in Jacksonville, St. John \r', 'County, Fla., November 11, 1946; B.S., Florida Agricultural and Mechanical \r', 'University, Tallahassee, Fla., 1969; M.A., Florida Agricultural and Mechanical \r', 'University, Tallahassee, Fla., 1971; Ed.S., University of Florida, Gainesville, \r', 'Fla., 1974; faculty, University of Florida, Gainesville, Fla., Edward Waters \r', 'College, Jacksonville, Fla., and Florida Community College, Jacksonville, Fla.; \r', 'member of the Florida state house of representatives, 1983-1993; elected as a \r', 'Democrat to the One Hundred Third and to the eleven succeeding Congresses \r', '(January 3, 1993-January 3, 2017); unsuccessful candidate for renomination to the \r', 'One Hundred Fifteenth Congress in 2016. \r']

Name: BROWN, Henry Edward, Jr.
Bio: [' a Representative from South Carolina; born in Bishopville, Lee \r', 'County, S.C., December 20, 1935; graduated from Berkeley High School, Moncks \r', 'Corner, S.C., 1953; attended Baptist College (now Charleston Southern \r', 'University), Charleston, S.C.; attended The Citadel, Charleston, S.C.; South \r', 'Carolina National Guard, 1953-1962; business executive; member of the South \r', 'Carolina state general assembly, 1985-2000; member of the Hanahan, S.C., city \r', 'council, 1996-2000; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Seventh and to \r', 'the four succeeding Congresses (January 3, 2001-January 3, 2011); was not a \r', 'candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Twelfth Congress in 2010. \r']

Name: BROWN, Sherrod
Bio: ['a Senator and a Representative from Ohio; born in Mansfield, \r', 'Richland County, Ohio, November 9, 1952; B.A., Yale University, New Haven, \r', 'Conn., 1974; M.A., Ohio State University, Ohio, 1981; member of the faculty, \r', 'Ohio State University, Mansfield, Ohio, 1979-1981; member of the Ohio State \r', 'house of representatives, 1975-1982; Ohio secretary of state, 1983-1991; \r', 'elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Third and to the six succeeding \r', 'Congresses (January 3, 1993-January 3, 2007); not a candidate for reelection to \r', 'the House of Representatives but was elected as a Democrat to the United States \r', 'Senate in 2006; reelected in 2012 for the term ending January 3, \r', '2019.\r']

Name: BRYANT, Ed
Bio: ['a Representative from Tennessee; born in Jackson, Cooksville County, Tenn.,  \r', 'September 7, 1948;  graduated from Jackson High School, Jackson, Tenn.;  B.A., University of \r', 'Mississippi, University, Miss., 1970;  J.D., University of Mississippi, University, Miss., 1972;  United \r', 'States Army Reserve Officers Training Corps, 1970;  United States Army, 1970-1978; faculty, United \r', 'States Military Academy, West Point, N.Y., 1977-1978; United States Attorney for the Western \r', 'District of Tennessee, 1991-1993;  elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Fourth and to the \r', 'three succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1995-January 3, 2003); one of the managers appointed by \r', 'the House of Representatives in 1998 to conduct the impeachment proceedings of President William \r', 'Jefferson Clinton;  not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Eighth Congress in 2002, but was \r', 'an unsuccessful candidate for nomination to the United States Senate. \r']

Name: BURR, Richard M.
Bio: ['a Senator and a Representative from North Carolina; born in \r', 'Charlottesville, Albemarle County, Va., November 30, 1955; graduated from \r', 'Reynolds High School, Winston-Salem, N.C., 1974; B.A., Wake Forest University, \r', 'Winston-Salem, N.C., 1978; unsuccessful candidate for election to the One \r', 'Hundred Third Congress in 1992; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred \r', 'Fourth and to the four succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1995-January 3, 2005); \r', 'was not a candidate for reelection to the House of Representatives, but was \r', 'elected to the United States Senate in 2004; reelected in 2010, and again in 2016 for the term \r', 'ending January 3, 2023; chair, Select Committee on Intelligence (One Hundred \r', 'Fourteenth and One Hundred Fifteenth Congresses). \r']

Name: BURTON, Danny Lee
Bio: ['a Representative from Indiana; born in Indianapolis, Marion County, \r', 'Ind., June 21, 1938; graduated from Shortridge High School, Indianapolis, Ind., \r', '1957; attended Indiana University, Indianapolis, Ind., 1958; Cincinnati Bible \r', 'College, Cincinnati, Ohio, 1959-1960; United States Army and United States Army \r', 'reserve, 1957-1962; businessman; member of the Indiana state house of \r', 'representatives, 1967-1968 and 1977-1980; member of the Indiana state senate, \r', '1969-1970 and 1981-1982; unsuccessful candidate for the United States Congress \r', 'in 1970; elected as a Republican to the Ninety-eighth and to the fourteen \r', 'succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1983-January 3, 2013); chair, Committee on \r', 'Government Reform and Oversight (One Hundred Fifth Congress); chair, Committee \r', 'on Government Reform (One Hundred Sixth and One Hundred Seventh Congresses); \r', 'was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Thirteenth Congress in \r', '2012.\r']

Name: BUYER, Stephen Earle
Bio: ['a Representative from Indiana; born in Rensselaer, Jasper County, \r', 'Ind., November 26, 1958; graduated from North White High School, Monon, Ind., \r', '1976; B.S., The Citadel, Charlestown, S.C., 1980; J.D., Valparaiso University \r', 'School of Law, Valparaiso, Ind., 1984; lawyer, private practice; United States \r', 'Army, 1984-1987; United States Army Reserve, 1980-2010; Indiana state deputy \r', 'attorney general, 1987-1988; legal counsel for the 22nd Theater Army in \r', 'Operation Desert Shield and Desert Storm; elected as a Republican to the One \r', 'Hundred Third and to the eight succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1993-January \r', '3, 2011); one of the managers appointed by the House of Representatives in 1998 \r', 'to conduct the impeachment proceedings of President William Jefferson Clinton; \r', 'chair, Committee on Veterans’ Affairs (One Hundred Ninth Congress); not a \r', 'candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Twelfth Congress in \r', '2010.\r']

Name: CALLAHAN, Herbert Leon (Sonny)
Bio: ['a Representative from Alabama; born in Mobile, Mobile County, Ala., \r', 'September 11, 1932; graduated from McGill Institute High School, Mobile, Ala., \r', '1950; attended the University of Alabama, Mobile, Ala., 1959-1960; United \r', 'States Navy, 1952-1954; businessman; member of the Alabama state house of \r', 'representatives, 1971-1979; member of the Alabama state senate, 1979-1983; \r', 'unsuccessful candidate for the Democratic nomination for lieutenant governor in \r', '1982; elected as a Republican to the Ninety-ninth and to the eight succeeding \r', 'Congresses (January 3, 1985-January 3, 2003); not a candidate for reelection to \r', 'the One Hundred Eighth Congress in 2002. \r']

Name: CALVERT, Ken
Bio: ['a Representative from California; born in Corona, Riverside County, \r', 'Calif., June 8, 1953; graduated from Corona High School, Corona, Calif., 1971; \r', 'A.A., Chaffey College, Rancho Cucamonga, Calif., 1973; B.A., San Diego State \r', 'University, San Diego, Calif., 1975; restaurant manager; business owner; \r', 'unsuccessful candidate for nomination to the Ninety-eighth Congress in 1982; \r', 'chair, Riverside County, Calif., Republican Party, 1984-1988; elected as a \r', 'Republican to the One Hundred Third and to the twelve succeeding Congresses \r', '(January 3, 1993-present). \r']

Name: CAMP, David Lee
Bio: ['a Representative from Michigan; born in Midland, Midland County, Mich., July 9, 1953; graduated from Midland Dow High School, Midland, Mich., 1971; attended the University of Sussex, Brighton, England, 1973-1974; B.A., Albion College, Albion, Mich., 1975; J.D., University of San Diego School of Law, San Diego, Calif., 1978; member of the Midland County, Mich., board of canvassers; member of the Midland County, Mich., Republican executive committee; special assistant attorney general, Michigan state attorney general, 1980-1984; staff, United States Representative Bill Schuette of Michigan, 1984-1987; member of the Michigan state house of representatives, 1989-1990; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Second and to the eleven succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1991-January 3, 2015); was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Fourteenth Congress in 2014; chair, Committee on Ways and Means (One Hundred Twelfth and One Hundred Thirteenth Congresses); chair, Joint Committee on Taxation (One Hundred Thirteenth Congress). \r']

Name: CANNON, Christopher B.
Bio: ['a Representative from Utah; born in Salt Lake City, Salt Lake \r', 'County, Utah, October 20, 1950; B.S., Brigham Young University, Provo, Utah, \r', '1974; attended Harvard School of Business, Cambridge, Mass., 1974-1975; J.D., \r', 'Brigham Young University, Provo, Utah, 1980; lawyer, private practice; \r', 'solicitor, Department of Interior, 1983-1986; business owner; business \r', 'executive; Utah Republican Party finance chairman, 1992-1994; elected as a \r', 'Republican to the One Hundred Fifth and to the five succeeding Congresses \r', '(January 3, 1997-January 3, 2009); one of the managers appointed by the House \r', 'of Representatives in 1998 to conduct the impeachment proceedings of President \r', 'William Jefferson Clinton; unsuccessful candidate for nomination to the One \r', 'Hundred Eleventh Congress in 2008. \r']

Name: CANTOR, Eric
Bio: ['a Representative from Virginia; born in Richmond, Henrico County, \r', 'Va., June 6, 1963; B.A., George Washington University, Washington, D.C., 1985; \r', 'J.D., College of William and Mary, Williamsburg, Va., 1988; M.S., Columbia \r', 'University, New York, N.Y., 1989; lawyer; small businessman; member of the \r', 'Virginia state house of delegates, 1992-2001; elected as a Republican to the \r', 'One Hundred Seventh and to the six succeeding Congresses until his resignation \r', 'on August 18, 2014 (January 3, 2001-August 18, 2014); unsuccessful candidate \r', 'for renomination to the One Hundred Fourteenth Congress in 2014; minority whip \r', '(One Hundred Eleventh Congress); majority leader (One Hundred Twelfth and One \r', 'Hundred Thirteenth Congresses).\r']

Name: CAPITO, Shelley Moore
Bio: [' (daughter of Arch Alfred Moore, Jr.), \r', 'a Senator and a Representative from West Virginia; born in Glendale, \r', 'Marshall County, W.Va., November 26, 1953; B.S., Duke University, Durham, N.C., \r', '1975; M.Ed., University of Virginia, Charlottesville, Va., 1976; college \r', 'counselor; member, West Virginia state house of representatives, 1997-2001; \r', 'elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Seventh and to the six succeeding \r', 'Congresses (January 3, 2001-January 3, 2015); was not a candidate for \r', 'reelection to the House of Representatives but was elected as a Republican to \r', 'the United States Senate in 2014 for the term ending January 3, \r', '2021.\r']

Name: CAPPS, Lois
Bio: [' (wife of Walter Capps), \r', 'a Representative from California; born in Ladysmith, Rusk County, \r', 'Wis., January 10, 1938; graduated from Flathead County High School, Kalispell, \r', 'Mont., 1955; B.S., Pacific Lutheran University, Tacoma, Wash., 1959; M.A., Yale \r', 'University, New Haven, Conn., 1964; M.A., University of California, Santa \r', 'Barbara, Calif., 1990; nursing instructor; nurse administrator, Yale Hospital, \r', 'New Haven, Conn.; director, Teenage Pregnancy and Parenting Project and the \r', 'Parent and Child Enrichment Center, Santa Barbara County, Calif.; instructor, \r', 'Santa Barbara City College, Santa Barbara, Calif.; elected as a Democrat to the \r', 'One Hundred Fifth Congress, by special election, to fill the vacancy caused by \r', 'the death of her husband, United States Representative Walter Capps, and \r', 'reelected to the nine succeeding Congresses (March 10, 1998-January 3, 2017); \r', 'was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Fifteenth Congress in \r', '2016.\r']

Name: CAPUANO, Michael Everett
Bio: ['a Representative from Massachusetts; born in Somerville, Middlesex \r', 'County, Mass., January 9, 1952; graduated from Somerville High School, \r', 'Somerville, Mass., 1969; A.B., Dartmouth College, Hanover, N.H., 1973; J.D., \r', 'Boston College, Chestnut Hill, Mass., 1977; lawyer, private practice; chief \r', 'legal counsel, joint committee on taxation, Massachusetts state legislature, \r', '1978-1984; alderman, Somerville, Mass., 1977-1979; alderman-at-large, \r', 'Somerville, Mass., 1985-1989; Mayor of Somerville, Mass., 1990-1998; Democratic \r', 'state committeeman, 1996; president, Massachusetts Municipal Association, 1998; \r', 'elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Sixth and to the nine succeeding \r', 'Congresses (January 3, 1999-present).\r']

Name: CARDIN, Benjamin Louis
Bio: ['a Senator and a Representative from Maryland; born in Baltimore, \r', 'Md., October 5, 1943; attended public schools; graduated from Baltimore City \r', 'College, Baltimore, Md., 1961; B.A., University of Pittsburgh, Pittsburgh, Pa., \r', '1964; J.D., University of Maryland, Baltimore, Md., 1967; lawyer, private \r', 'practice; member of the Maryland state house of delegates, 1966-1986, speaker, \r', '1979-1986; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundredth and to the nine \r', 'succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1987-January 3, 2007); one of the managers \r', 'appointed by the House of Representatives in 1989 to conduct the impeachment \r', 'proceedings against Walter L. Nixon, judge of the United States District Court \r', 'for the District Court of Mississippi; not a candidate for reelection to the \r', 'House of Representatives but was elected as a Democrat to the United States \r', 'Senate in 2006 for the term commencing January 3, 2007; reelected in 2012 for \r', 'the term ending January 3, 2019.\r']

Name: CARSON, Brad
Bio: ['a Representative from Oklahoma;  born in Winslow, Navajo County, Ariz., March \r', '11, 1967;  B.A., Baylor University, Waco, Tex.;  Rhodes Scholar, M.A., Oxford University, Oxford, \r', 'England;  J.D., University of Oklahoma, Norman, Okla, 1994.; lawyer, private practice;  elected as a \r', 'Democrat to the One Hundred Seventh and to the succeeding Congress (January  3, 2001-January 3, \r', '2005); not a candidate for reelection in 2004, but was an unsuccessful candidate to the United States \r', 'Senate in 2004.\r']

Name: CARSON, Julia May
Bio:
['(grandmother of André Carson) a Representative from Indiana; \r', 'born Julia May Porter in Louisville, Jefferson County, Ky., July 8, 1938; \r', 'graduated from Crispus Attucks High School, Indianapolis, Ind., 1955; attended \r', 'Martin University, Indianapolis, Ind., and Indiana University-Purdue \r', 'University, Fort Wayne, Ind.; secretary, United Auto Workers, Local #550; staff \r', 'assistant, United States Representative Andrew Jacobs, Jr., of Indiana, \r', '1965-1972; member of the Indiana state house of representatives, 1972-1976; \r', 'member of the Indiana state senate, 1976-1990; Indianapolis, Ind., center \r', 'township trustee, 1990-1996; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Fifth and \r', 'to the five succeeding Congresses, served until her death on December 15, 2007 \r', '(January 3, 1997-December 15, 2007); died on December 15, 2007, in \r', 'Indianapolis, Ind.; lay in state in Indiana state capitol in Indianapolis, \r', 'December 21, 2007.\r', '


\r', '

Bibliography

”Julia May Carson” in \r', 'Black Americans in Congress, 1870-2007. Prepared under the \r', 'direction of the Committee on House Administration by the Office of History \r', '& Preservation, U. S. House of Representatives. Washington: Government \r', 'Printing Office, 2008.\r']

Name: CASE, Ed
Bio: ['a Representative from Hawaii; born in Hilo, Territory of Hawaii, \r', 'September 27, 1952; graduated from Hawaii Preparatory High School, Kamuela, \r', 'Hawaii, 1970; B.A., Williams College, Williamstown, Mass., 1975; J.D., \r', 'University of California, San Francisco, Calif., 1981; lawyer, private \r', 'practice; staff member for United States Representative Spark Matsunaga, \r', '1975-1977; staff member for United States Senator Spark Matsunaga, 1977-1978; \r', 'member of the Hawaii state house of representatives, 1994-2002; unsuccessful \r', 'candidate for nomination for Governor of Hawaii in 2002; elected as a Democrat \r', 'to the One Hundred and Seventh Congress, by special election, to fill the \r', 'vacancy caused by the death of United States Representative Patsy Mink, \r', '(November 30, 2002-January 3, 2003); elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred \r', 'Eighth Congress, by special election, to fill the vacancy caused by the death \r', 'of United States Representative Patsy Mink, and reelected to the succeeding \r', 'Congress (January 4, 2003-January 3, 2007); not a candidate for reelection, but \r', 'was an unsuccessful candidate to the United States Senate in 2006; unsuccessful \r', 'candidate for United States House of Representatives in 2010.\r']

Name: CASTLE, Michael Newbold
Bio: ['a Representative from Delaware; born in Wilmington, New Castle \r', 'County, Del., July 2, 1939; graduate of Tower Hill School, Wilmington, Del., \r', '1957; B.S., Hamilton College, Clinton, N.Y., 1961; LL.B., Georgetown University \r', 'School of Law, Washington, D.C., 1964; lawyer, private practice; deputy \r', 'attorney general of Delaware, 1965-1966; member of the Delaware state house of \r', 'representatives, 1966-1967; member of the Delaware state senate, 1968-1976; \r', 'Lieutenant Governor of Delaware, 1981-1985; Governor of Delaware, 1985-1992; \r', 'elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Third and to the eight succeeding \r', 'Congresses (January 3, 1993-January 3, 2011); not a candidate for relection in \r', '2010, but was an unsuccessful nominee to the United States Senate. \r']

Name: CHABOT, Steve
Bio: ['a Representative from Ohio; born in Cincinnati, Hamilton County, \r', 'Ohio, January 22, 1953; graduated from LaSalle High School, Cincinnati, Ohio; \r', 'B.A., College of William and Mary, Williamsburg, Va., 1975; J.D., Salmon P. \r', 'Chase College of Law, Highland Heights, Ky., 1978; teacher, 1975-1976; member \r', 'of the Cincinnati, Ohio, city council, 1985-1990; Hamilton County, Ohio, \r', 'commissioner, 1990-1994; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Fourth and \r', 'to the six succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1995-January 3, 2009); one of the \r', 'managers appointed by the House of Representatives in 1998 to conduct the \r', 'impeachment proceedings of President William Jefferson Clinton; unsuccessful \r', 'candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Eleventh Congress in 2008; elected \r', 'as a Republican to the One Hundred Twelfth and to the three succeeding \r', 'Congresses (January 3, 2011-present); chair, Committee on Small Business (One \r', 'Hundred Fourteenth and One Hundred Fifteenth Congresses).\r']

Name: CHAMBLISS, Saxby
Bio: ['a Senator and a Representative from Georgia; born in Warrenton, \r', 'Warren County, N.C., November 10, 1943; graduated C.E. Byrd High School, \r', 'Shreveport, La.; B.A., University of Georgia, Athens 1966; J.D., University of \r', 'Tennessee College of Law 1968; attorney, Moultrie, Ga.; elected as a Republican \r', 'to the House of Representatives for the One Hundred Fourth and the three \r', 'succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1995-January 3, 2003); not a candidate for \r', 'reelection to the House of Representatives but was elected as a Republican to \r', 'the U.S. Senate in 2002; reelected in 2008, and served from January 3, 2003, to \r', 'January 3, 2015; chair, Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry (One \r', 'Hundred Ninth Congress); was not a candidate for reelection in \r', '2014.\r']

Name: CLAY, William Lacy, Jr.
Bio: ['  (son of William Lacy Clay, Sr.), \r', ' a Representative from Missouri; born in St. Louis, Mo., July 27, \r', '1956; graduated from Springbrook High School, Silver Spring, Md., 1974; B.A., \r', 'University of Maryland, College Park, Md., 1983; member of the Missouri state \r', 'house of representatives, 1983-1991; member of the Missouri state senate, \r', '1991-2001; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Seventh and to the eight \r', 'succeeding Congresses (January 3, 2001-present).\r']

Name: CLAYTON, Eva M.
Bio:
['a Representative from North Carolina; born in Savannah, Chatham \r', 'County, Ga., September 16, 1934; B.S., Johnson C. Smith University, Charlotte, \r', 'N.C., 1955; M.S., North Carolina Central University, Durham, N.C., 1962; \r', 'director, University of North Carolina Health Manpower Development Programs; \r', 'assistant secretary for community development, North Carolina Department of \r', 'Natural Resources and Community Development, 1977-1981; unsuccessful candidate \r', 'for nomination to the Ninety-first Congress in 1968; chair of the Warren \r', 'County, N.C., board of commissioners, 1982-1992; elected as a Democrat to the \r', 'One Hundred Second Congress, by special election, to fill the vacancy caused by \r', 'the death of United States Representative Walter B. Jones, and reelected to the \r', 'four succeeding Congresses (November 3, 1992-January 3, 2003); not a candidate \r', 'for reelection to the One Hundred Eighth Congress in 2002. \r', '


\r', '

Bibliography

”Eva M. Clayton” in \r', 'Black Americans in Congress, 1870-2007. Prepared under the \r', 'direction of the Committee on House Administration by the Office of History \r', '& Preservation, U. S. House of Representatives. Washington: Government \r', 'Printing Office, 2008.\r']

Name: CLEMENT, Robert Nelson
Bio: ['a Representative from Tennessee; born in Nashville, Davidson County, \r', 'Tenn., September 23, 1943; graduated from Hillsboro High School, Nashville, \r', 'Tenn., 1962; B.S., University of Tennessee, Knoxville, Tenn., 1967; M.B.A., \r', 'Memphis State University (University of Memphis), Memphis, Tenn., 1968; \r', 'Tennessee Army National Guard, 1969-1971; Army National Guard Reserve, \r', '1971-2001, retired as a colonel; member of the Tennessee Public Service \r', 'Commission, 1973-1979; unsuccessful candidate for nomination for Governor of \r', 'Tennessee in 1978; member, board of directors, Tennessee Valley Authority, \r', '1979-1981; unsuccessful candidate for election to the Ninety-eighth Congress in \r', '1982; president, Cumberland University, Lebanon, Tenn., 1983-1987; elected as a \r', 'Democrat to the One Hundredth Congress, by special election, to fill the \r', 'vacancy caused by the resignation of United States Representative William Hill \r', 'Boner, and reelected to the One Hundred First and to the six succeeding \r', 'Congresses (January 19, 1988-January 3, 2003); not a candidate for reelection \r', 'to the One Hundred Eighth Congress in 2002, but was an unsuccessful candidate \r', 'to the United States Senate. \r']

Name: CLYBURN, James Enos
Bio: [' (relative of George Washington Murray), \r', 'a Representative from South Carolina; born in Sumter, Sumter County, \r', 'S.C., July 21, 1940; graduated from Mather Academy, Camden, S.C., 1957; B.S., \r', 'South Carolina State University, Orangeburg, S.C., 1961; teacher; employment \r', 'counselor, South Carolina state employment security commission, 1965-1966; \r', 'director, Charleston County, S.C., neighborhood youth corps and new careers \r', 'projects, 1966-1968; executive director, South Carolina state commission for \r', 'farm workers, 1968-1971; staff, Governor John C. West of South Carolina, \r', '1971-1974; South Carolina human affairs commissioner, 1974-1992; elected as a \r', 'Democrat to the One Hundred Third and to the twelve succeeding Congresses \r', '(January 3, 1993-present); chair, House Democratic Caucus (One Hundred Ninth \r', 'Congress); majority whip (One Hundred Tenth and One Hundred Eleventh \r', 'Congresses); assistant Democratic leader (One Hundred Twelfth through One \r', 'Hundred Fifteenth Congresses).\r']

Name: COBLE, Howard
Bio: ['a Representative from North Carolina; born in Greensboro, Guilford \r', 'County, N.C., March 18, 1931; attended Appalachian State University, Boone, \r', 'N.C., 1949-1950; A.B., Guilford College, Greensboro, N.C., 1958; J.D., \r', 'University of North Carolina School of Law, Chapel Hill, 1962; United States \r', 'Coast Guard, 1952-1956, 1977-1978; United States Coast Guard Reserve, \r', '1960-1982; admitted to the North Carolina state bar, 1966; member of the North \r', 'Carolina state house of representatives, 1969, and 1979-1983; assistant \r', 'attorney, United States Attorney for the Middle District of North Carolina, \r', '1969-1973; secretary of the North Carolina Department of Revenue, 1973-1977; \r', 'elected as a Republican to the Ninety-ninth and to the fourteen succeeding \r', 'Congresses (January 3, 1985-January 3, 2015); was not a candidate for \r', 'renomination to the One Hundred Fourteenth Congress in 2014; died on November \r', '3, 2015, in Greensboro, N.C. \r']

Name: COLLINS, Michael Allen (Mac)
Bio: ['a Representative from Georgia; born in Jackson, Butts County, Ga., October 15, 1944; attended public schools; Georgia National Guard, 1964-1970; business owner; chair, Butts County, Ga., commission, 1977-1981; member of the Georgia state senate, 1989-1993; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Third and to the five succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1993-January 3, 2005); not a candidate for reelection in 2004, but was an unsuccessful candidate for nomination to the United States Senate in 2004; died on November 20, 2018 in Flovilla, Ga.; interment in Milner, Ga.  \r']

Name: COMBEST, Larry Ed
Bio: ['a Representative from Texas; born in Memphis, Hall County, Tex., \r', 'March 20, 1945; West Texas State University, Canyon, Tex., 1969; farmer; \r', 'director, Agriculture Stabilization and Conservation Service of the United \r', 'States Department of Agriculture, 1971; legislative assistant to United States \r', 'Senator John Tower of Texas, 1971-1978; business owner; elected as a Republican \r', 'to the Ninety-ninth and to the nine succeeding Congresses, and served until his \r', 'resignation on May 31, 2003 (January 3, 1985-May 31, 2003); chair, Select \r', 'Committee on Intelligence (One Hundred Fourth Congress); chair, Committee on \r', 'Agriculture (One Hundred Sixth and One Hundred Seventh Congresses). \r']

Name: CONDIT, Gary Adrian
Bio: ['a Representative from California; born in Salina, Mayes County, \r', 'Okla., April 21, 1948; A.A., Modesto Junior College, Modesto, Calif., 1970; \r', 'B.A., California State College, Stanislaus, Calif., 1972; Ceres, Calif., city \r', 'council, 1972-1976; mayor of Ceres, Calif., 1974-1976; member of the Stanislaus \r', 'County, Calif., board of supervisors, 1976-1982; member of the California state \r', 'assembly, 1982-1989; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred First Congress by \r', 'special election to fill the vacancy caused by the resignation of United States \r', 'Representative Anthony L. Coelho, and reelected to the six succeeding \r', 'Congresses (September 12, 1989-January 3, 2003); unsuccessful candidate for \r', 'nomination to the One Hundred Eighth Congress in 2002. \r']

Name: CONYERS, John, Jr.
Bio: ['a Representative from Michigan; born in Detroit, Wayne County, \r', 'Mich., May 16, 1929; attended Detroit public schools; B.A., Wayne State \r', 'University, Detroit, Mich., 1957; LL.B., Wayne State Law School, Detroit, \r', 'Mich., 1958; lawyer, private practice; Michigan National Guard, 1948-1950; \r', 'United States Army, 1950-1954; United States Army Reserve, 1954-1957; staff, \r', 'United States Representative John D. Dingell, Jr., of Michigan, 1958-1961; \r', 'general counsel for three labor locals in Detroit, 1959-1964; executive board \r', 'member, Detroit, Mich., American Civil Liberties Union, 1964 to present; \r', 'executive board member, Detroit, Mich., NAACP, 1963 to present; referee for \r', 'Michigan workmen’s compensation department, 1961-1963; elected as a \r', 'Democrat to the Eighty-ninth and to the twenty-six succeeding Congresses \r', 'until his resignation on December 5, 2017 (January 3, 1965-December 5, 2017); one of the managers appointed by the House of \r', 'Representatives in 1988 to conduct the impeachment proceedings against Alcee \r', 'Lamar Hastings, judge of the United States District Court for the Southern \r', 'District of Florida; chairman, Committee on Government Operations (One Hundred \r', 'First through One Hundred Third Congresses); chairman, Committee on the \r', 'Judiciary (One Hundred Tenth and One Hundred Eleventh Congresses).\r']

Name: COOKSEY, John
Bio: ['a Representative from Louisiana; born in Alexandria, Rapides Parish, \r', 'La., August 20, 1941; graduated from LaSalle High School, Olla, La.; B.S., \r', 'Louisiana State University, Baton Rouge, La.,1962; M.D., Louisiana State \r', 'University, Baton Rouge, La., 1966; M.B.A., University of Texas, Austin, \r', 'Tex.,1994; United States Air Force, 1967-1969; Louisiana Air National Guard, \r', '1970-1971; physician; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Fifth and to \r', 'the two succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1997-January 3, 2003); was not a \r', 'candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Eighth Congress in 2002, but was an \r', 'unsuccessful candidate for nomination to the United States Senate; is a \r', 'resident of Monroe, La. \r']

Name: COSTELLO, Jerry Francis
Bio: ['a Representative from Illinois; born in East St. Louis, St. Clair \r', 'County, Ill., September 25, 1949; graduated from Assumption High School, East \r', 'St. Louis, Ill., 1968; A.A., Belleville Area College, Belleville, Ill.; B.A., \r', 'Maryville College of the Sacred Heart, St. Louis, Mo.; county bailiff, Illinois \r', '20th judicial circuit; deputy sheriff, St. Clair County, Ill.; director, court \r', 'services and probation, Illinois 20th judicial district; chief investigator, \r', 'Illinois state attorney’s office, St. Clair County, Ill.; chairman, St. Clair \r', 'County, Ill., board, 1980-1988; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundredth \r', 'Congress, by special election, to fill the vacancy caused by the death of \r', 'United States Representative Charles Melvin Price, and reelected to the twelve \r', 'succeeding Congresses (August 9, 1988-January 3, 2013); was not a candidate for \r', 'reelection to the One Hundred Thirteenth Congress in 2012. \r']

Name: COX, Charles Christopher
Bio: ['a Representative from California; born in St. Paul, Ramsey County, \r', 'Minn., October 16, 1952; attended St. Gregory’s School, St. Paul, Minn., \r', '1957-1966; attended St. Thomas Academy, St. Paul, Minn., 1966-1970; B.A., \r', 'University of Southern California, Los Angeles, Calif.,1973; M.B.A., Harvard \r', 'Business School, Cambridge, Mass., 1977; J.D., Harvard University Law School, \r', 'Cambridge, Mass., 1977; law clerk to Judge Herbert Y.C. Choy, U.S. Court of \r', 'Appeals, Ninth Circuit, 1977-1978; lawyer, private practice; lecturer on \r', 'business administration, Harvard Business School, 1982-1983; co-founder, \r', 'Context Corp., St. Paul, 1984-1986; senior associate counsel to President \r', 'Ronald Reagan, 1986-1988; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred First and \r', 'to the eight succeeding Congresses and served until his resignation on August \r', '2, 2005 (January 3, 1989-August 2, 2005); chair, Select Committee on U.S. \r', 'National Security and Military/Commercial Concerns with the People’s Republic \r', 'of China (One Hundred Fifth and One Hundred Sixth Congresses); chair, Select \r', 'Committee on Homeland Security (One Hundred Eighth Congress); chair, Committee \r', 'on Homeland Security (One Hundred Ninth Congress); chairman, Securities and \r', 'Exchange Commission, 2005 to 2009.\r']

Name: COYNE, William Joseph
Bio: ['a Representative from Pennsylvania; born in Pittsburgh, Allegheny \r', 'County, Pa., August 24, 1936; graduated from Central Catholic High School, \r', 'Pittsburgh, Pa., 1954; B.S., Robert Morris College, Pittsburgh, Pa., 1965; \r', 'United States Army, 1955-1957; accountant; member of the Pennsylvania state \r', 'legislature, 1970-1972; member of the Pittsburgh, Pa., city council, 1974-1980; \r', 'elected as a Democrat to the Ninety-seventh and to the ten succeeding \r', 'Congresses (January 3, 1981-January 3, 2003); not a candidate for reelection to \r', 'the One Hundred Eighth Congress in 2002; died on November 3, 2013, in \r', 'Pittsburgh, Pa.\r']

Name: CRAMER, Robert E. (Bud), Jr.
Bio: ['a Representative from Alabama; born in Huntsville, Madison County, \r', 'Ala., August 22, 1947; graduated from public schools; B.A., University of \r', 'Alabama, 1969; J.D., University of Alabama Law School, 1972; United States \r', 'Army, 1972; United States Army Reserves, 1976-1978; assistant district \r', 'attorney, Madison County, Ala., 1973-1975; lawyer, private practice; district \r', 'attorney of Madison County, Ala., 1981-1990; elected as a Democrat to the One \r', 'Hundred Second and to the eight succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1991-January \r', '3, 2009); was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Eleventh \r', 'Congress in 2008. \r']

Name: CRANE, Philip Miller
Bio: [' (brother of Rep. Daniel Bever Crane), \r', 'a Representative from Illinois; born in Chicago, Cook County, Ill., \r', 'November 3, 1930; attended DePauw University, Greencastle, Ind., University of \r', 'Michigan, and the University of Vienna; B.A., Hillsdale College, Hillsdale, \r', 'Mich., 1952; M.A., Indiana University, Bloomington, Ind., 1961; Ph.D., Indiana \r', 'University, Bloomington, Ind., 1963; United States Army, 1954-1956; faculty, \r', 'Indiana University, Bloomington, Ind., and Bradley University, Peoria, Ill.; \r', 'staff, Republican National Party, 1962; director of research for the Illinois \r', 'Goldwater Organization, 1964; director of schools, Westminster Academy, \r', 'Northbrook, Ill., 1967-1968; staff for Richard Nixon, 1964-1968; director, \r', 'Intercollegiate Studies Institute since 1968; elected as a Republican to the \r', 'Ninety-first Congress by special election to fill the vacancy caused by the \r', 'resignation of United States Representative Donald Rumsfeld; reelected to the \r', 'seventeen succeeding Congresses (November 25, 1969-January 3, 2005); \r', 'unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Ninth Congress in \r', '2004; appointed by President Reagan in1986 to serve on the Commission on the \r', 'Bicentennial of the United States Constitution; died on November 8, 2014, in \r', 'Jefferson, Md. \r']

Name: CRENSHAW, Ander
Bio: ['a Representative from Florida; born in Jacksonville, Duval County, Fla., September 1, 1944; graduated from Robert E. Lee High School, Jacksonville, Fla., 1962; B.A., University of Georgia, Athens, Ga., 1966; J.D., University of Florida, Gainesville, Fla., 1969; member of the Florida state house of representatives, 1972-1978; member of the Florida state senate, 1986-1994; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Seventh and to the seven succeeding Congresses (January 3, 2001-January 3, 2017); was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundredth Fifteenth Congress in 2016. \r']

Name: CROWLEY, Joseph
Bio: [' a Representative from New York; born in New York, New York County, \r', 'N.Y., March 16, 1962; graduated from Power Memorial High School, New York, \r', 'N.Y., 1981; B.A., Queens College, City University of New York, Flushing, N.Y., \r', '1985; member of the New York state assembly, 1986-1998; elected as a Democrat \r', 'to the One Hundred Sixth and to the nine succeeding Congresses (January 3, \r', '1999-present); chair, House Democratic Caucus (One Hundred Fifteenth \r', 'Congress).\r']

Name: CUBIN, Barbara L.
Bio:
['a Representative from Wyoming; born in Salinas, San Benito, Calif., \r', 'November 30, 1946; graduated from Natrona County High School, Casper, Wyo.; \r', 'B.S., Creighton University, Omaha, Nebr., 1969; teacher; social worker; \r', 'chemist; office manager; member of the Wyoming state house of representatives, \r', '1987-1991; member of the Wyoming state senate, 1992-1994; elected as a \r', 'Republican to the One Hundred Fourth and to the six succeeding Congresses \r', '(January 3, 1995-January 3, 2009); was not a candidate for reelection to the \r', 'One Hundred Eleventh Congress in 2008.\r', '

Name: CULBERSON, John
Bio: ['a Representative from Texas; born in Houston, Harris County, Tex., \r', 'August 24, 1956; graduated from Lamar High School, Houston, Tex., 1975; B.A., \r', 'Southern Methodist University, Dallas, Tex., 1981; J.D., South Texas College of \r', 'Law, Houston, Tex.; member of the Texas state house of representatives, \r', '1986-2001; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Seventh and to the eight \r', 'succeeding Congresses (January 3, 2001-present).\r']

Name: CUMMINGS, Elijah Eugene
Bio: ['a Representative from Maryland; born in Baltimore, Md., January 18, \r', '1951; graduated from Baltimore City College High School, Baltimore, Md., 1969; \r', 'B.S., Howard University, Washington, D.C., 1973; J.D., University of Maryland \r', 'School of Law, Baltimore, Md., 1976; lawyer, private practice; chief judge, \r', 'Maryland Moot Court Board; member of the Maryland state house of delegates, \r', '1983-1996, and speaker pro tempore, 1995-1996; elected as a Democrat to the One \r', 'Hundred Fourth Congress, by special election, to fill the vacancy caused by the \r', 'resignation of United States Representative Kweisi Mfume, and reelected to the \r', 'eleven succeeding Congresses (April 16, 1996-present). \r']

Name: CUNNINGHAM, Randall (Duke)
Bio:
['a Representative from California; born in Los Angeles, Los Angeles \r', 'County, Calif., December 8, 1941; B.A., University of Missouri, Columbia, Mo., \r', '1964; M.A., University of Missouri, Columbia, Mo., 1965; M.B.A., National \r', 'University, San Diego, Calif., 1985; United States Navy, 1966-1987; teacher; \r', 'lecturer; businessman; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Second and to \r', 'the seven succeeding Congresses until his resignation on December 1, 2005 \r', '(January 3, 1991-December 1, 2005). \r', '


\r', '

Name: DAVIS, Danny K.

College, Pine Bluff, Ark., 1961; M.S., Chicago \r', 'State University, Chicago, Ill., 1968; Ph.D., Union Institute, Cincinnati, \r', 'Ohio, 1977; clerk, Chicago, Ill., Post Office, 1961-1965; teacher, Chicago, \r', 'Ill., public schools, 1962-1968; executive director, Greater Lawndale \r', 'Conservation Commission, 1969; director of training, Martin L. King \r', 'Neighborhood Health Center, 1969-1971; executive director, Westside Health \r', 'Center, 1975-1981; alderman, Chicago, Ill., city council, 1979-1990; \r', 'commissioner, Cook County, Ill., board, 1990-1996; college professor; \r', 'unsuccessful candidate for election to the United States House of \r', 'Representatives in 1984 and 1986; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred \r', 'Fifth and to the ten succeeding Congresses (January 3, \r', '1997-present).\r']

Name: DAVIS, Jim
Bio: ['a Representative from Florida; born in Tampa, Hillsborough County, \r', 'Fla., October 11, 1957; graduated from Jesuit High School, Tampa, Fla.; B.A., \r', 'Washington and Lee University, Lexington, Va., 1979; J.D., University of \r', 'Florida, Gainesville, Fla., 1982; lawyer, private practice; member of the \r', 'Florida state house of representatives, 1988-1996, majority leader, 1994-1996; \r', 'elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Fifth and to the four succeeding \r', 'Congresses (January 3, 1997-January 3, 2007); not a candidate for reelection, \r', 'but was an unsuccessful candidate for Governor of Florida in 2006. \r']

Name: DAVIS, Jo Ann
Bio:
['a Representative from Virginia; born in Rowan County, N.C., June 29, \r', '1950; attended Hampton Roads Business College, Hampton Roads, Va.; business \r', 'owner; member of the Virginia state general assembly, 1997-2001; elected as a \r', 'Republican to the One Hundred Seventh and to the three succeeding Congresses, \r', '(January 3, 2001-October 6, 2007); died on October 6, 2007, in Gloucester \r', 'County, Va.\r', '


\r', '

Bibliography
