Name: DAVIS, Susan A.
Bio: ['a Representative from California; born in Cambridge, Middlesex \r', 'County, Mass., April 13, 1944; B.A., University of California, Berkeley, \r', 'Calif., 1965; M.S.W., University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill, N.C., 1968; \r', 'member of the San Diego, Calif., board of education, 1983-1992, president, San \r', 'Diego, Calif., board of education 1989-1992; executive director, Aaron Price \r', 'Fellows, 1990-1994; member of the California state assembly, 1994-2000; elected \r', 'as a Democrat to the One Hundred Seventh and to the eight succeeding Congresses \r', '(January 3, 2001-present). \r']

Name: DAVIS, Thomas M., III
Bio: ['a Representative from Virginia; born in Minot, Ward County, N.Dak., \r', 'January 5, 1949; graduated from the United States Capitol Page School; B.A., \r', 'Amherst College, Amherst, Mass., 1971; J.D., University of Virginia, \r', 'Charlottesville, Va., 1975; United States Army, 1971-1972; United States Army \r', 'Reserve, 1972-1979; legislative assistant, Virginia house of delegates; \r', 'business executive; member of the Fairfax County, Va., board of supervisors, \r', '1980-1994; chair, Fairfax County, Va., board of supervisors, 1991-1994; elected \r', 'as a Republican to the One Hundred Fourth and to the five succeeding Congresses \r', 'until his resignation November 24, 2008 (January 3, 1995-November 24, 2008); \r', 'chair, National Republican Congressional Committee (One Hundred Sixth and One \r', 'Hundred Seventh Congresses); chair, Committee on Government Reform (One Hundred \r', 'Eighth and One Hundred Ninth Congresses). \r']

Name: DEAL, John Nathan
Bio: ['a Representative from Georgia; born in Millen, Jenkins County, Ga., \r', 'August 25, 1942; attended public schools in Washington County, Ga.; B.A., \r', 'Mercer University, Macon, Ga., 1964; J.D., Mercer University School of Law, \r', 'Macon, Ga., 1966; United States Army, 1966-1968; lawyer, private practice; \r', 'assistant district attorney, Northeastern Judicial Circuit, 1970-1971; judge of \r', 'the juvenile court of Hall County, Ga., 1971-1972; Hall County, Ga., attorney, \r', '1977-1979; member of the Georgia state senate, 1981-1993; elected as a Democrat \r', 'to the One Hundred Third and to the succeeding Congress, changed his party \r', 'affiliation to Republican on April 10, 1995 (January 3, 1993-April 10, 1995); \r', 'elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Fifth Congress and to the six \r', 'succeeding Congresses until his resignation on March 21, 2010 (January 3, \r', '1997-March 21, 2010); Governor of Georgia, 2011-present. \r']

Name: DeFAZIO, Peter Anthony
Bio: ['a Representative from Oregon; born in Needham, Norfolk County, \r', 'Mass., May 27, 1947; graduated from Needham High School, Needham, Mass., 1965; B.A., Tufts University, Medford, Mass., 1969; M.A., \r', 'University of Oregon, Eugene, Oreg., 1977; United States Air Force Reserve, \r', '1967-1971; staff, United States Representative James Howard Weaver of Oregon, \r', '1977-1982; member of the Lane County, Oreg., board of commissioners, 1983-1986, \r', 'chair, 1985-1986; unsuccessful candidate for nomination to the United States \r', 'Senate in a special primary election in 1995; elected as a Democrat to the One \r', 'Hundredth and to the fifteen succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1987-present). \r']

Name: DeGETTE, Diana
Bio: ['a Representative from Colorado; born in Tachikawa, Japan, July 29, \r', '1957; graduated from South High School, Denver, Colo., 1975; B.A., Colorado \r', 'College, Colorado Springs, Colo., 1979; J.D., New York University, New York, \r', 'N.Y., 1982; member of the Colorado state house of representatives, 1992-1996; \r', 'elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Fifth and to the ten succeeding \r', 'Congresses (January 3, 1997-present). \r']

Name: DELAHUNT, Bill

Name: DeLAURO, Rosa L.

Dodd of Connecticut, 1979-1980; staff, United States \r', 'Senator Christopher J. Dodd of Connecticut, 1981-1987; executive director, \r', 'Countdown ‘87, 1987-1988; executive director, EMILY’S List, \r', '1989-1990; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Second and to the thirteen \r', 'succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1991-present).\r']

Name: DeLAY, Thomas Dale
Bio:
['a Representative from Texas; born in Laredo, Webb County, Tex., \r', 'April 8, 1947; graduated from Calallan High School, Corpus Christi, Tex., 1965; \r', 'attended Baylor University, Waco, Tex., 1967; B.S., University of Houston, \r', 'Houston, Tex., 1970; business owner; member of the Texas state house of \r', 'representatives, 1979-1984; elected as a Republican to the Ninety-ninth and to \r', 'the ten succeeding Congresses until his resignation on June 9, 2006 (January 3, \r', '1985-June 9, 2006); majority whip (One Hundred Fourth Congress to One Hundred \r', 'Seventh Congress); majority leader (One Hundred Eighth and One Hundred Ninth \r', 'Congress). \r', '

Name: DeMINT, James W.

Name: DEUTSCH, Peter R.

Magnuson of Washington, \r', '1968-1976; elected as a Democrat to the Ninety-fifth and to the seventeen \r', 'succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1977-January 3, 2013); was not a candidate \r', 'for reelection to the One Hundred Thirteenth Congress in 2012. \r']

Name: DINGELL, John David, Jr.
Bio: [' (son of John David Dingell and husband of Debbie \r', 'Dingell), \r', 'a Representative from Michigan; born in Colorado Springs, El Paso \r', 'County, Colo., July 8, 1926; attended Capitol Page School, Washington, D.C., \r', 'and Georgetown Preparatory School, Garrett Park, Md.; Page, United States House \r', 'of Representatives, 1938-1943; B.S., Georgetown University, Washington, D.C., \r', '1949; J.D., Georgetown University Law School, Washington, D.C., 1952; United \r', 'States Army, 1944-1946; lawyer, private practice; research assistant, United \r', 'States Circuit Judge Theodore Levin, 1952-1953; assistant prosecuting attorney \r', 'of Wayne County, Mich., 1954-1955; delegate to the Democratic National \r', 'Conventions in 1956, 1960, 1968, 1980 and 1984; elected as a Democrat to the \r', 'Eighty-fourth Congress, by special election, to fill the vacancy caused by the \r', 'death of his father, United States Representative John D. Dingell, Sr., and \r', 'reelected to the twenty-nine succeeding Congresses (December 13, 1955-January \r', '3, 2015); was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Fourteenth \r', 'Congress in 2014; chair, Committee on Energy and Commerce (Ninety-seventh \r', 'through One Hundred Third Congresses and One Hundred Tenth Congress). \r']

Bio: ['a Representative from Texas; born in Austin, Travis County, Tex., \r', 'October 6, 1946; graduated from Austin High School, Austin, Tex., 1964; B.A., \r', 'University of Texas, Austin, Tex., 1967; J.D., University of Texas School of \r', 'Law, 1970; member of the Texas state senate, 1973-1985; justice of the Texas \r', 'supreme court, 1989-1994; adjunct professor, University of Texas School of Law, \r', 'Austin, Tex., 1989-1994; unsuccessful candidate for election to the United \r', 'States Senate in 1984; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Fourth and to \r', 'the eleven succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1995-present).\r']

Name: DOOLEY, Calvin M.
Bio: ['a Representative from California; born in Visalia, Tulare County, Calif., January 11, 1954; B.S., University of California, Davis, Calif., 1977; M.A., Stanford University, Stanford, Calif., 1987; farmer; administrative assistant to California state Senator Rose Ann Vuich, 1987-1989; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Second and to the six succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1991-January 3, 2005); not a candidate for reelection in 2004.  \r']

Name: DOOLITTLE, John Taylor
Bio: ['a Representative from California; born in Glendale, Los Angeles \r', 'County, Calif., October 30, 1950; graduated from Cupertino High School, \r', 'Cupertino, Calif., 1968; B.A., University of California, Santa Cruz, Calif., \r', '1972; J.D., University of the Pacific, McGeorge School of Law, Stockton, \r', 'Calif., 1978; lawyer, private practice; member of the California state senate, \r', '1981-1990; chair, California senate Republican caucus, 1987-1990; elected as a \r', 'Republican to the One Hundred Second and to the eight succeeding Congresses \r', '(January 3, 1991-January 3, 2009); was not a candidate for reelection to the \r', 'One Hundred Eleventh Congress in 2008.\r']

Name: DOYLE, Michael F.

Name: DREIER, David Timothy
Bio: ['a Representative from California; born in Kansas City, Jackson \r', 'County, Mo., July 5, 1952; attended the Principia Upper Schools in St. Louis, \r', 'Mo.; B.A., Claremont Men’s College, Claremont, Calif., 1975; M.A., Claremont \r', 'Graduate School, Claremont, Calif., 1976; director, corporate relations, \r', 'Claremont McKenna College, 1975-1979; delegate, California state Republican \r', 'conventions, 1978-1980; delegate, Republican National Conventions, 1976-1980; \r', 'vice president, Dreier Development Co., Kansas City, Mo.; unsuccessful \r', 'candidate for election to the Ninety-sixth Congress in 1978; elected as a \r', 'Republican to the Ninety-seventh and to the fifteen succeeding Congresses \r', '(January 3, 1981-January 3, 2013); chair, Committee on Rules (One Hundred Sixth \r', 'through One Hundred Ninth Congresses, One Hundred Twelfth Congress); was not a \r', 'candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Thirteenth Congress in \r', '2012.\r']

Name: DUNCAN, John J., Jr.
Bio: [' (son of John James Duncan), \r', 'a Representative from Tennessee; born in Lebanon, Wilson County, \r', 'Tenn., July 21, 1947; graduated from Holston High School, Knoxville, Tenn.; \r', 'B.S., University of Tennessee, Knoxville, Tenn., 1969; J.D., National Law \r', 'Center, George Washington University, Washington, D.C., 1973; lawyer, private \r', 'practice; Army National Guard, 1970-1987; United States Army Reserve, \r', '1970-1987; state trial judge, Knox County, Tenn., 1981-1988; elected as a \r', 'Republican to the One Hundredth Congress, by special election, to fill the \r', 'vacancy caused by the death of his father, John J. Duncan, and simultaneously \r', 'elected to the One Hundred First Congress; reelected to the One Hundred Second \r', 'and to the thirteen succeeding Congresses (November 8, 1988-present). \r']

Name: DUNN, Jennifer Blackburn
Bio:
['a Representative from Washington; born in Seattle, King County, \r', 'Wash., July 29, 1941; graduated from Bellevue High School, Bellevue, Wash.; \r', 'attended the University of Washington, Seattle, Wash., 1960-1962; B.A., \r', 'Stanford University, Stanford, Calif., 1963; systems engineer; section \r', 'supervisor, King County, Wash., Department of Assessments, 1978-1980; chair, \r', 'Washington State Republican Party, 1981-1992; member, United States delegations \r', 'to the United Nations Commission on the Status of Women, 1984 and 1990; elected \r', 'as a Republican to the One Hundred Third and to the five succeeding Congresses \r', '(January 3, 1993- January 3, 2005); not a candidate for reelection to the One \r', 'Hundred Ninth Congress in 2004; died on September 5, 2007, in Alexandria, Va. \r', '


\r', '

Bibliography

”Jennifer Dunn” in \r', 'Women in Congress, 1917-2006. Prepared under the direction of \r', 'the Committee on House Administration by the Office of History & \r', 'Preservation, U. S. House of Representatives. Washington: Government Printing \r', 'Office, 2006.\r']

Name: EDWARDS, Thomas Chester (Chet)
Bio: ['a Representative from Texas; born in Corpus Christi, Nueces County, \r', 'Tex., November 24, 1951; B.A., Texas Agricultural & Mechanical University, \r', '1974; M.B.A., Harvard University Business School, Cambridge, Mass., 1981; \r', 'legislative and district administrative assistant to United States \r', 'Representative Olin Teague of Texas, 1974-1977; unsuccessful candidate for \r', 'nomination to the Ninety-sixth Congress in 1978; business executive; member of \r', 'the Texas state senate, 1983-1990; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred \r', 'Second and to the nine succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1991-January 3, 2011); \r', 'unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Twelfth Congress in \r', '2010. \r']

Name: EHLERS, Vernon James
Bio: ['a Representative from Michigan; born in Pipestone, Pipestone County, \r', 'Minn., February 6, 1934; educated at home by his parents; attended Calvin \r', 'College, Grand Rapids, Mich., 1952-1956; A.B., University of California, \r', 'Berkeley, Calif., 1956; Ph.D., University of California, Berkeley, Calif., \r', '1960; teaching and scientific research, Lawrence Berkeley Laboratory, \r', 'University of California, Berkeley, 1956-1966; professor of physics, Calvin \r', 'College, Grand Rapids, Mich., 1966-1983; commissioner, Kent County, Mich., \r', '1975-1983; member of the Michigan state house of representatives, 1983-1985; \r', 'member of the Michigan state senate, 1985-1993; elected as a Republican to the \r', 'One Hundred Third Congress by special election, to fill the vacancy caused by \r', 'the death of United States Representative Paul B. Henry, reelected to the eight \r', 'succeeding Congresses (December 7, 1993-January 3, 2011); chair, Committee on \r', 'House Administration (One Hundred Ninth Congress); was not a candidate for \r', 'reelection to the One Hundred Twelfth Congress in 2010; died on August 15, \r', '2017, in Grand Rapids, Mich. \r']

Name: EHRLICH, Robert L., Jr.
Bio:
['a Representative from Maryland; born in Arbutus, Howard County, Md., \r', 'November 25, 1957; B.A., Princeton University, Princeton, N.J., 1979; J.D., \r', 'Wake Forest University School of Law, Winston-Salem, N.C., 1982; member of the \r', 'Maryland state general assembly, 1987-1994; elected as a Republican to the One \r', 'Hundred Fourth and to the three succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1995-January \r', '3, 2003); not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Eighth Congress in \r', '2002; Governor of Maryland, 2003-2007; unsuccessful candidate for governor of \r', 'Maryland in 2010. \r', '


\r', '

Bibliography

Ehrlich, Robert. \r', 'Turn This Car Around: The Roadmap to Restoring America.\r', 'Dallas, TX: BenBella Books, 2011.\r']

Name: EMERSON, Jo Ann
Bio: [' (wife of Bill Emerson), \r', 'a Representative from Missouri; born in Bethesda, Montgomery County, \r', 'Md., September 16, 1950; graduated from Walt Whitman High School, Bethesda, \r', 'Md., 1968; B.A., Ohio Wesleyan University, Delaware, Ohio, 1972; professional \r', 'advocate; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Fourth Congress, by \r', 'special election to fill the vacancy caused by the death of her husband, United \r', 'States Representative Bill Emerson, and simultaneously elected as an \r', 'Independent to the One Hundred Fifth Congress; resumed prior party affiliation \r', 'as a Republican at the start of the One Hundred Fifth Congress; reelected as a \r', 'Republican to the One Hundred Sixth and to the seven succeeding Congresses \r', 'until her resignation on January 22, 2013 (November 5, 1996-January 22, 2013). \r']

Name: ENGEL, Eliot Lance
Bio: ['a Representative from New York; born in New York, Bronx County, \r', 'N.Y., February 18, 1947; attended Bronx public schools; B.A., Hunter-Lehman \r', 'College, City University of New York, New York, N.Y., 1969; M.A., Herbert H. \r', 'Lehman College, City University of New York, New York, N.Y., 1973; J.D., New \r', 'York Law School, New York, N.Y., 1987; teacher; member of the New York state \r', 'assembly, 1977-1988; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred First and to the \r', 'fourteen succeeding Congresses (January 3,1989-present).\r']

Name: ENGLISH, Philip Sheridan
Bio: ['a Representative from Pennsylvania; born in Erie, Erie County, Pa., \r', 'June 20, 1956; B.A., University of Pennsylvania, Philadelphia, Pa., 1978; \r', 'committee staff aide, Pennsylvania state senate; Erie County, Pa., controller, \r', '1985-1988; unsuccessful candidate for Pennsylvania state treasurer, 1988; chief \r', 'of staff for Pennsylvania state senator Melissa Hart, 1990-1994; delegate to \r', 'Republican National Convention in 1984, 2000, and 2004; elected as a Republican \r', 'to the One Hundred Fourth and to the six succeeding Congresses (January 3, \r', '1995-January 3, 2009); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One Hundred \r', 'Eleventh Congress in 2008. \r']

Name: ESHOO, Anna Georges
Bio: ['a Representative from California; born in New Britain, Hartford \r', 'County, Conn., December 13, 1942; A.A., Canada College, Redwood City, Calif., \r', '1975; Democratic National Committeewoman from California, 1980-1992; chief of \r', 'staff, speaker pro tempore of the California state assembly, 1981-1982; member \r', 'of the San Mateo County, Calif., board of supervisors, 1983-1992, president, \r', '1986; member, California Democratic state central executive committee; member \r', 'of the Democratic National Commission on Presidential Nominations, 1982; \r', 'unsuccessful candidate for election to the United States House of \r', 'Representatives in 1988; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Third and to \r', 'the twelve succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1993-present). \r']

Name: ETHERIDGE, Bobby R.
Bio: ['a Representative from North Carolina; born in Sampson County, N.C., August 7, 1941; B.S. Campbell University, Buies Creek, N.C., 1965; graduate studies, North Carolina State University, Raleigh, N.C., 1967; United States Army, 1965-1967; commissioner, Harnett County, N.C., 1972-1976; member of the North Carolina state general assembly, 1978-1988; superintendent of public instruction, North Carolina, 1988-1996; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Fifth and to the six succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1997-January 3, 2011); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Twelfth Congress in 2010.\r']

Name: EVANS, Lane Allen
Bio: ['a Representative from Illinois; born in Rock Island, Rock Island \r', 'County, Ill., August 4, 1951; attended Sacred Heart School, Rock Island, Ill.; \r', 'graduated from Alleman High School, Rock Island, Ill., 1969; B.A., Augustana \r', 'College, Rock Island, Ill., 1974; J.D., Georgetown University Law Center, \r', 'Washington, D.C., 1977; United States Marine Corps, 1969-1971; lawyer, private \r', 'practice; elected as a Democrat to the Ninety-eighth and to the eleven \r', 'succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1983-January 3, 2007); not a candidate for \r', 'reelection to the One Hundred Tenth Congress in 2006; died on November 5, 2014, \r', 'in East Moline, Ill.\r']

Name: EVERETT, Robert Terry
Bio: ['a Representative from Alabama; born in Dothan, Houston County, Ala., \r', 'February 15, 1937; graduated from the public schools of Midland City, Ala.; \r', 'attended Enterprise State Junior College, Enterprise, Ala.; United States Air \r', 'Force, 1955-1959; journalist; newspaper executive; farmer; contractor; elected \r', 'as a Republican to the One Hundred Third and to the seven succeeding Congresses \r', '(January 3, 1993-January 3, 2009); was not a candidate for reelection to the \r', 'One Hundred Eleventh Congress in 2008. \r']

Name: FARR, Sam
Bio: ['a Representative from California; born in San Francisco, San \r', 'Francisco County, Calif., July 4, 1941; graduated from Carmel High School, \r', 'Carmel-by-the-Sea, Calif., 1959; B.S., Willamette University, Salem, Oreg., \r', '1963; attended Santa Clara University, Santa Clara, Calif.; attended the \r', 'Monterey Institute of International Studies, Monterey, Calif.; United States \r', 'Peace Corps, 1963-1965; staff, California state assembly; member of the \r', 'Monterey County, Calif., board of supervisors, 1975-1980; chair, 1979; member \r', 'of the California state assembly, 1980-1993; elected as a Democrat to the One \r', 'Hundred Third Congress, by special election, to fill the vacancy caused by the \r', 'resignation of United States Representative Leon Panetta, and reelected to the \r', 'eleven succeeding Congresses (June 8, 1993-January 3, 2017); was not a \r', 'candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Fifteenth Congress in 2016. \r']

Name: FATTAH, Chaka

Kennedy School of Government, Harvard \r', 'University, Cambridge, Mass., 1984; special assistant to director of housing \r', 'and community development, Philadelphia, Pa., 1980; special assistant to \r', 'managing director of housing and community development, Philadelphia, Pa., \r', '1981; policy assistant, Greater Philadelphia Partnership; member of the \r', 'Pennsylvania state house of representatives, 1982-1988; member of the \r', 'Pennsylvania state senate, 1988-1994; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred \r', 'Fourth and to the ten succeeding Congresses until his resignation on June 23, \r', '2016 (January 3, 1995-June 23, 2016). \r']

Name: FERGUSON, Michael
Bio: ['a Representative from New Jersey; born in Ridgewood, Bergen County, \r', 'N.J., June 22, 1970; graduated from Delbarton School, Morristown, N.J.; B.A., \r', 'University of Notre Dame, Notre Dame, Ind.; M.P.A., Georgetown University, \r', 'Washington, D.C.; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Seventh and to the \r', 'three succeeding Congresses (January 3, 2001-January 3, 2009); was not a \r', 'candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Eleventh Congress in \r', '2008.\r']

Name: FILNER, Bob

Humphrey of Minnesota, 1975; staff, \r', 'United States Representative Donald M. Fraser of Minnesota, 1976; member, San \r', 'Diego, Calif., school board, 1979-1983, president, 1982; staff, United States \r', 'Representative Jim Bates of California, 1984; member of the San Diego, Calif., \r', 'city council, 1987-1992; deputy mayor of San Diego, Calif., 1990; elected as a \r', 'Democrat to the One Hundred Third and to the nine succeeding Congresses until \r', 'his resignation on December 3, 2012 (January 3, 1993-December 3, 2012); chair, \r', 'Committee on Veterans’ Affairs (One Hundred Tenth and One Hundred Eleventh \r', 'Congresses); was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Thirteenth \r', 'Congress in 2012, but was elected Mayor of San Diego, Calif.; Mayor of San \r', 'Diego, Calif., 2012-2013.\r']

Name: FLAKE, Jeff
Bio: ['a Senator and a Representative from Arizona; born in Snowflake, \r', 'Navajo County, Ariz., December 31, 1962; graduated from Brigham Young \r', 'University, Provo, Utah, 1986; M.A. Brigham Young University, Provo, Utah, \r', '1987; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Seventh and to the five \r', 'succeeding Congresses (January 3, 2001-January 3, 2013); was not a candidate \r', 'for reelection to the House of Representatives but was elected as a Republican \r', 'to the United States Senate in 2012 for the term ending January 3, \r', '2019.\r']

Name: FLETCHER, Ernest L.
Bio: ['a Representative from Kentucky; born in Mt. Sterling, Montgomery \r', 'County, Ky., November 12, 1952; graduated from LaFayette High School, \r', 'Lexington, Ky., 1970; B.S., University of Kentucky College of Engineering, \r', 'Lexington, Ky., 1974; M.D., University of Kentucky College of Medicine, \r', 'Lexington, Ky., 1984; United States Air Force, 1974-1979; member of the \r', 'Kentucky state house of representatives, 1994-1996; elected as a Republican to \r', 'the One Hundred Sixth Congress and to the two succeeding Congresses and served \r', 'until his resignation on December 8, 2003 (January 3, 1999-December 8, 2003); \r', 'Governor of Kentucky, 2003 to 2007.\r']

Name: FOLEY, Mark A.
Bio: ['a Representative from Florida;  born in Newton, Middlesex County, Mass., \r', 'September 8, 1954;  graduated Lake Worth High School, Lake Worth, Fla.;  attended Palm Beach \r', 'Community College, Lake Worth, Fla., 1973-1975;  business owner;  Lake Worth, Fla., city \r', 'commissioner, 1977;  vice mayor, Lake Worth, Fla., 1983-1984;  member of the Florida state house \r', 'of representatives, 1990-1992;  member of the Florida state senate, 1993-1995;  elected as a \r', 'Republican to the One  Hundred Fourth and to the five succeeding Congresses until his resignation on September 29, 2006 (January 3, \r', '1995-September 29, 2006). \r']

Name: FORBES, J. Randy
Bio: ['a Representative from Virginia; born in Chesapeake, Chesapeake \r', 'County, Va., February 17, 1952; graduated from Great Bridge High School, \r', 'Chesapeake, Va., 1970; B.A., Randolph-Macon College, Ashland, Va., 1974; J.D., \r', 'University of Virginia, Charlottesville, Va., 1977; lawyer, private practice; \r', 'chairman, Republican Party of Virginia, 1996-2001; member of the Virginia state \r', 'house of delegates, 1989-1997; member of the Virginia state senate, 1997-2001; \r', 'elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Seventh Congress, by special \r', 'election, to fill the vacancy caused by the death of United States \r', 'Representative Norman Sisisky, and reelected to the seven succeeding Congresses \r', '(June 19, 2001-January 3, 2017); unsuccessful candidate for renomination to the \r', 'One Hundred Fifteenth Congress in 2016.\r']

Name: FORD, Harold, Jr.
Bio:
[' (son of Harold Eugene Ford), \r', 'a Representative from Tennessee; born in Memphis, Shelby County, \r', 'Tenn., May 11, 1970; graduated from St. Albans School for Boys, Washington, \r', 'D.C.; B.A., University of Pennsylvania, Philadelphia, Pa., 1992; J.D., \r', 'University of Michigan Law School, 1996; staff aide, United States Senate \r', 'Committee on the Budget, 1992; special assistant, United States Department of \r', 'Commerce, 1993; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Fifth and to the four \r', 'succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1997-January 3, 2007); not a candidate for \r', 'reelection, but was an unsuccessful candidate to the United States Senate in \r', '2006. \r', '

Name: FOSSELLA, Vito John
Bio: [" (great grandson of James O'Leary), \r", 'a Representative from New York; born in Staten Island, Richmond \r', 'County, N.Y., March 9, 1965; graduated from Monsignor Farrell High School, \r', 'Staten Island, N.Y.; B.S., Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania, \r', 'Philadelphia, Pa., 1987; J.D., Fordham University Law School, New York, N.Y., \r', '1994; lawyer, private practice; New York, N.Y., city council member; elected as \r', 'a Republican to the One Hundred Fifth Congress, by special election to fill the \r', 'vacancy caused by the resignation of United States Representative Susan \r', 'Molinari, reelected to the five succeeding Congresses (November 4, 1997-January \r', '3, 2009); was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Eleventh \r', 'Congress in 2008.\r']

Name: FRANK, Barney
Bio: ['a Representative from Massachusetts; born in Bayonne, Hudson County, \r', 'N.J., March 31, 1940; graduated from Bayonne High School, Bayonne, N.J., 1957; \r', 'A.B., Harvard University, Cambridge, Mass., 1962; graduate work in political \r', 'science and teaching fellow in government, Harvard University, Cambridge, \r', 'Mass., 1962-1972; J.D., Harvard Law School, Cambridge, Mass., 1977; staff, \r', 'Mayor Kevin White of Boston, Mass., 1968-1971; staff, United States \r', 'Representative Michael F. Harrington of Massachusetts, 1971-1972; member of the \r', 'Massachusetts state legislature, 1973-1980; elected as a Democrat to the \r', 'Ninety-seventh and to the fifteen succeeding Congresses (January 3, \r', '1981-January 3, 2013); reprimanded by the U.S. House of Representatives on July \r', '29, 1990, for improper use of political influence to fix parking tickets and to \r', 'influence probation officers for a personal friend; chair, Committee on \r', 'Financial Services (One Hundred Tenth and One Hundred Eleventh Congresses); was \r', 'not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Thirteenth Congress in \r', '2012.\r']

Name: FRELINGHUYSEN, Rodney P.
Bio: [' (son of Peter Hood Ballantine Frelinghuysen, Jr., great-great \r', 'grandson of Frederick Frelinghuysen, and great-great-great nephew of Theodore \r', 'Frelinghuysen), \r', 'a Representative from New Jersey; born in New York, N.Y., April 29, \r', '1946; graduated from St. Albans School, Washington, D.C., 1964; B.A., Hobart \r', 'College, Geneva, N.Y., 1969; graduate studies, Trinity College, Hartford, \r', 'Conn.; United States Army, 1969-1971; state and federal aid coordinator and \r', 'administrative assistant to board of chosen freeholders, Morris County, N.J., \r', '1972; board of chosen freeholders, Morris County, N.J., 1974-1983, director, \r', '1980; member, New Jersey commission on capital budgeting and planning; member \r', 'of the New Jersey state general assembly, 1983-1994; member of the Morris \r', 'County, N.J., Republican Committee; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred \r', 'Fourth and to the eleven succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1995-present); \r', 'chair, Committee on Appropriations (One Hundred Fifteenth \r', 'Congress).\r']

Name: FROST, Jonas Martin
Bio: ['a Representative from Texas; born in Glendale, Los Angeles County, \r', 'Calif., January 1, 1942; graduated from R.L. Paschal High School, Fort Worth, \r', 'Tex., 1960; B.A. and B.J., University of Missouri, Columbia, Mo., 1964; J.D., \r', 'Georgetown University Law Center, Washington, D.C., 1970; United States Army \r', 'Reserves, 1966-1972; lawyer, private practice; journalist; law clerk for United \r', 'State Judge Sarah T. Hughes, for the Northern District of Texas, 1970-1971; \r', 'delegate, Democratic National Convention, 1976, 1984, 1988, 1992, 1996, and \r', '2000; elected as a Democrat to the Ninety-sixth and to the twelve succeeding \r', 'Congresses (January 3, 1979-January 3, 2005); chair, House Democratic Caucus \r', '(One Hundred Sixth through One Hundred Eighth Congresses); unsuccessful \r', 'candidate for reelection in 2004. \r']

Name: GALLEGLY, Elton W.
Bio: ['a Representative from California; born in Huntington Park, Los \r', 'Angeles County, Calif., March 7, 1944; graduated from Huntington Park High \r', 'School, Huntington Park, Calif., 1962; attended Los Angeles State College, Los \r', 'Angeles, Calif., 1962-1963; real estate broker; member, Simi Valley, Calif., \r', 'city council, 1979; mayor, Simi Valley, Calif., 1980-1986; chair, Ventura \r', 'County, Calif., Association of Governments, 1983; elected as a Republican to \r', 'the One Hundredth and to the twelve succeeding Congresses (January 3, \r', '1987-January 3, 2013); was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred \r', 'Thirteenth Congress in 2012.\r']

Name: GANSKE, Greg
Bio: ['a Representative from Iowa; born in New Hampton, Chickasaw County, \r', 'Iowa, March 31, 1949; B.A., University of Iowa, Iowa City, Iowa, 1972; M.D., \r', 'University of Iowa Medical School, Iowa City, Iowa, 1976; general surgery \r', 'training, University of Colorado Medical Center, Denver, Colo., and Oregon \r', 'Health Science Center, Portland, Oreg., 1976-1982; plastic surgery training, \r', 'Harvard Medical School, Cambridge, Mass., 1982-1984; surgeon; United States \r', 'Army Reserve, 1986-2001; farm manager; elected as a Republican to the One \r', 'Hundred Fourth and to the three succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1995-January \r', '3, 2003); not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Eighth Congress in \r', '2002, but was an unsuccessful candidate for election to the United States \r', 'Senate; is a resident of Des Moines, Iowa. \r']

Name: GEKAS, George William
Bio: ['a Representative from Pennsylvania; born in Harrisburg, Dauphin \r', 'County, Pa., April 14, 1930; graduated from William Penn High School, \r', 'Harrisburg, Pa., 1948; B.A., Dickinson College, Carlisle, Pa., 1952; J.D., \r', 'Dickinson School of Law, Carlisle, Pa., 1958; United States Army, 1953-1955; \r', 'lawyer, private practice; assistant district attorney, Dauphin County, Pa., \r', '1960-1966; member of the Pennsylvania state house of representatives, \r', '1966-1974; member of the Pennsylvania state senate, 1976-1982; elected as a \r', 'Republican to the Ninety-eighth and to the nine succeeding Congresses (January \r', '3, 1983-January 3, 2003); one of the managers appointed by the House of \r', 'Representatives in 1988 to conduct the impeachment proceedings against Alcee \r', 'Lamar Hastings, judge of the United States District Court for the Southern \r', 'District of Florida; one of the managers appointed by the House of \r', 'Representatives in 1998 to conduct the impeachment proceedings against \r', 'President William Clinton; unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One \r', 'Hundred Eighth Congress in 2002. \r']

Name: GEPHARDT, Richard Andrew
Bio: ['a Representative from Missouri; born in St. Louis, St. Louis County, \r', 'Mo., January 31, 1941; graduated from South West High School, 1958; B.S., \r', 'Northwestern University, Evanston, Ill., 1962; J.D., University of Michigan Law \r', 'School, 1965; lawyer, private practice; Missouri Air National Guard, 1965-1971; \r', 'Democratic committeeman, St. Louis, Mo., 1968-1971; alderman, St. Louis, Mo., \r', '1971-1976; elected as a Democrat to the Ninety-fifth and to the thirteen \r', 'succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1977- January 3, 2005); unsuccessful \r', 'candidate for the Democratic presidential nomination in 1988 and in 2004; \r', 'majority leader (One Hundred First through One Hundred Third Congresses); \r', 'minority leader (One Hundred Fourth through One Hundred Seventh Congresses). \r']

Name: GIBBONS, James A.
Bio: ['a Representative from Nevada; born in Sparks, Washoe County, Nev., \r', 'December 16, 1944; B.S., University of Nevada, Reno, Nev., 1967; M.S., \r', 'University of Nevada, Reno, Nev., 1973; J.D. Southwestern Law School, Los \r', 'Angeles, Calif., 1979; post-graduate studies, University of Southern \r', 'California, Los Angeles, Calif.; United States Air Force, 1967-1971; Nevada Air \r', 'National Guard, 1975-1996; lawyer, private practice; commercial airline pilot; \r', 'hydrologist, Office of Federal Water Master; member of Nevada state assembly, \r', '1989-1993; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Fifth and to the four \r', 'succeeding Congresses until his resignation on December 31, 2006 (January 3, \r', '1997-December 31, 2006); was not a candidate for reelection to the United \r', 'States House of Representatives in 2006; Governor of Nevada, 2007-2010. \r']

Name: GILCHREST, Wayne Thomas
Bio: ['a Representative from Maryland; born in Rahway, Union County, N.J., April 15, 1946; graduated from Rahway High School, Rahway, N.J., 1964; A.A., Wesley College, Dover, Del., 1971; B.A., Delaware State College, Dover, Del., 1973; United States Marine Corps, 1964-1968; teacher; unsuccessful candidate for election to the One Hundred First Congress in 1988; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Second and to the eight succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1991-January 3, 2009); unsuccessful candidate for nomination to the One Hundred Eleventh Congress in 2008. \r']

Name: GILLMOR, Paul Eugene
Bio: ['a Representative from Ohio; born in Tiffin, Seneca County, Ohio, \r', 'February 1, 1939; graduated from Old Fort High School, Old Fort, Ohio, 1957; \r', 'B.A., Ohio Wesleyan University, Delaware, Ohio, 1961; J.D., University of \r', 'Michigan Law School, Ann Arbor, Mich., 1964; United States Air Force, \r', '1965-1966; lawyer, private practice; member of the Ohio state senate, \r', '1967-1988, minority leader, 1978-1980, 1983-1984, and president, 1981-1982, \r', '1985-1988; unsuccessful candidate for nomination for Governor of Ohio in 1986; \r', 'elected as a Republican to the One Hundred First and to the nine succeeding \r', 'Congresses, served until his death on September 5, 2007. (January 3, \r', '1989-September 5, 2007). \r']

Name: GILMAN, Benjamin Arthur
Bio: ['a Representative from New York; born in Poughkeepsie, Dutchess \r', 'County, N.Y., December 6, 1922; graduated from Middletown High School, \r', 'Middletown, N.Y., 1941; B.S., Wharton School of Business and Finance, \r', 'University of Pennsylvania, Philadelphia, Pa., 1946; LL.B., New York Law \r', 'School, New York, N.Y., 1950; lawyer, private practice; United States Army Air \r', 'Corps, 1942-1945; assistant attorney general, New York state attorney general, \r', '1953-1955; member of the New York state assembly, 1966-1972; member, New York \r', 'state southeastern water commission; elected as a Republican to the \r', 'Ninety-third and to the fourteen succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1973-January \r', '3, 2003); chair, Committee on International Relations (One Hundred Fourth \r', 'through One Hundred Sixth Congresses); not a candidate for reelection to the \r', 'One Hundred Eighth Congress in 2002; delegate, Republican National Convention, \r', '1996 and 2000; died on December 17, 2016, in Wappingers Falls, N.Y. \r']

Name: GONZALEZ, Charles A.
Bio:
[' (son of Henry Barbosa González), \r', 'a Representative from Texas; born in San Antonio, Bexar County, \r', 'Tex., May 5, 1945; graduated from Thomas A. Edison High School, San Antonio, \r', 'Tex., 1965; B.A., University of Texas, Austin, Tex., 1969; J.D., St. Mary’s \r', 'School of Law, San Antonio, Tex., 1972; Texas Air National Guard, 1969-1975; \r', 'teacher; lawyer, private practice; judge, Bexar County, Tex., Court at Law, No. \r', '2, 1983-1987; Texas state district court judge, Bexar County, Tex., 1989-1997; \r', 'elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Sixth and to the six succeeding \r', 'Congresses (January 3, 1999-January 3, 2013); was not a candidate for \r', 'reelection to the One Hundred Thirteenth Congress in 2012. \r', '


\r', '

Name: GOODE, Virgil H., Jr.
Bio: ['a Representative from Virginia; born in the City of Richmond, Va., \r', 'October 17, 1946; graduated from Franklin County High School, Rocky Mount, Va., \r', '1965; B.A., University of Richmond, Richmond, Va., 1969; J.D., University of \r', 'Virginia School of Law, Charlottesville, Va., 1973; Virginia Army National \r', 'Guard, 1969-1975; lawyer, private practice; member of the Virginia state \r', 'senate, 1973-1997; unsuccessful candidate for nomination as United States \r', 'Senator in 1982; unsuccessful candidate for nomination as United States Senator \r', 'in 1994; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Fifth Congress and to the \r', 'succeeding Congress, changed party affiliation from a Democrat to an \r', 'Independent on January 27, 2000; elected as an Independent to the One Hundred \r', 'Seventh Congress and changed party affiliation to Republican on August 1, 2002, \r', 'elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Eighth and to the two succeeding \r', 'Congress (January 3, 1997-January 3, 2009); unsuccessful candidate for \r', 'reelection to the One Hundred Eleventh Congress in 2008; unsuccessful \r', 'Constitution Party candidate for election for the President of the United \r', 'States in 2012.\r']

Name: GOODLATTE, Robert William
Bio: ['a Representative from Virginia; born in Holyoke, Hampden County, \r', 'Mass., September 22, 1952; graduated from Classical High School, Springfield, \r', 'Mass., 1970; B.A., Bates College, Lewiston, Maine, 1974; J.D., Washington and \r', 'Lee University, Lexington, Va., 1977; lawyer, private practice; staff, United \r', 'States Representative M. Caldwell Butler of Virginia, 1977-1979; elected as a \r', 'Republican to the One Hundred Third and to the twelve succeeding Congresses \r', '(January 3, 1993-present); one of the managers appointed by the House of \r', 'Representatives in 2009 to conduct the impeachment proceedings of Samuel B. \r', 'Kent, judge of the United States District Court for the Southern District of \r', 'Texas; chair, Committee on Agriculture (One Hundred Eighth and One Hundred \r', 'Ninth Congresses); chair, Committee on the Judiciary (One Hundred Thirteenth \r', 'through One Hundred Fifteenth Congresses).\r']

Name: GORDON, Barton Jennings
Bio: ['a Representative from Tennessee; born in Murfreesboro, Rutherford \r', 'County, Tenn., January 24, 1949; graduated from Central High School, \r', 'Murfreesboro, Tenn., 1967; B.S., Middle Tennessee State University, \r', 'Murfreesboro, Tenn., 1971; J.D., University of Tennessee College of Law, \r', 'Knoxville, Tenn., 1973; United States Army, 1971-1972; lawyer, private \r', 'practice; executive director, Tennessee state Democratic Party, 1979; chair, \r', 'Tennessee state Democratic Party, 1981-1983; elected as a Democrat to the \r', 'Ninety-ninth and to the twelve succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1985-January \r', '3, 2011); not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Twelfth Congress in \r', '2010; chair, Committee on Science and Technology (One Hundred Tenth and One \r', 'Hundred Eleventh Congresses).\r']

Name: GOSS, Porter J.
Bio: ['a Representative from Florida;  born in Waterbury, New Haven County, Conn., \r', 'November 26, 1938;  B.A., Yale University, New Haven, Conn., 1960;  United States Army, \r', '1960-1962;  Central Intelligence Agency, 1962-1972;  businessman;   investor;  member of the city \r', 'council and mayor, Sanibel, Fla., 1974-1982;  commissioner, Lee County, Fla., 1983-1988;  chair, \r', 'Lee County, Fla., Commission, 1985-1986;  elected as a Republican to the One Hundred First and to \r', 'the seven succeeding  Congresses until his resignation on September 23, 2004 (January 3, \r', '1989-September 23, 2004);  chair, Permanent Select Committee on  Intelligence (One Hundred Fifth \r', 'through One Hundred Eighth Congresses);  director, Central Intelligence Agency, 2004-2006. \r']

Name: GRAHAM, Lindsey O.
Bio: ['a Senator and a Representative from South Carolina; born in Central, \r', 'Pickens County, S.C., July 9, 1955; graduated from Daniel High School, Central, \r', 'S.C. 1973; B.A., University of South Carolina, Columbia 1977; J.D., University \r', 'of South Carolina School of Law 1981; United States Air Force 1982-1988; South \r', 'Carolina Air National Guard 1989-1995; United States Air Force Reserves \r', '1995-present; lawyer, private practice; assistant county attorney, Oconee \r', 'County, S.C. 1988-1992; city attorney for Central, S.C. 1990-1994; member of \r', 'the South Carolina state house of representatives 1992-1994; elected as a \r', 'Republican to the House of Representatives for the One Hundred Fourth and to \r', 'the three succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1995-January 3, 2003); one of the \r', 'managers appointed by the House of Representatives in 1998 to conduct the \r', 'impeachment proceedings against President William Clinton; was not a candidate \r', 'for reelection in 2002, but was elected as a Republican to the U.S. Senate in \r', '2002; reelected in 2008, and again in 2014 for the term ending January 3, 2021; was an unsuccessful candidate for the Republican presidential \r', 'nomination in 2016. \r']

Name: GRANGER, Kay
Bio: ['a Representative from Texas; born in Greenville, Hunt County, Tex., \r', 'January 18, 1943; graduated from Eastern Hills High School, Fort Worth, Tex.; \r', 'B.S. Texas Wesleyan University, Fort Worth, Tex., 1965; teacher; business \r', 'owner; member of the Fort Worth, Tex., zoning commission, 1981-1989; member of \r', 'the Fort Worth, Tex., city council, 1989-1991; mayor of Fort Worth, Tex., \r', '1991-1995; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Fifth and to the ten \r', 'succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1997-present).\r']

Name: GRAVES, Samuel
Bio: ['a Representative from Missouri; born in Tarkio, Atchison County, \r', 'Mo., November 7, 1963; graduated from Tarkio High School, Tarkio, Mo., 1982; \r', 'B.A., University of Missouri, Columbia, Mo., 1986; member of the Missouri state \r', 'house of representatives, 1992-1994; member of the Missouri state senate, \r', '1994-2000; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Seventh and to the eight \r', 'succeeding Congresses (January 3, 2001-present); chair, Committee on Small \r', 'Business (One Hundred Twelfth and One Hundred Thirteenth \r', 'Congresses).\r']

Name: GREEN, Mark
Bio: ['a Representative from Wisconsin; born in Boston, Suffolk County, \r', 'Mass., June 1, 1960; graduated from Abbot Pennings High School, De Pere, Wis.; \r', 'B.A., University of Wisconsin, Eau Claire, Wis., 1983; J.D., University of \r', 'Wisconsin Law School, Madison, Wis., 1987; lawyer, private practice; member of \r', 'the Wisconsin state assembly, 1992-1998; elected as a Republican to the One \r', 'Hundred Sixth and to the three succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1999-January \r', '3, 2007); not a candidate for reelection, but was an unsuccessful candidate for \r', 'Governor of Wisconsin in 2006.\r']

Name: GREEN, Raymond Eugene (Gene)
Bio: ['a Representative from Texas; born in Houston, Harris County, Tex., \r', 'October 17, 1947; graduated from Jefferson Davis High School, Houston, Tex., \r', '1967; B.B.A., University of Houston, Houston, Tex., 1971; attended University \r', 'of Houston, Bates College of Law, Houston, Tex., 1973-1977; lawyer, private \r', 'practice; business executive; member of the Texas state house of \r', 'representatives, 1973-1985; member of the Texas state senate, 1985-1993; \r', 'elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Third and to the twelve succeeding \r', 'Congresses (January 3, 1993-present); chair, Committee on Standards of Official \r', 'Conduct (One Hundred Tenth Congress).\r']

Name: GREENWOOD, James Charles
Bio: ['a Representative from Pennsylvania; born in Philadelphia, \r', 'Philadelphia County, Pa., May 4, 1951; graduated from Council Rock High School, \r', 'Newton, Pa., 1969; B.A., Dickinson College, Carlisle, Pa., 1973; legislative \r', 'assistant to Pennsylvania state Representative John S. Renninger, 1972-1976; \r', 'head house parent, The Woods Schools, 1974-1976; caseworker, Bucks County, Pa., \r', 'Children and Youth Social Service Agency, 1977-1980; member of the Pennsylvania \r', 'state house of representatives, 1981-1986; member of the Pennsylvania state \r', 'senate, 1987-1992; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Third and to the \r', 'five succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1993-January 3, 2005); not a candidate \r', 'for reelection to the One Hundred Ninth Congress in 2004. \r']

Name: GRUCCI, Jr., Felix J.
Bio: ['a Representative from New York; born in Brookhaven, N.Y.,  November 25, 1951;  \r', 'graduated from Bellport High School, Long Island, N.Y., 1970;  business executive;  member of the \r', 'Brookhaven, N.Y., town council, 1993-1995; town supervisor, Brookhaven, N.Y., 1996-2000;  \r', 'elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Seventh Congress (January 3, 2001-January 3, 2003);  \r', 'unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Eighth Congress in 2002. \r']

Name: GUTIÉRREZ, Luis V.
Bio: ['a Representative from Illinois; born in Chicago, Cook County, Ill., \r', 'December 10, 1953; B.A., Northeastern Illinois University, DeKalb, Ill., 1974; \r', 'teacher; social worker, Illinois state department of children and family \r', 'services; administrative assistant, Chicago, Ill., mayor’s office \r', 'subcommittee on infrastructure, 1984-1985; co-founder, West Town-26th Ward \r', 'Independent Political Organization, 1985; alderman, Chicago, Ill., city \r', 'council, 1986-1993, president pro tem, 1989-1992; delegate, Democratic National \r', 'Committee, 1984; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Third and to the \r', 'twelve succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1993-present).\r']

Name: GUTKNECHT, Gilbert W.
Bio: ['a Representative from Minnesota; born in Cedar Falls, Black Hawk \r', 'County, Iowa, March 20, 1951; graduated from Cedar Falls High School, Cedar \r', 'Falls, Iowa; B.A., University of Northern Iowa, Cedar Falls, 1973; Worldwide \r', 'College of Auctioneering (Iowa), 1978; member of the Minnesota state house of \r', 'representatives, 1982-1994; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Fourth \r', 'and to the five succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1995-January 3, 2007); \r', 'unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Tenth Congress in \r', '2006. \r']

Name: HALL, Ralph Moody
Bio: ['a Representative from Texas; born in Fate, Rockwall County, Tex., \r', 'May 3, 1923; graduated from Rockwall High School, Rockwall, Tex.; attended \r', 'Texas Christian University, Fort Worth, Tex., 1943; attended University of \r', 'Texas, Austin, Tex., 1946-1947; LL.B., Southern Methodist University, Dallas, \r', 'Tex., 1951; United States Navy, 1942-1945; lawyer, private practice; business \r', 'executive; Rockwall County, Tex., judge, 1950-1962; member of the Texas state \r', 'senate, 1962-1972; elected as a Democrat to the Ninety-seventh and to the \r', 'eleven succeeding Congresses; changed from a Democrat to a Republican on \r', 'January 5, 2004 (January 3, 1981-January 5, 2004); served as a Republican in \r', 'the One Hundred Eighth, and reelected to the five succeeding Congresses \r', '(January 5, 2004-January 3, 2015); unsuccessful candidate for renomination to \r', 'the One Hundred Fourteenth Congress in 2014; chair, Committee on Science, \r', 'Space, and Technology (One Hundred Twelfth Congress).\r']

Name: HALL, Tony Patrick
Bio: ['a Representative from Ohio; born in Dayton, Montgomery County, Ohio, \r', 'January 16, 1942; graduated from Fairmont High School, Kettering, Ohio, 1960; \r', 'A.B., Denison University, Granville, Ohio, 1964; United States Peace Corps, \r', '1966-1967; member of the Ohio state general assembly, 1969-1972; member of the \r', 'Ohio state senate, 1973-1978; elected as a Democrat to the Ninety-sixth and to \r', 'the eleven succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1979-September 9, 2002); chairman, \r', 'Select Committee on Hunger (One Hundred First through One Hundred Third \r', 'Congresses); United States Ambassador to the United Nations Agencies for Food \r', 'and Agriculture, 2002-2005; executive director, Alliance to End Hunger. \r']

Name: HANSEN, James Vear
Bio: ['a Representative from Utah; born in Salt Lake City, Salt Lake \r', 'County, Utah, August 14, 1932; graduated from East High School, Salt Lake City, \r', 'Utah, 1951; B.S., University of Utah, Salt Lake City, Utah, 1961; United States \r', 'Navy, 1951-1955; real estate agent; insurance agent; member of the Farmington, \r', 'Utah, city council, 1960-1972; member of the Utah state house of \r', 'representatives, 1973-1980, speaker, 1979-1980; business owner; business \r', 'executive; elected as a Republican to the Ninety-seventh and to the ten \r', 'succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1981-January 3, 2003); chair, Committee on \r', 'Standards of Official Conduct (One Hundred Fifth Congress); chair, Committee on \r', 'Resources (One Hundred Seventh Congress); not a candidate for reelection to the \r', 'One Hundred Eighth Congress in 2002 .\r']

Name: HARMAN, Jane L.
Bio:
['a Representative from California; born in New York, N.Y., June 28, \r', '1945; graduated from University High School, Los Angeles, Calif., 1962; B.A., \r', 'Smith College, Northampton, Mass., 1966, J.D., Harvard University School of \r', 'Law, Cambridge, Mass., 1969; staff for United States Senator John V. Tunney of \r', 'California, 1972-1973; adjunct professor, Georgetown University Law Center, \r', 'Washington, D.C., 1974-1975; chief counsel and staff director, United States \r', 'Senate Judiciary subcommittee on constitutional rights, 1975-1977; deputy \r', 'secretary to the cabinet, The White House, 1977-1978; special counsel, \r', 'Department of Defense, 1979; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Third and \r', 'to the two succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1993-January 3, 1999); was not a \r', 'candidate for reelection to One Hundred Sixth Congress in 1998, but was an \r', 'unsuccessful candidate for nomination as governor of California; elected as a \r', 'Democrat to the One Hundred Seventh and to the five succeeding Congresses until \r', 'her resignation on February 28, 2011 (January 3, 2001-February 28, \r', '2011).\r', '


\r', '

Bibliography

”Jane L. Harman” in \r', 'Women in Congress, 1917-2006. Prepared under the direction of \r', 'the Committee on House Administration by the Office of History & \r', 'Preservation, U. S. House of Representatives. Washington: Government Printing \r', 'Office, 2006.\r']

Name: HART, Melissa A.
Bio:
['a Representative from Pennsylvania; born in Pittsburgh, Allegheny \r', 'County, Pa., April 4, 1962; graduated from North Allegheny High School, North \r', 'Allegheny, Pa.; B.A., Washington and Jefferson College, Washington, Pa., 1984; \r', 'J.D., University of Pittsburgh, Pittsburgh, Pa., 1987; lawyer, private \r', 'practice; member of the Pennsylvania state senate, 1991-2000; elected as a \r', 'Republican to the One Hundred Seventh and to the two succeeding Congresses \r', '(January 3, 2001-January 3, 2007); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the \r', 'One Hundred Tenth Congress in 2006 and the One Hundred Eleventh Congress in \r', '2008. \r', '

Name: HASTERT, John Dennis
Bio:
['a Representative from Illinois; born in Aurora, Kane County, Ill., January 2, 1942; B.A., Wheaton College, Wheaton, Ill., 1964; M.S., Northern Illinois University, DeKalb, Ill.,1967; teacher; athletic coach; business owner; member of the Illinois state house of representatives, 1980-1986; elected as a Republican to the One Hundredth and to the ten succeeding Congresses until his resignation on November 26, 2007 (January 3, 1987-November 26, 2007); Speaker of the House (One Hundred Sixth through One Hundred Ninth Congresses). \r', '


\r', '

Bibliography

Hastert, Dennis. Speaker: Lessons From 40 Years in Coaching and Politics. Washington: Regnery Publishing, Inc., 2004. \r']

Name: HASTINGS, Alcee Lamar
Bio: ['a Representative from Florida; born in Altamonte Springs, Seminole \r', 'County, Fla., September 5, 1936; graduated Crooms Academy, Sanford, Fla, 1953; \r', 'B.A., Fisk University, Nashville, Tenn., 1958; attended Howard University \r', 'School of Law, Washington, D.C., 1958-1960; J.D., Florida Agricultural and \r', 'Mechanical University, Tallahassee, 1963; lawyer, private practice; Broward \r', 'County, Fla., circuit court judge, 1977-1979; United States district judge for \r', 'the Southern District of Florida, 1979-1989; elected as a Democrat to the One \r', 'Hundred Third and to the twelve succeeding Congresses (January 3, \r', '1993-present). \r']

Name: HASTINGS, Richard Norman (Doc)
Bio: ['a Representative from Washington; born in Spokane, Spokane County, \r', 'Wash., February 7, 1941; graduated from Pasco High School, Pasco, Wash., 1959; \r', 'attended Columbia Basin College, Pasco, Wash., 1959-1961; attended Central \r', 'Washington State University, Ellensburg, Wash., 1964; United States Army \r', 'Reserves, 1963-1969; small businessman; member of the Washington state house of \r', 'representatives, 1979-1987; delegate, Republican National Convention, \r', '1976-1984; unsuccessful candidate for election to the United States House of \r', 'Representatives in 1992; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Fourth and \r', 'reelected to the nine succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1995-January 3, 2015); \r', 'was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Fourteenth Congress in \r', '2014; chair, Committee on Standards of Official Conduct (One Hundred Ninth \r', 'Congress); chair, Committee on Natural Resources (One Hundred Twelfth and One \r', 'Hundred Thirteenth Congresses). \r']

Name: HAYES, Robert (Robin)
Bio: ['a Representative from North Carolina; born in Concord, Cabarrus \r', 'County, N.C., August 14, 1945; B.A., Duke University, Durham, N.C., 1967; \r', 'member of Concord, N.C., board of aldermen, 1978; member of the North Carolina \r', 'state house of representatives, 1992-1996; unsuccessful candidate for the \r', 'Republican nomination for governor of North Carolina in 1996; elected as a \r', 'Republican to the One Hundred Sixth and to the four succeeding Congress \r', '(January 3, 1999-January 3, 2009); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the \r', 'One Hundred Eleventh Congress in 2008.\r']

Name: HAYWORTH, John D., Jr.
Bio: ['a Representative from Arizona; born in Highpoint, Guilford County, \r', 'N.C., July 12, 1958; graduated from High Point Central High School, Highpoint, \r', 'N.C., 1976; B.A., North Carolina State University, Raleigh, N.C., 1980; \r', 'television journalist; radio journalist; elected as a Republican to the One \r', 'Hundred Fourth and five succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1995-January 3, \r', '2007); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Tenth Congress \r', 'in 2006. \r']

Name: HEFLEY, Joel M.
Bio: ['a Representative from Colorado; born in Ardmore, Carter County, \r', 'Okla., April 18, 1935; B.A., Oklahoma Baptist University, Shawnee, Okla., 1957; \r', 'M.S., Oklahoma State University, Stillwater, Okla., 1962; Gates Fellow, Harvard \r', 'University, Cambridge, Mass., 1984; management consultant; executive director, \r', 'Community Planning and Research Council, 1966-1986; executive director, Pikes \r', 'Peak Health Planning, 1971-1973; member of the Colorado state house of \r', 'representatives, 1977-1978; member of the Colorado state senate, 1979-1986; \r', 'elected as a Republican to the One Hundredth and to the nine succeeding \r', 'Congresses (January 3, 1987-January 3, 2007); chair, Committee on Standards \r', '(One Hundred Seventh and One Hundred Eighth Congresses); not a candidate for \r', 'reelection to the One Hundred Tenth Congress in 2006.\r']

Name: HERGER, Walter William (Wally)
Bio: ['a Representative from California; born in Yuba City, Calif., May 20, \r', '1945; graduated from East Nicolaus High School, Nicolaus, Calif.; attended \r', 'California State University, Sacramento, Calif.; cattle rancher; businessman; \r', 'member, East Nicolaus High School Board of Trustees, Nicolaus, Calif., \r', '1977-1980; member of the California state assembly, 1980-1986; elected as a \r', 'Republican to the One Hundredth and to the twelve succeeding Congresses \r', '(January 3, 1987-January 3, 2013); was not a candidate for reelection to the \r', 'One Hundred Thirteenth Congress in 2012.\r']

Name: HILL, Baron P.
Bio: ['a Representative from Indiana; born in Seymour, Jackson County, \r', 'Ind., June 23, 1953; attended Seymour High School, Seymour, Ind.; B.A., Furman \r', 'University, Greenville, S.C., 1975; member of the Indiana state house of \r', 'representatives, 1982-1990; unsuccessful candidate for election to the United \r', 'States Senate in 1990; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Sixth and to \r', 'the two succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1999-January 3, 2005); unsuccessful \r', 'candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Ninth Congress in 2004; elected as \r', 'a Democrat to the One Hundred Tenth and to the succeeding Congress (January 3, \r', '2007-January 3, 2011); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One Hundred \r', 'Twelfth Congress in 2010; successful candidate for nomination to the United \r', 'States Senate in 2016, but withdrew following the primary.\r']

Name: HILLEARY, Van
Bio: ['a Representative from Tennessee; born in Dayton, Rhea County, Tenn., \r', 'June 20, 1959; graduated from Rhea County High School, Dayton, Tenn.; B.S., \r', 'University of Tennessee, Knoxville, Tenn., 1981; J.D., Cumberland School of \r', 'Law, Samford University, Birmingham, Ala., 1990; lawyer, private practice; \r', 'business executive; United States Air Force, 1982-1984; United States Air Force \r', 'Reserve, 1984-1995; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Fourth and to \r', 'the three succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1995-January 3, 2003); not a \r', 'candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Eighth Congress in 2002, but was an \r', 'unsuccessful candidate for Governor of Tennessee. \r']

Name: HILLIARD, Earl Frederick
Bio:
['a Representative from Alabama; born in Birmingham, Ala., April 9, \r', '1942; graduated from Western-Olin High School, Birmingham, Ala., 1960; B.A., \r', 'Morehouse College, Atlanta, Ga., 1964; J.D., Howard University, Washington, \r', 'D.C., 1967; M.B.A., Atlanta University, Atlanta, Ga., 1970; lawyer, private \r', 'practice; member of the Alabama state house of representatives, 1974-1980; \r', 'member of the Alabama state senate, 1981-1992; elected as a Democrat to the One \r', 'Hundred Third and to the four succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1993-January 3, \r', '2003); unsuccessful candidate for nomination to the One Hundred Eighth Congress \r', 'in 2002. \r', '

”Earl Frederick Hilliard” in \r', 'Black Americans in Congress, 1870-2007. Prepared under the \r', 'direction of the Committee on House Administration by the Office of History \r', '& Preservation, U. S. House of Representatives. Washington: Government \r', 'Printing Office, 2008.\r']

Name: HINCHEY, Maurice Dunlea
Bio: ['a Representative from New York; born in New York, N.Y., October 27, 1938; graduated from Saugerties High School, Saugerties, N.Y., 1956; B.S., State University of New York at New Paltz, New Paltz, N.Y., 1968, M.A., State University of New York at New Paltz, New Paltz, N.Y., 1970; United States Navy, 1956-1959; member of the New York state assembly, 1975-1993; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Third and to the nine succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1993-January 3, 2013); not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Thirteenth Congress in 2012; died on November 22, 2017, in Saugerties, N.Y; interment in the grounds of the Maurice D. Hinchey Catskill Interpretive Center, Mt. Tremper, N.Y. \r']

Name: HINOJOSA, Rubén
Bio: ['a Representative from Texas; born in Edcouch, Hidalgo County, Tex., \r', 'August 20, 1940; attended Mercedes High School, Mercedes, Tex.; B.B.A., \r', 'University of Texas, Austin, Tex., 1962; M.B.A., University of Texas-Pan \r', 'American, Edinburg, Tex., 1980; business executive; member of the Texas state \r', 'board of education, 1974-1984; adjunct professor, University of Texas-Pan \r', 'American School of Business, Edinburg, Tex.; chairman, board of South Texas \r', 'Community College for Hidalgo and Starr Counties, Tex., 1993-1996; elected as a \r', 'Democrat to the One Hundred Fifth and to the nine succeeding Congresses \r', '(January 3, 1997-January 3, 2017); was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Fifteenth Congress in 2016.\r']

Name: HOBSON, David Lee
Bio: ['a Representative from Ohio; born in Cincinnati, Hamilton County, \r', 'Ohio, October 17, 1936; graduated from Withrow High School, Cincinnati, Ohio, \r', '1954; B.A., Ohio Wesleyan University, Delaware, Ohio, 1958; J.D., Ohio State \r', 'College of Law, Columbus, 1963; Ohio Air National Guard, 1958-1963; member of \r', 'the Ohio state senate, 1982-1990, president pro tempore, 1988-1990; elected as \r', 'a Republican to the One Hundred Second and to the eight succeeding Congresses \r', '(January 3, 1991-January 3, 2009); was not a candidate for reelection to the \r', 'One Hundred Eleventh Congress in 2008.\r']

Name: HOEFFEL, Joseph M.
Bio: ['a Representative from Pennsylvania; born in Philadelphia, \r', 'Philadelphia County, Pa., September 3, 1950; graduated from William Penn \r', 'Charter School, Philadelphia, Pa.; B.A., Boston University, Boston, Mass., \r', '1972; J.D., Temple University, Philadelphia, Pa., 1986; United States Army \r', 'Reserve, 1970-1976; member of the Pennsylvania state house of representatives, \r', '1977-1984; Montgomery County, Pa., commissioner, 1992-1998; elected as a \r', 'Democrat to the One Hundred Sixth and to the two succeeding Congresses (January \r', '3, 1999-January 3, 2005); was not a candidate for reelection in 2004, but was \r', 'an unsuccessful candidate for election to the United States Senate in \r', '2004.\r']

Name: HOEKSTRA, Peter
Bio: ['a Representative from Michigan; born in Groningen, Netherlands, \r', 'October 30, 1953; graduated from Holland Christian High School, Holland, Mich.; \r', 'B.A., Hope College, Holland, Mich., 1975; M.B.A., University of Michigan, Ann \r', 'Arbor, Mich., 1977; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Third and to the \r', 'eight succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1993-January 3, 2011); chair, Permanent \r', 'Select Committee on Intelligence (One Hundred Eighth and One Hundred Ninth \r', 'Congresses); not a candidate for reelection in 2010, but was an unsuccessful \r', 'candidate for nomination for governor of Michigan; United States Ambassador to the Netherlands, 2017-present.\r']

Name: HOLDEN, Thomas Timothy (Tim)
Bio: ['a Representative from Pennsylvania; born in St. Clair, Schuylkill \r', 'County, Pa., March 5, 1957; graduated from St. Clair Area High School, St. \r', 'Clair, Pa., 1975; attended Fork Union Military Academy and the University of \r', 'Richmond, Richmond, Va.; B.A., Bloomsburg State University, Bloomsburg, Pa., \r', '1980; Schuylkill County, Pa., probation officer; sergeant-at-arms, Pennsylvania \r', 'state house of representatives; sheriff of Schuylkill County, Pa., 1985-1993; \r', 'elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Third and to the nine succeeding \r', 'Congresses (January 3, 1993-January 3, 2013); unsuccessful candidate for \r', 'nomination to the One Hundred Thirteenth Congress in 2012. \r']

Name: HOLT, Rush
Bio: [' (son of Rush D. Holt), \r', '(son of Rush D. Holt), a Representative from New Jersey; born in \r', 'Weston, Lewis County, W. Va., October 15, 1948; graduated from the Landon \r', 'School, Bethesda, Md., 1966; B.A., Carleton College, Northfield, Minn., 1970; \r', 'M.S., New York University, New York, N.Y., 1974; Ph.D., New York University, \r', 'New York, N.Y., 1981; Congressional Science Fellow with United States House of \r', 'Representatives, Office of Representative Bob Edgar of Pennsylvania, 1982-1983; \r', 'faculty, Swarthmore College, Swarthmore, Pa., 1980-1988; acting chief, Nuclear \r', 'and Scientific Division, Office of Strategic Forces, United States Department \r', 'of State, 1987-1989; assistant director, Princeton Plasma Physics Laboratory, \r', '1989-1997; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Sixth and to the seven \r', 'succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1999-January 3, 2015); unsuccessful candidate \r', 'for nomination for the United States Senate in 2013.\r']

Name: HONDA, Mike
Bio: ['a Representative from California; born in Walnut Grove, Solano County, Calif., June 27, 1941; graduated from San Jose High School, San Jose, Calif., 1959; B.A., San Jose State University, San Jose, Calif., 1968; M.A., San Jose State University, San Jose, Calif., 1974; United States Peace Corps, 1965-1967; member of the San Jose, Calif., planning commission, 1971-1981; member of the San Jose, Calif., unified school board, 1981-1990; member of the Santa Clara County, Calif., board of supervisors, 1990-1996; member of the California state assembly, 1997-2000; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Seventh and to the seven succeeding Congresses (January 3, 2001-January 3, 2017); was an unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Fifteenth Congress in 2016. \r']

Name: HOOLEY, Darlene
Bio:
['a Representative from Oregon; born in Williston, Williams County, N. Dak., April 4, 1939; B.S., Oregon State University, Corvallis, 1961; teacher, 1961-1975; West Linn, Oreg., city council, 1977-1980; member of the Oregon state house of representatives, 1980-1986; Clackamas County, Oreg., board of commissioners, 1987-1996; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Fifth and to the five succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1997-January 3, 2009); was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Eleventh Congress in 2008. \r', '


\r', '
