Name: HORN, John Stephen (Steve)
Bio: ['a Representative from California; born in San Juan Bautista, San \r', 'Benito County, Calif., May 31, 1931; A.B., Stanford University, Stanford, \r', 'Calif., 1953; M.P.A., Harvard University, Cambridge, Mass., 1955; Ph.D., \r', 'Stanford University, Stanford, Calif., 1958; United States Army, 1954-1962; \r', 'administrative assistant to Secretary of Labor James P. Mitchell, 1959-1960; \r', 'legislative assistant to Senator Thomas H. Kuchel, 1960-1966; senior fellow, \r', 'Brookings Institution, 1966-1969; administrator, American University, \r', 'Washington, D.C.; president, California State University, Long Beach, \r', '1970-1988; vice chairman, United States Commission on Civil Rights, 1969-1980, \r', 'commissioner, 1980-1982; member, advisory board, National Institute of \r', 'Corrections, 1972-1988, chairman, 1984-1987; vice chairman, California \r', 'Republican League, 1980-1985; member, California Educational Facility \r', 'Authority; faculty, California State University, Long Beach; unsuccessful \r', 'candidate for nomination to the One Hundred First Congress in 1988; elected as \r', 'a Republican to the One Hundred Third and to the four succeeding Congresses \r', '(January 3, 1993-January 3, 2003); not a candidate for reelection to the One \r', 'Hundred Eighth Congress in 2002; died on February 17, 2011, in Long Beach, \r', 'Calif. \r']

Name: HOSTETTLER, John Nathan
Bio: ['a Representative from Indiana; born in Evansville, Vanderburgh \r', 'County, Ind., June 19, 1961; graduated from North Posey High School, \r', 'Poseyville, Ind.; B.S., Rose-Hulman Institute of Technology, Terre Haute, Ind., \r', '1983; performance engineer, Warrick Power Plant, Southern Indiana Gas and \r', 'Electric Co., 1985-1994; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Fourth and \r', 'to the five succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1995-January 3, 2007); \r', 'unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Tenth Congress in \r', '2006.\r']

Name: HOUGHTON, Amory, Jr.
Bio: [' (grandson of Alanson Bigelow Houghton), \r', "a Representative from New York; born in Corning, Steuben County, N.Y., August 7, 1926; graduated from St. Paul's School, Concord, N.H.; B.A., Harvard University, Cambridge, Mass., 1950; M.B.A., Harvard Business School, Cambridge, Mass., 1952; United States Marine Corps, 1945-1946; business executive; elected as a Republican to the One Hundredth and to the eight succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1987-January 3, 2005); not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Ninth Congress in 2004. \r"]

Name: HOYER, Steny Hamilton
Bio: ['a Representative from Maryland; born in New York City, N.Y., June \r', '14, 1939; graduated from Suitland High School, Suitland, Md., 1957; B.S., \r', 'University of Maryland, College Park, 1963; J.D., Georgetown University Law \r', 'Center, Washington, D.C., 1966; lawyer, private practice; member of the \r', 'Maryland state senate, 1966-1979, and president, 1975-1979; member of the \r', 'Maryland state board for higher education, 1978-1981; delegate to Democratic \r', 'National Conventions, 1968, 1974, 1976, and 1984; elected as a Democrat to the \r', 'Ninety-seventh Congress, by special election, to fill the vacancy created by H. \r', 'Res. 80, which declared United States Representative Gladys Noon Spellman’s \r', 'seat vacant due to an incapacitating illness, and reelected to the eighteen \r', 'succeeding Congresses (May 19, 1981-present); chairman, House Democratic Caucus \r', '(One Hundred First through One Hundred Third Congresses); minority whip (One \r', 'Hundred Eighth, One Hundred Ninth, and One Hundred Twelfth through One Hundred \r', 'Fifteenth Congresses); majority leader (One Hundred Tenth and One Hundred \r', 'Eleventh Congresses). \r']

Name: HULSHOF, Kenny
Bio: ['a Representative from Missouri; born in Sikeston, Scott County, Mo., \r', 'May 22, 1958; graduated from Thomas W. Kelly High School, Benton, Mo.; B.S., \r', 'University of Missouri, 1980; J.D., University of Mississippi Law School, 1983; \r', 'assistant public defender, 1983-1986; assistant prosecuting attorney, Cape \r', 'Girardeau, Mo., 1986-1989; assistant attorney general, Office of the Missouri \r', 'state attorney general, 1989-1996; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred \r', 'Fifth and to the five succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1997-January 3, 2009); \r', 'not a candidate for reelection, but was an unsuccessful candidate for Governor \r', 'of Missouri in 2008.\r']

Name: HUNTER, Duncan Lee
Bio: [' (father of Duncan Duane Hunter), \r', 'a Representative from California; born in Riverside, Riverside \r', 'County, Calif., May 31, 1948; graduated from Rubidoux High School, Riverside, \r', 'Calif., 1966; B.S., Western State University, San Diego, Calif., 1968; J.D., \r', 'Western State University, San Diego, Calif., 1976; United States Army Airborne, \r', '1969-1971; lawyer, private practice; elected as a Republican to the \r', 'Ninety-seventh and to the thirteen succeeding Congresses (January 3, \r', '1981-January 3, 2009); was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred \r', 'Eleventh Congress in 2008; chair, Committee on Armed Services (One Hundred \r', 'Eighth and One Hundred Ninth Congress); unsuccessful candidate for the \r', 'Republican presidential nomination in 2008. \r']

Name: HUTCHINSON, Asa
Bio: [' (brother of Timothy Hutchinson), \r', 'a Representative from Arkansas; born in Bentonville, Benton County, \r', 'Ark., December 3, 1950; graduated from Springdale High School, Springdale, \r', 'Ark., 1968; B.S., Bob Jones University, Greenville, S.C., 1972; J.D., \r', 'University of Arkansas School of Law, Fayetteville, 1975; city attorney, \r', 'Bentonville, Ark., 1977-1978; United States Attorney for the Western District \r', 'of Arkansas, 1982-1985; unsuccessful candidate for Arkansas attorney general, \r', '1990; unsuccessful candidate for the United States Senate in 1986; chairman, \r', 'Arkansas State Republican Committee, 1990-1995; elected as a Republican to the \r', 'One Hundred Fifth Congress and to the two succeeding Congresses, served until \r', 'resignation on August 6, 2001 (January 3, 1997-August 6, 2001); one of the \r', 'managers appointed by the House of Representatives in 1998 to conduct the \r', 'impeachment proceedings of President William Jefferson Clinton; Director, Drug \r', 'Enforcement Administration, 2001-2003; Under Secretary for Border and \r', 'Transportation Security, Department of Homeland Security, 2003-2005. \r']

Name: HYDE, Henry John
Bio: ['a Representative from Illinois; born in Chicago, Cook County, Ill., April 18, 1924; B.S., Georgetown University, Washington, D.C., 1947; J.D., Loyola University Law School, Chicago, Ill., 1949; lawyer; private practice; United States Navy, 1944-1946; United States Naval Reserve, 1946-1968; member of the Illinois state house of representatives, 1967-1974, majority leader, 1971-1972; delegate, Illinois state Republican conventions, 1958-1974; elected as a Republican to the Ninety-fourth and to the fifteen succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1975-January 3, 2007); one of the managers appointed by the House of Representatives in 1986 to conduct the impeachment proceedings against Harry E. Claiborne, judge of the United States District Court for Nevada; one of the managers appointed by the House of Representatives in 1998 to conduct the impeachment proceedings against President William Clinton; chair, Committee on the Judiciary (One Hundred Fourth through One Hundred Sixth Congresses); chair, Committee on International Relations (One Hundred Seventh through One Hundred Ninth Congresses); not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Tenth Congress in 2006; died on November 29, 2007, in Chicago, Ill. \r']

Name: INSLEE, Jay Robert
Bio: ['a Representative from Washington; born in Seattle, King County, \r', 'Wash., February 9, 1951; graduated from Ingraham High School, Seattle, Wash., \r', '1969; attended Stanford University, Stanford, Calif., 1969-1970; B.A., \r', 'University of Washington, Seattle, Wash., 1972; J.D., Willamette University \r', 'School of Law, Salem, Oreg., 1976; lawyer, private practice; Selah, Wash., city \r', 'prosecutor, 1976-1984; member of the Washington state house of representatives, \r', '1988-1992; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Third Congress (January 3, \r', '1993-January 3, 1995); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One Hundred \r', 'Fourth Congress in 1994; unsuccessful candidate for nomination as governor of \r', 'Washington in 1996; regional director, United States Department of Health and \r', 'Human Services, 1997-1998; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Sixth \r', 'Congress and to the six succeeding Congresses until his resignation on March \r', '20, 2012. (January 3, 1999-March 20, 2012); was not a candidate for reelection \r', 'to the One Hundred Thirteenth Congress in 2012, but was elected governor of \r', 'Washington; Governor of Washington, 2013-present.\r']

Name: ISAKSON, Johnny
Bio: ['a Senator and a Representative from Georgia; born in Atlanta, Fulton \r', 'County, Ga., December 28, 1944; graduated from the University of Georgia, \r', 'Athens, Ga., 1966; served in the Georgia Air National Guard 1966-1972; member \r', 'of the Georgia state general assembly, 1976-1990; unsuccessful candidate for \r', 'election as Governor of Georgia 1990; member of the Georgia state senate \r', '1993-1996; unsuccessful candidate for election to the United States Senate in \r', '1996; chair of the Georgia board of education 1996; elected as a Republican to \r', 'the One Hundred Sixth Congress by special election to fill the vacancy created \r', 'when United States Representative Newt Gingrich did not take his seat in the \r', 'One Hundred Sixth Congress; reelected to the two succeeding Congresses \r', '(February 23, 1999-January 3, 2005); was not a candidate for reelection to the \r', 'House of Representatives, but was elected to the United States Senate in 2004; \r', 'reelected in 2010 and again in 2016 for the term ending January 3, 2023; chair, Committee on \r', 'Veterans’ Affairs (One Hundred Fourteenth and One Hundred Fifteenth Congresses), Select Committee on Ethics \r', '(One Hundred Fourteenth and One Hundred Fifteenth Congresses). \r']

Name: ISRAEL, Steve
Bio: ['a Representative from New York; born in Brooklyn, Kings County, \r', 'N.Y., May 30, 1958; attended Nassau Community College, Garden City, N.Y., 1978; \r', 'attended Syracuse University, Syracuse, N.Y., 1978-1979; B.A., George \r', 'Washington University, Washington, D.C., 1982; staff, United States \r', 'Representative Richard Ottinger of New York, 1980-1983; member of the \r', 'Huntington, N.Y., town board, 1993-2001; elected as a Democrat to the One \r', 'Hundred Seventh and to the seven succeeding Congresses (January 3, 2001-January \r', '3, 2017); was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Fifteenth \r', 'Congress in 2016.\r']

Name: ISSA, Darrell
Bio: ['a Representative from California; born in Cleveland, Cuyahoga \r', 'County, Ohio, November 1, 1953; B.A., Siena Heights College, Adrian, Mich., \r', '1976; United States Army, 1970-1980; business owner; elected as a Republican to \r', 'the One Hundred Seventh and to the eight succeeding Congresses (January 3, \r', '2001-present); chairman, Committee on Oversight and Government Reform (One \r', 'Hundred Twelfth and One Hundred Thirteenth Congresses). \r']

Name: ISTOOK, Ernest James, Jr.
Bio: ['a Representative from Oklahoma; born in Fort Worth, Tarrant County, \r', 'Tex., February 11, 1950; graduated from Castleberry High School, Ft. Worth, \r', 'Tex., 1967; B.A., Baylor University, Waco, Tex., 1971; J.D., Oklahoma City \r', 'University School of Law, Oklahoma City, 1976; lawyer, private practice; \r', 'journalist; director, Oklahoma State Alcoholic and Beverage Control Board, \r', '1977-1978; legal counsel to Governor David L. Boren of Oklahoma, 1978; board \r', 'member, Oklahoma County, Okla., metropolitan library system, 1982-1986, and \r', 'chair, 1985-1986; member, Warr Acres, Okla., city council, 1982-1986; director, \r', 'Warr Acres, Okla., chamber of commerce; member of the Oklahoma state house of \r', 'representative, 1987-1993; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Third and \r', 'to the six succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1993-January 3, 2007); not a \r', 'candidate for reelection, but was an unsuccessful candidate for Governor of \r', 'Oklahoma in 2006.\r']

Name: JACKSON, Jesse L., Jr.
Bio: ['a Representative from Illinois; born in Greenville, Pickens County, \r', 'S.C., March 11, 1965; B.S., North Carolina Agricultural & Technical State \r', 'University, Greensboro, N.C., 1987; M.A., Chicago Theological Seminary, \r', 'Chicago, Ill., 1989; J.D., University of Illinois College of Law, Chicago, \r', 'Ill., 1993; secretary, Democratic National Committee’s Black Caucus; national \r', 'field director, National Rainbow Coalition, 1993-1995; member, Rainbow/PUSH \r', 'Coalition; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Fourth Congress, to fill \r', 'the vacancy created by the resignation of United States Representative Mel \r', 'Reynolds, reelected to the eight succeeding Congresses until his resignation on \r', 'November 21, 2012 (December 12, 1995-November 21, 2012); elected to the One \r', 'Hundred Thirteenth Congress, but declined his seat.\r']

Name: JACKSON LEE, Sheila
Bio: ['a Representative from Texas; born in Queens, Queens County, N.Y., \r', 'January 12, 1950; graduated from Jamaica High School, Jamaica, N.Y.; B.A., Yale \r', 'University, New Haven, Conn., 1972; J.D., University of Virginia Law School, \r', 'Charlottesville, Va., 1975; lawyer, private practice; staff counsel, United \r', 'States House Select Committee on Assassinations, 1977-1978; member of the \r', 'Houston, Tex., city council, 1990-1994; Houston, Tex., municipal judge, \r', '1987-1990; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Fourth and to the eleven \r', 'succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1995-present).\r']

Name: JEFFERSON, William Jennings
Bio:
['a Representative from Louisiana; born in Lake Providence, East \r', 'Carroll Parish, La., March 14, 1947; G.W. Griffin High School, Lake Providence, \r', 'La.; B.A., Southern University and Agricultural & Mechanical College, Baton \r', 'Rouge, La., 1969; J.D., Harvard University, Cambridge, Mass., 1972; United \r', 'States Army, c. 1969-1975; lawyer, private practice; law clerk for United \r', 'States District Judge Alvin B. Rubin, Eastern District of Louisiana, 1972-1973; \r', 'staff, United States Senator J. Bennett Johnston of Louisiana, 1973-1975; \r', 'member of the Louisiana state senate, 1979-1990; candidate for Mayor of New \r', 'Orleans in 1982 and 1986; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Second and \r', 'to the eight succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1991-January 3, 2009); \r', 'unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Eleventh Congress in \r', '2008.\r', '

Name: JENKINS, William Lewis
Bio: ['a Representative from Tennessee; born in Detroit, Wayne County, \r', 'Mich., November 29, 1936; graduated from Rogersville High School, Rogersville, \r', 'Tenn., 1954; B.B.A., Tennessee Technical, Cookville, Tenn., 1957; United States \r', 'Army, 1960-1962; J.D., University of Tennessee College of Law, Knoxville, \r', 'Tenn., 1961; lawyer, private practice; farmer; energy advisor to Governor Lamar \r', 'Alexander; member of the Tennessee state general assembly, 1962-1971, speaker, \r', '1969-1971; Tennessee Valley Authority board member, 1971-1978; delegate to the \r', 'Republican National Convention, 1988; Tennessee state circuit court judge, \r', '1990-1996; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Fifth and to the four \r', 'succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1997-January 3, 2007); not a candidate for \r', 'reelection to the One Hundred Tenth Congress in 2006. \r']

Name: JOHN, Christopher
Bio: ['a Representative from Louisiana;  born in Crowley, Acadia Parish, La., January 5, \r', '1960;  graduated from Notre Dame High School, Acadia Parish, La., 1978;  B.A., Louisiana State \r', 'University, Shreveport, La., 1982;  aide to father, Louisiana state representative, John N. John, Jr., \r', '1974-1982;  member of the Louisiana state house of representatives, 1988-1996;  charter member of \r', 'the Crowley, La., chamber of commerce;  Crowley, La., board of alderman, 1984-1988;  elected as a \r', 'Democrat to the One Hundred Fifth Congress and to the three succeeding Congresses (January 3, \r', '1997- January 3, 2005);  not a candidate for reelection, but was an unsuccessful candidate for  the \r', 'United States Senate in 2004. \r']

Name: JOHNSON, Eddie Bernice
Bio: ['a Representative from Texas; born in Waco, McLennan County, Tex., \r', 'December 3, 1935; graduated from A.J. Moore High School, Waco, Tex., 1952; \r', 'nursing certificate, St. Mary’s College at the University of Notre Dame, \r', 'Notre Dame, Ind., 1955; B.S., Texas Christian University, Fort Worth, Tex., \r', '1967; M.P.A., Southern Methodist University, Dallas, Tex., 1976; chief \r', 'psychiatric nurse and psychotherapist, Veterans Administration hospital, \r', 'Dallas, Tex.; member of the Texas state house of representatives, 1972-1977; \r', 'administrator, United States Department of Health, Education and Welfare, \r', '1977-1981; business owner; member of the Texas state senate, 1986-1992; elected \r', 'as a Democrat to the One Hundred Third and to the twelve succeeding Congresses \r', '(January 3, 1993-present).\r']

Name: JOHNSON, Nancy Lee
Bio:
['a Representative from Connecticut; born Nancy Elizabeth Lee in \r', 'Chicago, Cook County, Ill., January 5, 1935; graduated from elementary and \r', 'secondary classes of the University of Chicago Laboratory School, Chicago, \r', 'Ill., 1953; B.A., Radcliffe College, Cambridge, Mass., 1957; attended, \r', 'University of London Courtauld Institute, 1957-1958; teacher; member of the \r', 'Connecticut state senate, 1977-1982; delegate, Republican National Convention, \r', '1980; elected as a Republican to the Ninety-eighth and to the eleven succeeding \r', 'Congresses (January 3, 1983-January 3, 2007); chair, Committee on Standards of \r', 'Official Conduct (One Hundred Fourth Congress);unsuccessful candidate for \r', 'reelection to the One Hundred Tenth Congress in 2006. \r', '

Name: JOHNSON, Sam
Bio: ['a Representative from Texas; born in San Antonio, Bexar County, \r', 'Tex., October 11, 1930; graduated from Woodrow Wilson High School, Dallas, \r', 'Tex.; B.B.A., Southern Methodist University, Dallas, Tex., 1951; M.S.I.A., \r', 'George Washington University, Washington, D.C., 1974; United States Air Force, \r', '1950-1979; prisoner of war during the Vietnam War, 1966-1973; decorated combat \r', 'veteran, received two Silver Stars, two Legions of Merit, the Distinguished \r', 'Flying Cross, one Bronze Star with Valor, two Purple Hearts, four Air Medals, \r', 'and three outstanding unit awards; member of the Texas state house of \r', 'representatives, 1985-1991; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Second \r', 'Congress, by special election, to fill the vacancy caused by the resignation of \r', 'United States Representative Harry Stephen (Steve) Bartlett, and reelected to \r', 'the One Hundred Third and to the twelve succeeding Congresses (May 8, \r', '1991-present). \r']

Name: JOHNSON, Timothy V.
Bio: ['a Representative from Illinois; born in Urbana, Champaign County, \r', 'Ill., July 23, 1946; graduated from Urbana High School, Urbana, Ill.; attended \r', 'United States Military Academy, West Point, N.Y., 1964; graduated from \r', 'University of Illinois, Champaign, Ill., 1969; J.D., University of Illinois, \r', 'Champaign, Ill., 1972; lawyer, private practice; realtor; member, Urbana, Ill., \r', 'city council, 1971-1975; member, Illinois state house of representatives, \r', '1976-2000; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Seventh and to the five \r', 'succeeding Congresses (January 3, 2001-January 3, 2013); was not a candidate \r', 'for reelection to the One Hundred Thirteenth Congress in 2012. \r']

Name: JONES, Stephanie Tubbs
Bio:
['a Representative from Ohio; born in Cleveland, Cuyahoga County, \r', 'Ohio, September 10, 1949; graduated from Collinwood High School, Cleveland, \r', 'Ohio; B.A., Case Western Reserve University, Cleveland, Ohio, 1971; J.D., Case \r', 'Western Reserve University, Cleveland, Ohio, 1974; elected to Cleveland, Ohio, \r', 'municipal court, 1981; judge, Court of Common Pleas of Cuyahoga County, Ohio, \r', '1983-1991; prosecutor, Cuyahoga County, Ohio, 1991-1998; elected as a Democrat \r', 'to the One Hundred Sixth and to the four succeeding Congresses (January 3, \r', '1999-August 20, 2008); chair, Committee on Standards of Official Conduct (One \r', 'Hundred Tenth Congress); died on August 20, 2008, in Cleveland, \r', 'Ohio.\r', '


\r', '

Name: JONES, Walter Beaman, Jr.
Bio: [' (son of Walter Beaman Jones, Sr.), \r', 'a Representative from North Carolina; born in Farmville, Pitt \r', 'County, N.C., February 10, 1943; graduated from Hargrave Military Academy, \r', 'Chatham, Va., 1961; B.A., Atlantic Christian College (now Barton College), \r', 'Wilson, N.C., 1966; North Carolina National Guard, 1967-1971; member of the \r', 'North Carolina state house of representatives, 1983-1992; unsuccessful \r', 'candidate for nomination to the One Hundred Third Congress in 1992; elected as \r', 'a Republican to the One Hundred Fourth and to the eleven succeeding Congresses \r', '(January 3, 1995-present). \r']

Name: KANJORSKI, Paul E.
Bio: ['a Representative from Pennsylvania; born in Nanticoke, Luzerne \r', 'County, Pa., April 2, 1937; United States Capitol Page School, Washington, \r', 'D.C., 1954; attended Wyoming Seminary, Kingston, Pa.; Temple University, \r', 'Philadelphia, Pa., 1957-1961; Dickinson School of Law, Carlisle, Pa., \r', '1962-1965; United States Army Reserves, 1960-1961; lawyer, private practice; \r', 'administrative law judge for workmen’s compensation, 1971-1980; elected as a \r', 'Democrat to the Ninety-ninth and to the twelve succeeding Congresses (January \r', '3, 1985-January 3, 2011); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One \r', 'Hundred Twelfth Congress in 2010.\r']

Name: KAPTUR, Marcia Carolyn (Marcy)
Bio: ['a Representative from Ohio; born in Toledo, Lucas County, Ohio, June \r', '17, 1946; graduated from St. Ursula Academy, Toledo, Ohio, 1964; B.A., \r', 'University of Wisconsin, Madison, Wis., 1968; M.A., University of Michigan, Ann \r', 'Arbor, Mich., 1974; attended the University of Manchester, Manchester, England, \r', '1974; post-graduate studies, Massachusetts Institute of Technology, Cambridge, \r', 'Mass., 1981; urban planner, Toledo-Lucas County, Ohio, Plan Commissions, \r', '1969-1975; director of planning, National Center for Urban Ethnic Affairs, \r', '1975-1977; assistant director for urban affairs, domestic policy staff, \r', 'Executive Office of the President, 1977-1979; elected as a Democrat to the \r', 'Ninety-eighth and to the seventeen succeeding Congresses (January 3, \r', '1983-present).\r']

Name: KELLER, Richard (Ric)
Bio: ['a Representative from Florida; born in Johnson City, Washington \r', 'County, Tenn., September 5, 1964; graduated from Boone High School, Orlando, \r', 'Fla., 1982; B.A., East Tennessee State University, Johnson City, Tenn., 1986; \r', 'J.D., Vanderbilt University, Nashville, Tenn., 1992; lawyer, private practice; \r', 'elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Seventh and to the three succeeding \r', 'Congresses (January 3, 2001-January 3, 2009); unsuccessful candidate for \r', 'reelection to the One Hundred Eleventh Congress in 2008. \r']

Name: KELLY, Sue W.
Bio:
['a Representative from New York; born in Lima, Allen County, Ohio, \r', 'September 26, 1936; graduated from Lima Central High School, Lima, Ohio; B.A., \r', 'Denison University, Granville, Ohio, 1958; M.A., Sarah Lawrence College, \r', 'Bronxville, N.Y., 1985; biomedical researcher, Boston City Hospital, Boston, \r', 'Mass., and New England Institute for Medical Research; teacher; staff for \r', 'United States Representative Hamilton Fish of New York; patient advocate, \r', 'emergency room, St. Luke’s Hospital, N.Y.; adjunct professor, Graduate Program \r', 'in Health Advocacy, Sarah Lawrence College, Bronxville, N.Y.; certified New \r', 'York ombudsman for nursing homes; member, New York Republican family committee; \r', 'elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Fourth and to the five succeeding \r', 'Congresses (January 3, 1995-January 3, 2007); unsuccessful candidate for \r', 'reelection to the One Hundred Tenth Congress in 2006. \r', '


\r', '

Bibliography

”Sue W. Kelly” in \r', 'Women in Congress, 1917-2006. Prepared under the direction of \r', 'the Committee on House Administration by the Office of History & \r', 'Preservation, U. S. House of Representatives. Washington: Government Printing \r', 'Office, 2006.\r']

Name: KENNEDY, Mark
Bio: ['a Representative from Minnesota; born in Benson, Swift County, \r', 'Minn., April 11, 1957; graduated from St. John’s University, Collegeville, \r', 'Minn., 1979; M.B.A., University of Michigan, Ann Arbor, Mich., 1983; elected as \r', 'a Republican to the One Hundred Seventh and to the two succeeding Congresses \r', '(January 3, 2001-January 3, 2007); not a candidate for reelection, but was an \r', 'unsuccessful candidate to the United States Senate in 2006. \r']

Name: KENNEDY, Patrick Joseph
Bio: [' (son of Edward Moore Kennedy, nephew of John Fitzgerald Kennedy and \r', 'Robert Francis Kennedy, cousin of Joseph Patrick Kennedy II, and great-grandson \r', 'of John Francis Fitzgerald), \r', 'a Representative from Rhode Island; born in Brighton, Middlesex \r', 'County, Mass., July 14, 1967; graduated Phillips Academy, Andover, Mass.; B.S., \r', 'Providence College, Providence, R.I., 1991; delegate to the Democratic National \r', 'Convention of 1988; member of the Rhode Island state house of representatives, \r', '1988-1994; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Fourth and to the seven \r', 'succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1995-January 3, 2011); was not a candidate \r', 'for reelection to the One Hundred Twelfth Congress in 2010.\r']

Name: KERNS, Brian D.
Bio: [' (son-in-law of John Thomas Myers), \r', 'a Representative from Indiana; born in Terre Haute, Vigo County, Ind.,  May  22, \r', '1957; B.S.,  Indiana State University, Terre Haute, Ind., 1991; M.P.A.,  Indiana State University, \r', 'Terre Haute, Ind., 1992; aide to United States Representative Ed Pease of Indiana;  television \r', 'journalist; administrator, St. Joseph’s College, Terre Haute, Ind.; staff, Indiana state department of \r', 'natural resources; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Seventh Congress  (January 3, \r', '2001-January 3, 2003); unsuccessful candidate for nomination to the One Hundred Eighth Congress in \r', '2002.\r']

Name: KILDEE, Dale Edward
Bio: ['(uncle of Dan Kildee), a Representative from Michigan; born in Flint, Genesee County, Mich., September 16, 1929; graduated from St. Mary’s High School, Flint, Mich., 1947; B.A., Sacred Heart Seminary, Detroit, Mich., 1952; teacher’s certificate, University of Detroit, Detroit, Mich., 1955; graduate work, University of Peshawar, Pakistan, 1958-1959; M.A., University of Michigan, Ann Arbor, Mich., 1961; teacher; member, Michigan state house of representatives, 1965-1974; member, Michigan state senate, 1975-1976; delegate to Michigan state Democratic conventions, 1956-1977; delegate to Democratic National Conventions, 1968 and 1984; elected as a Democrat to the Ninety-fifth and to the seventeen succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1977-January 3, 2013); was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Thirteenth Congress in 2012. \r']

Name: KILPATRICK, Carolyn Cheeks
Bio:
['a Representative from Michigan; born Carolyn Jean Cheeks in Detroit, \r', 'Wayne County, Mich., June 25, 1945; graduated from the High School of Commerce, \r', 'Detroit, Mich.; attended Ferris State University, Big Rapids, Mich., 1968-1970; \r', 'B.S., Western Michigan University, Kalamazoo, Mich., 1972; M.S., University of \r', 'Michigan, Ann Arbor, Mich., 1977; teacher; member of the Michigan state house \r', 'of representatives, 1979-1996; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Fifth \r', 'Congress and to the six succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1997-January 3, \r', '2011); unsuccessful candidate for nomination for One Hundred Twelfth Congress \r', 'in 2010. \r', '


\r', '

Bibliography

”Carolyn Cheeks Kilpatrick” in \r', 'Black Americans in Congress, 1870-2007. Prepared under the \r', 'direction of the Committee on House Administration by the Office of History \r', '& Preservation, U. S. House of Representatives. Washington: Government \r', 'Printing Office, 2008.\r']

Name: KIND, Ron
Bio: ['a Representative from Wisconsin; born in La Crosse, La Crosse \r', 'County, Wis., March 16, 1963; B.A., Harvard University, Cambridge, Mass., 1985; \r', 'M.A., London School of Economics, London, England, 1986; J.D., University of \r', 'Minnesota School of Law, Minneapolis, Minn., 1990; lawyer, private practice; \r', 'state prosecutor, La Crosse County, Wis., district attorney’s office, \r', '1992-1996; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Fifth and to the ten \r', 'succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1997-present).\r']

Name: KING, Peter T.
Bio: ['a Representative from New York; born in New York, New York County, \r', 'N.Y., April 5, 1944; B.A., St. Francis College, Brooklyn Heights, N.Y., 1965; \r', 'J.D., Notre Dame University, Notre Dame, Ind., 1968; New York Army National \r', 'Guard, 1968-1973; lawyer, private practice; Nassau County, N.Y. deputy \r', 'attorney, 1972-1974; member of the Hempstead, N.Y., town council, 1977-1981; \r', 'Nassau County, N.Y. comptroller, 1981-1993; elected as a Republican to the One \r', 'Hundred Third and to the twelve succeeding Congresses (January 3, \r', '1993-present); chair, Committee on Homeland Security (One Hundred Ninth and One \r', 'Hundred Twelfth Congresses).\r']

Name: KINGSTON, Jack
Bio: ['a Representative from Georgia; born in Bryan, Brazos County, Tex., \r', 'April 24, 1955; graduated from Clarke Central High School, Athens, Ga.; \r', 'attended Michigan State University, East Lansing, Mich., 1973-1974; A.B., \r', 'University of Georgia, Athens, Ga., 1978; business executive; member of the \r', 'Georgia state house of representatives, 1985-1993; elected as a Republican to \r', 'the One Hundred Third and to the ten succeeding Congresses (January 3, \r', '1993-January 3, 2015); unsuccessful candidate for nomination to the United \r', 'States Senate in 2014.\r']

Name: KIRK, Mark Steven
Bio: ['a Senator and a Representative from Illinois; born in Champaign, \r', 'Champaign County, Ill., September 15, 1959; B.A., Cornell University, Ithaca, \r', 'N.Y., 1981; M.S., London School of Economics, London, England, 1982; J.D., \r', 'Georgetown University, Washington, D.C., 1992; United States Naval Reserves, \r', '1989 to present; lawyer, private practice; staff member for United States \r', 'Representative John Porter of Illinois, 1984-1990; special assistant, United \r', 'States Department of State, 1992-1993; staff member for United States House of \r', 'Representatives International Relations Committee, 1995; elected as a \r', 'Republican to the One Hundred Seventh and to the four succeeding Congresses, \r', 'and served from January 3, 2001, until his resignation on November 29, 2010; \r', 'was not a candidate for reelection to the House of Representatives but was \r', 'elected as a Republican to the United States Senate in the November 2, 2010, \r', 'special election to the term ending January 3, 2011, a seat previously held by \r', 'appointed Senator Roland Burris, and at the same time elected in the general \r', 'election for the six-year term ending January 3, 2017; took the oath of office \r', 'on November 29, 2010; unsuccessful candidate for reelection in 2016. \r']

Name: KLECZKA, Gerald Daniel
Bio: ['a Representative from Wisconsin; born in Milwaukee, Milwaukee County, Wis., November 26, 1943; graduated from Don Bosco High School, Milwaukee, Wis., 1961; attended University of Wisconsin, Milwaukee, Wis., 1961-1962, 1967, 1970; Wisconsin Air National Guard, 1963-1969; accountant; member of the Wisconsin state assembly, 1969-1974; member of the Wisconsin state senate, 1975-1984; delegate, Wisconsin state Democratic conventions, 1966-1984; delegate, Democratic National Convention, 1980 and 1984; elected as a Democrat to fill the vacancy caused by the death of United States Representative Clement J. Zablocki, reelected to the ten succeeding Congresses (April 3, 1984-January 3, 2005); not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Ninth Congress in 2004; died on October 8, 2017, in Madison, Wis. \r']

Name: KNOLLENBERG, Joseph
Bio: ['a Representative from Michigan; born in Mattoon, Coles County, Ill., \r', 'November 28, 1933; attended public schools; B.S., Eastern Illinois University, \r', 'Charleston, Ill., 1955; United States Army, 1955-1957; elected as a Republican \r', 'to the One Hundred Third and to the eight succeeding Congresses (January 3, \r', '1993-January 3, 2009); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One Hundred \r', 'Eleventh Congress in 2008; died on February 6, 2018, in Troy, Mich.\r']

Name: KOLBE, James Thomas

Michel of Illinois, 1983-1994; elected \r', 'as a Republican to the One Hundred Fourth and to the six succeeding Congresses \r', '(January 3, 1995-January 3, 2009); was not a candidate for reelection to the \r', 'One Hundred Eleventh Congress in 2008; Secretary of Transportation in the \r', 'Cabinet of President Barack Obama, 2009-2013.\r']

Name: LAMPSON, Nicholas V.
Bio: ['a Representative from Texas; born in Beaumont, Jefferson County, \r', 'Tex., February 14, 1945; graduated from South Park High Sa Representative from \r', 'Texas; born in Beaumont, Jefferson County, Tex., February 14, 1945; graduated \r', 'from South Park High School, Beaumont, Tex., 1964; B.S., Lamar University, \r', 'Beaumont, Tex., 1968; M.Ed., Lamar University, Beaumont, Tex., 1971; teacher; \r', 'tax assessor, Jefferson County, Tex., 1977-1995; elected as a Democrat to the \r', 'One Hundred Fifth and to the three succeeding Congresses (January 3, \r', '1997-January 3, 2005); unsuccessful candidate for reelection in 2004; elected \r', 'as a Democrat to the One Hundred Tenth Congress (January 3, 2007-January 3, \r', '2009); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Eleventh \r', 'Congress in 2008; unsuccessful candidate for election to the One Hundred \r', 'Thirteenth Congress in 2012.\r']

Name: LANGEVIN, James
Bio: ['a Representative from Rhode Island; born in Providence, Providence \r', 'County, R.I., April 22, 1964; B.A., Rhode Island College, Providence, R.I., \r', '1990; M.A., Harvard University, Cambridge, Mass., 1994; member of the Rhode \r', 'Island state house of representatives, 1988-1994; Rhode Island secretary of \r', 'state, 1994-2001; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Seventh and to the \r', 'eight succeeding Congresses (January 3, 2001-present).\r']

Name: LANTOS, Thomas Peter
Bio: [' (father-in-law of Richard Swett), \r', 'a Representative from California; born in Budapest, Hungary, \r', 'February 1, 1928; came to the United States on an academic scholarship in 1947; \r', 'B.A., University of Washington, Seattle, Wash., 1949; M.A., University of \r', 'Washington, Seattle, Wash., 1950; Ph.D., University of California, Berkeley, \r', 'Calif., 1953; professor of economics; television journalist; administrative \r', 'assistant, economic and foreign policy adviser, United States Senate; delegate, \r', 'Democratic National Convention, 1976; elected as a Democrat to the \r', 'Ninety-seventh and to the thirteen succeeding Congresses (January 3, \r', '1981-February 11, 2008); chair, Committee on Foreign Affairs (One Hundred Tenth \r', 'Congress); died on February 11, 2008, in Bethesda, Md. \r']

Name: LARGENT, Steve
Bio: ['a Representative from Oklahoma; born in Tulsa, Tulsa County, Okla., \r', 'September 28, 1954; graduated from Putnam City High School, Okla.; B.S., \r', 'University of Tulsa, Tulsa, Okla., 1976; elected as a Republican to the One \r', 'Hundred Fourth Congress; appointed to the One Hundred Third Congress by the \r', 'Governor of Oklahoma under the provisions of Oklahoma Statute, Section \r', '26-12-101 (B) and without objection by the House (H. Res. 585, 103rd Congress) \r', 'to fill the vacancy caused by the resignation of United States Representative \r', 'James Inhofe; reelected to the three succeeding Congresses and served until his \r', 'resignation on February 15, 2002 (November 29, 1994-February 15, 2002); \r', 'unsuccessful candidate for Governor of Oklahoma in 2002. \r']

Name: LARSEN, Richard Ray (Rick)
Bio: ['a Representative from Washington; born in Arlington, Snohomish \r', 'County, Wash., June 15, 1965; B.A., Pacific Lutheran University, Tacoma, Wash., \r', '1987; M.P.A., University of Minnesota, Minneapolis, Minn., 1990; member of the \r', 'Snohomish, Wash., county council, 1998-2000; elected as a Democrat to the One \r', 'Hundred Seventh and to the eight succeeding Congresses (January 3, \r', '2001-present).\r']

Name: LARSON, John B.

Name: LATHAM, Thomas
Bio: ['a Representative from Iowa; born in Hampton, Franklin County, Iowa, \r', 'July 14, 1948; graduated from Cal Community College, Latimer, Iowa, 1966; \r', 'attended Wartburg College, Waverly, Iowa, 1966-1967, and Iowa State University, \r', 'Ames, Iowa, 1967-1970; business owner; delegate, Republican National \r', 'Convention, 1992; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Fourth and to the \r', 'nine succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1995-January 3, 2015); was not a \r', 'candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Fourteenth Congress in \r', '2014.\r']

Name: LaTOURETTE, Steven C.
Bio: ['a Representative from Ohio; born in Cleveland, Cuyahoga County, \r', 'Ohio, July 22, 1954; graduated from Cleveland Heights High School, Cleveland, \r', 'Ohio, 1972; B.A., University of Michigan, 1976; J.D., Cleveland State \r', 'University, Cleveland, Ohio, 1979; lawyer, private practice; public defender, \r', 'Lake County, Ohio, 1980-1983; prosecuting attorney, Lake County, Ohio, \r', '1989-1995; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Fourth and to the eight \r', 'succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1995-January 3, 2013); was not a candidate \r', 'for reelection to the One Hundred Thirteenth Congress in 2012; died on August \r', '3, 2016, in McLean, Va.\r']

Name: LEACH, James Albert Smith
Bio: ['a Representative from Iowa; born in Davenport, Scott County, Iowa, \r', 'October 15, 1942; attended the public schools of Davenport, Iowa; B.A., \r', 'Princeton University, Princeton. N.J., 1964; M.A., School of Advanced \r', 'International Studies of Johns Hopkins University, Washington, D.C., 1966; \r', 'London School of Economics, 1966-1968; staff, United States Representative \r', 'Donald Rumsfeld of Illinois, 1965-1966; foreign service officer, United States \r', 'Department of State, 1968-1969; special assistant to director, Office of \r', 'Economic Opportunity, 1969-1970; member, Delegation to Geneva Disarmament \r', 'Conference and United Nations General Assembly, 1971-1972; business executive; \r', 'United Nations Conference on Natural Resources, 1975; member, United States \r', 'Advisory Commission on International Education and Cultural Affairs, 1975; \r', 'director, Federal Home Loan Bank Board, 1975-1976; delegate, Iowa State \r', 'Republican conventions 1974, 1976; elected as a Republican to the Ninety-fifth \r', 'and to the fourteen succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1977-January 3, 2007); \r', 'chair, Committee on Banking and Financial Services (One Hundred Fourth through \r', 'One Hundred Sixth Congresses); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One \r', 'Hundred Tenth Congress in 2006.\r']

Name: LEE, Barbara

Name: LEVIN, Sander Martin
Bio: [' (brother of Carl Levin), \r', 'a Representative from Michigan; born in Detroit, Wayne County, \r', 'Mich., September 6, 1931; graduated from Central High School, Detroit, Mich.; \r', 'B.A., University of Chicago, Chicago, Ill., 1952; M.A., Columbia University, \r', 'New York, N.Y., 1954; LL.B., Harvard University, Cambridge, Mass., 1957; \r', 'lawyer, private practice; member of the Michigan state senate, 1965-1970; \r', 'unsuccessful candidate for Governor of Michigan in 1970 and 1974; assistant \r', 'administrator, United States Agency for International Development, 1977-1981; \r', 'delegate, Democratic National Conventions, 1964 and 1968; elected as a Democrat \r', 'to the Ninety-eighth and to the seventeen succeeding Congresses (January 3, \r', '1983-present); chairman, Committee on Ways and Means (One Hundred Eleventh \r', 'Congress).\r']

Name: LEWIS, Charles Jeremy (Jerry)
Bio: ['a Representative from California; born in Seattle, King County, \r', 'Wash., October 21, 1934; graduated from San Bernardino High School, San \r', 'Bernardino, Calif., 1952; B.A., University of California, Los Angeles, Calif., \r', '1956; Coro Foundation, 1956-1957; insurance businessman; member, San Bernardino \r', 'School Board, San Bernardino, Calif., 1964-1968; staff, United States \r', 'Representative Jerry Pettis of California, 1966; member of the California state \r', 'assembly, 1969-1978; elected as a Republican to the Ninety-sixth and to the \r', 'fifteen succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1979-January 3, 2013); chair, House \r', 'Republican Conference (One Hundred First and One Hundred Second Congresses); \r', 'chair, Committee on Appropriations (One Hundred Ninth Congress); was not a \r', 'candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Thirteenth Congress in \r', '2012.\r']

Name: LEWIS, John R.
Bio: ['a Representative from Georgia; born in Troy, Pike County, Ala., \r', 'February 21, 1940; attended Pike County Training School, Brundidge, Ala.; B.A., \r', 'American Baptist Theological Seminary, Nashville, Tenn., 1961; B.A., Fisk \r', 'University, Nashville, Tenn., 1967; chairman, Student Nonviolent Coordinating \r', 'Committee, 1963-1966; director of ACTION, 1977-1980; community affairs \r', 'director, National Consumer Co-op Bank, Atlanta, 1980-1986; member of the \r', 'Atlanta, Ga., city council, 1982-1986; elected as a Democrat to the One \r', 'Hundredth and to the fifteen succeeding Congresses (January 3, \r', '1987-present).\r']

Name: LEWIS, Ron
Bio: ['a Representative from Kentucky; born in McKell, Greenup County, Ky., September 14, 1946; graduated from McKell High School, McKell, Ky., 1964; B.A., University of Kentucky, Lexington, Ky., 1969; M.A., Morehead State University, Morehead, Ky., 1981; United States Navy Officer Candidate School, Pensacola, Fla., 1972; faculty, Watterson College, Pasadena, Calif., 1980; ordained clergyman and minister, White Mills Baptist Church, White Mills, Ky.; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Third Congress, by special election to fill the vacancy caused by the death of United States Representative William Natcher, reelected to the seven succeeding Congresses (May 24, 1994-January 3, 2009); was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Eleventh Congress in 2008. \r']

Name: LIPINSKI, William Oliver
