Bio: ['a Representative from California; born in Richmond, Contra Costa \r', 'County, Calif., May 17, 1945; A.A., Diablo Valley College, Pleasant Hill, \r', 'Calif., 1965; A.B., San Francisco State University, San Francisco, Calif., \r', '1968; J.D., University of California Law School, Davis, Calif., 1972; lawyer, \r', 'private practice; staff, California state senate majority leader, 1969-1974; \r', 'elected as a Democrat to the Ninety-fourth and to the nineteen succeeding \r', 'Congresses (January 3, 1975-January 3, 2015); was not a candidate for \r', 'reelection to the One Hundred Fourteenth Congress in 2014; chair, Select \r', 'Committee on Children, Youth, and Families (Ninety-eighth through One Hundred \r', 'First Congresses); chair, Committee on Natural Resources (One Hundred Second \r', 'and One Hundred Third Congresses); chair, Committee on Education and Labor (One \r', 'Hundred Tenth and One Hundred Eleventh Congresses).\r']

Name: MILLER, Jefferson B. (Jeff)
Bio: ['a Representative from Florida; born in Pinellas County, Fla., June \r', '27, 1959; B.A., University of Florida, Gainesville, Fla., 1984; real estate \r', 'broker; sheriff’s deputy, Gilchrist County, Fla.; member of the Florida state \r', 'house of representatives, 1998-2001; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred \r', 'Seventh Congress, by special election, to fill the vacancy caused by the \r', 'resignation of United States Representative Joseph Scarborough and reelected to \r', 'the seven succeeding Congresses (October 16, 2001-January 3, 2017); chair, \r', 'Committee on Veterans’ Affairs (One Hundred Twelfth through One Hundred \r', 'Fourteenth Congresses); was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred \r', 'Fifteenth Congress in 2016. \r']

Name: MINK, Patsy Takemoto
Bio: ['a Representative from Hawaii; born Patsy Matsu Takemoto, December 6, \r', '1927, in Paia, Maui County, Hawaii; graduated from Maui High School, Maui, \r', 'Hawaii, 1944; attended Wilson College, Chambersburg, Pa., 1946; attended the \r', 'University of Nebraska, Lincoln, Nebr., 1947; B.A., University of Hawaii, \r', 'Manoa, Hawaii, 1948; J.D., University of Chicago Law School, Chicago, Ill., \r', '1951; lawyer, private practice; lecturer, University of Hawaii, 1952-1956, \r', '1959-1962, and 1979-1981; attorney for Hawaii territorial house of \r', 'representatives, 1955; member of the Hawaii territorial house of \r', 'representatives, 1956-1958; member of the Hawaii territorial senate, 1958-1959; \r', 'member of the Hawaii state senate, 1962-1964; delegate to the Democratic \r', 'National Convention, 1960, 1972, 1980, and 1984; elected as a Democrat to the \r', 'Eighty-ninth and to the five succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1965-January 3, \r', '1977); was not a candidate for reelection to the Ninety-fifth Congress in 1976, \r', 'but was an unsuccessful candidate for nomination to the United States Senate; \r', 'Assistant Secretary of State for Oceans and International Environmental and \r', 'Scientific Affairs, 1977-1978; president, Americans for Democratic Action, \r', '1978-1981; member, Honolulu, Hawaii, city council, 1983-1987, chair, 1983-1985; \r', 'elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred First Congress in a special election \r', 'to fill the vacancy caused by the resignation of United States Representative \r', 'Daniel K. Akaka; reelected to the seven succeeding Congresses (September 22, \r', '1990-September 28, 2002); died on September 28, 2002, in Honolulu, Hawaii; \r', 'posthumously elected to the One Hundred Eighth Congress in 2002; interment in \r', 'National Memorial Cemetery of the Pacific, Honolulu, Hawaii.\r']

Name: MOAKLEY, John Joseph
Bio: ['a Representative from Massachusetts; born in Boston, Suffolk County, \r', 'Mass., April 27, 1927; attended University of Miami, Miami, Fla., 1950-1951; \r', 'LL.B., Suffolk University Law School, Boston, Mass., 1956; United States Navy, \r', '1943-1946; admitted to the Massachusetts bar, 1957; member of the Massachusetts \r', 'state house of representatives, 1953-1963; member of the Massachusetts state \r', 'senate, 1964-1970; delegate, Democratic National Convention, 1968; Boston, \r', 'Mass., city council, 1971-1973; unsuccessful candidate for election to the \r', 'United States House of Representatives in 1970; elected as an \r', 'Independent-Democrat to the Ninety-third Congress, but changed party \r', 'affiliation to Democrat on January 2, 1973; reelected as a Democrat to the \r', 'fourteen succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1973-May 28, 2001); chairman, \r', 'Committee on Rules (One Hundred First through One Hundred Third Congresses); \r', 'died on May 28, 2001, in Bethesda, Md.; interment in Blue Hills Cemetery, \r', 'Braintree, Mass.\r']

Name: MOLLOHAN, Alan Bowlby
Bio: [' (son of Robert H. Mollohan), \r', 'a Representative from West Virginia; born in Fairmont, Marion \r', 'County, W.Va., May 14, 1943; graduated from Greenbrier Military School, \r', 'Lewisburg, W.Va., 1962; A.B., College of William and Mary, Williamsburg, Va., \r', '1966; LL.D., West Virginia University, Morgantown, W.Va., 1970; lawyer, private \r', 'practice; United States Army Reserves, 1970-1983; delegate, Democratic National \r', 'Convention, 1968, 1972, and 1976; elected as a Democrat to the Ninety-eighth \r', 'and to the thirteen succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1983-January 3, 2011); \r', 'unsuccessful candidate for nomination for One Hundred Twelfth Congress in 2010. \r']

Name: MOORE, Dennis
Bio: ['a Representative from Kansas; born in Anthony, Harper County, Kans., \r', 'November 8, 1945; attended Wichita Southeast High School, Wichita, Kans.; B.A., \r', 'University of Kansas, Lawrence, Kans., 1967; J.D., Washburn University School \r', 'of Law, Topeka, Kans., 1970; United States Army, 1970; United States Army \r', 'Reserve, 1970-1973; lawyer, private practice; Kansas state assistant attorney \r', 'general, 1971-1973; district attorney, Johnson County, Kans., 1977-1989; board \r', 'of trustees, Johnson County, Kans., Community College, 1993-1999; elected as a \r', 'Democrat to the One Hundred Sixth and to the five succeeding Congresses \r', '(January 3, 1999-January 3, 2011); was not a candidate for reelection to the \r', 'One Hundred Twelfth Congress in 2010.\r']

Name: MORAN, James P.
Bio: ['a Representative from Virginia; born in Buffalo, Erie County, N.Y., \r', 'May 16, 1945; B.A., College of the Holy Cross, Worcester, Mass., 1967; attended \r', 'the Bernard Baruch School of Finance, City University of New York, New York, \r', 'N.Y., 1967-1968; M.P.A., University of Pittsburgh, Pittsburgh, Pa., 1970; \r', 'attended the University of Southern California, Los Angeles, Calif., 1978; \r', 'investment banker; comptroller and budget analyst, United States Department of \r', 'Health, Education, and Welfare, 1968-1974; policy specialist, Congressional \r', 'Research Service, Library of Congress, 1974-1976; staff, United States Senate \r', 'Committee on Appropriations, 1976-1979; member of the Alexandria, Va., city \r', 'council, 1979-1982; vice mayor of Alexandria, Va., 1982-1984; mayor of \r', 'Alexandria, Va., 1985-1990; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Second and \r', 'to the eleven succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1991-January 3, 2015); was not \r', 'a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Fourteenth Congress in \r', '2014.\r']

Name: MORAN, Jerry
Bio: ['a Senator and a Representative from Kansas; born in Great Bend, \r', 'Barton County, Kans., May 29, 1954; attended Plainville High School, \r', 'Plainville, Kans.; graduated University of Kansas, Lawrence, Kans., B.S., 1976; \r', 'graduated Kansas University School of Law, Lawrence, Kans., J.D., 1981; M.B.A. \r', 'candidate, Fort Hays State University, Hays, Kans.; bank officer; instructor, \r', 'Fort Hays State University, Hays, Kans.; member of the Kansas state senate \r', '1989-1997, serving as vice president 1993-1995, majority leader 1995-1997; \r', 'Kansas state special assistant attorney general 1982-1985; deputy attorney, \r', 'Rooks County, Kans. 1987-1995; University of Kansas School of Law, Lawrence, \r', 'Kans., board of governors, serving as vice president 1993-1994, and as \r', 'president 1994-1995; board of directors, Kansas chamber of commerce and \r', 'industry 1996-1997; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Fifth Congress \r', 'and to the six succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1997-January 3, 2011); was not \r', 'a candidate for reelection to the House of Representatives but was elected as a \r', 'Republican to the United States Senate in 2010; reelected in 2016 for the term \r', 'ending January 3, 2023; chair, National Republican Senatorial Committee \r', '(2012-2014). \r']

Name: MORELLA, Constance A.
Bio:
['a Representative from Maryland; born Constance Albanese in \r', 'Somerville, Middlesex County, Mass., February 12, 1931; graduated from \r', 'Somerville High School, Somerville, Mass., 1948; A.B., Boston University, \r', 'Boston, Mass., 1954; M.A., American University, Washington, D.C., 1967; \r', 'professor, Montgomery College, 1970-1986; member of the Montgomery County, Md., \r', 'commission for women, 1971-1975; member of the Maryland state house of \r', 'delegates, 1979-1986; unsuccessful candidate for nomination to the House of \r', 'Representatives in 1980; elected as a Republican to the One Hundredth and to \r', 'the seven succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1987-January 3, 2003); unsuccessful \r', 'candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Eighth Congress in 2002; United \r', 'States Ambassador to the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development, \r', '2003-2007; faculty member, American University, Washington, D. C. \r', '


\r', '

Bibliography

”Constance A. Morella” in \r', 'Women in Congress, 1917-2006. Prepared under the direction of \r', 'the Committee on House Administration by the Office of History & \r', 'Preservation, U. S. House of Representatives. Washington: Government Printing \r', 'Office, 2006.\r']

Name: MURTHA, John Patrick, Jr.
Bio:
['a Representative from Pennsylvania; born in New Martinsville, Wetzel \r', 'County, W.Va., June 17, 1932; graduated from Ramsey High School, Mount \r', 'Pleasant, Pa., 1950; attended Kiskiminetas Spring School, 1951; B.A., \r', 'University of Pittsburgh, Pittsburgh, Pa., 1962; attended Indiana University of \r', 'Pennsylvania, Indiana, Pa., 1963; United States Marine Corps, 1952-1955, and \r', '1966-1967; United States Marine Corps Reserves, 1955-1966, and 1967-1990; \r', 'member of the Pennsylvania state house of representatives, 1969-1974; elected \r', 'as a Democrat to the Ninety-third Congress by special election, to fill the \r', 'vacancy caused by the death of United States Representative John P. Saylor, \r', 'reelected to the eighteen succeeding Congresses (February 5, 1974-February 8, \r', '2010); died on February 8, 2010, in Arlington, Va. \r', '


\r', '

Bibliography

Murtha, John P., with John Plashal. \r', 'From Vietnam to 9/11: On the Front Lines of National Security. \r', 'University Park, PA: Pennsylvania State University Press, 2005.\r']

Name: MYRICK, Sue
Bio: ['a Representative from North Carolina; born in Tiffin, Seneca County, \r', 'Ohio, August 1, 1941; graduated from Port Clinton High School, Port Clinton, \r', 'Ohio; attended Heidelberg College, Tiffin, Ohio, 1959-1960; at-large member, \r', 'Charlotte, N.C., city council, 1983-1985; mayor, Charlotte, N.C., 1987-1991; \r', 'unsuccessful candidate for nomination to the United States Senate in 1992; \r', 'elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Fourth and to the eight succeeding \r', 'Congresses (January 3, 1995-January 3, 2013); was not a candidate for \r', 'reelection to the One Hundred Thirteenth Congress in 2012.\r']

Name: NADLER, Jerrold Lewis
Bio: ['a Representative from New York; born in Brooklyn, Kings County, New \r', 'York, June 13, 1947; graduated from Stuyvesant High School, New York, N.Y., \r', '1965; B.A., Columbia University, New York, N.Y., 1969; J.D., Fordham \r', 'University, New York, N.Y., 1978; legislative assistant, New York state \r', 'assembly, 1972; member of the New York state assembly, 1977-1992; elected as a \r', 'Democrat to the One Hundred Second Congress, by special election, to fill the \r', 'vacancy caused by the death of United States Representative Theodore S. Weiss, \r', 'and to the thirteen succeeding Congresses (November 3, \r', '1992-present).\r']

Name: NAPOLITANO, Grace Flores
Bio: ['a Representative from California; born in Brownsville, Cameron \r', 'County, Tex., December 4, 1936; graduated from Brownsville High School, \r', 'Brownsville, Tex., 1954; attended Cerritos College, Norwalk, Calif.; attended \r', 'Texas Southmost College, Brownsville, Tex.; member of the Norwalk, Calif., city \r', 'council, 1986; Mayor of Norwalk, Calif., 1989-1990; member of the California \r', 'state assembly, 1992-1998; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Sixth and \r', 'to the nine succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1999-present).\r']

Name: NEAL, Richard Edmund
Bio: ['a Representative from Massachusetts; born in Springfield, Hampden \r', 'County, Mass., February 14, 1949; graduated from Springfield Technical High \r', 'School, Springfield, Mass., 1968; B.A., American International College, \r', 'Springfield, Mass., 1972; M.A., University of Hartford, West Hartford, Conn., \r', '1976; staff, Mayor William C. Sullivan, Springfield, Mass., 1973-1978; member \r', 'of the Springfield, Mass., city council, 1978-1984; Mayor of Springfield, \r', 'Mass., 1984-1988; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred First and to the \r', 'fourteen succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1989-present). \r']

Name: NETHERCUTT, George R., Jr.
Bio: ['a Representative from Washington; born in Spokane, Spokane County, \r', 'Wash., October 7, 1944; graduated from North Central High School, Spokane, \r', 'Wash.; B.A., Washington State University, Spokane, Wash., 1967; J.D., Gonzaga \r', 'University School of Law, Spokane, Wash., 1971; clerk to United States Judge \r', 'Raymond E. Plummer of the District of Alaska, 1971-1972; staff counsel and \r', 'chief of staff to United States Senator Ted Stevens of Alaska, 1972-1977; \r', 'lawyer, private practice; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Fourth and \r', 'to the four succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1995- January 3, 2005); not a \r', 'candidate for reelection, but was an unsuccessful candidate to the United \r', 'States Senate in 2004.\r']

Name: NEY, Robert William
Bio:
['a Representative from Ohio; born in Wheeling, Ohio County, W.Va., \r', 'July 5, 1954; B.S., Ohio State University, 1976; public safety director of \r', 'Bellaire, Ohio; program manager, health and education, Ohio Office of \r', 'Appalachia; teacher; member of the Ohio state house of representatives, \r', '1981-1983; member of the Ohio state senate, 1985-1995; elected as a Republican \r', 'to the One Hundred Fourth and to the five succeeding Congresses until his \r', 'resignation on November 3, 2006 (January 3, 1995-November 3, 2006); chair, \r', 'Committee on House Administration (One Hundred Seventh through One Hundred \r', 'Ninth Congresses). \r', '


\r', '

Bibliography

Ney, Robert. \r', 'Sideswiped: Lessons Learned Courtesy of the Hit Men of Capitol \r', 'Hill. Cleveland, OH: Changing Lives Press, 2013.\r']

Name: NORTHUP, Anne Meagher
Bio:
['a Representative from Kentucky; born in Louisville, Jefferson \r', 'County, Ky., January 22, 1948; graduated from Sacred Heart Academy, Louisville, \r', 'Ky., 1966; B.A., Saint Mary’s College, 1970; member of the Kentucky state house \r', 'of representatives, 1987-1996; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Fifth \r', 'and to the four succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1997-January 3, 2007); \r', 'unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Tenth Congress in \r', '2006. \r', '


\r', '

Bibliography

”Anne Meagher Northup” in \r', 'Women in Congress, 1917-2006. Prepared under the direction of \r', 'the Committee on House Administration by the Office of History & \r', 'Preservation, U. S. House of Representatives. Washington: Government Printing \r', 'Office, 2006.\r']

Name: NORWOOD, Charles W., Jr.
Bio: ['a Representative from Georgia; born in Valdosta, Lowndes County, \r', 'Ga., July 27, 1941; graduated from Baylor Military High School, Chattanooga, \r', 'Tenn., 1959; B.A., Georgia Southern University, Statesboro, Ga., 1964; D.D.S., \r', 'Georgetown University Dental School, Washington, D.C, 1967; United States Army, \r', '1967-1969; dentist; business owner; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred \r', 'Fourth and to the six succeeding Congresses, served until his death on February \r', '13, 2007 (January 3, 1995-February 13, 2007). \r']

Name: NUSSLE, James Allen
Bio: ['a Representative from Iowa; born in Des Moines, Polk County, Iowa, \r', 'June 27, 1960; B.A., Luther College, Decorah, Iowa, 1983; J.D., Drake \r', 'University, Des Moines, Iowa, 1985; lawyer, private practice; Delaware County, \r', 'Iowa, attorney, 1986-1990; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Second \r', 'and to the seven succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1991-January 3, 2007); \r', 'chair, Committee on the Budget (One Hundred Seventh through One Hundred Ninth \r', 'Congresses); not a candidate for reelection, but was an unsuccessful candidate \r', 'for Governor of Iowa in 2006; Director, Office of Management and Budget, in the \r', 'cabinet of President George W. Bush, 2007-2009.\r']

Name: OBERSTAR, James Louis
Bio: ['a Representative from Minnesota; born in Chisholm, St. Louis County, \r', 'Minn., September 10, 1934; graduated from Chisholm High School, Chisholm, \r', 'Minn., 1952; B.A., College of St. Thomas, St. Paul, Minn., 1956; M.A., College \r', 'of Europe, Bruges, Belgium, 1957; staff for United States Representative John \r', 'Anton Blatnik of Minnesota, 1963-1974; administrator of the Committee on Public \r', 'Works, United States House of Representatives, 1971-1974; elected as a Democrat \r', 'to the Ninety-fourth and to the seventeen succeeding Congresses (January 3, \r', '1975-January 3, 2011); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One Hundred \r', 'Twelfth Congress in 2010; chair, Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure \r', '(One Hundred Tenth and One Hundred Eleventh Congresses); died on May 3, 2014, \r', 'in Potomac, Md. \r']

Name: OBEY, David Ross
Bio:
['a Representative from Wisconsin; born in Okmulgee, Okmulgee County, Okla., October 3, 1938; graduated from Wausau High School, Wausau, Wis., 1956; B.S., University of Wisconsin, Madison, Wis., 1960; M.A., University of Wisconsin, Madison, Wis., 1962; real estate broker; member of the Wisconsin state assembly, 1963-1969; elected as a Democrat to the Ninety-first Congress to fill the vacancy caused by the resignation of United States Representative Melvin R. Laird, and reelected to the twenty succeeding Congresses (April 1, 1969-January 3, 2011); not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Twelfth Congress in 2010; chair, Joint Economic Committee (Ninety-ninth Congress); chair, Committee on Appropriations (One Hundred Third, One Hundred Tenth and One Hundred Eleventh Congresses). \r', '


\r', '

Bibliography

Obey, David R. \r', 'Raising Hell for Justice: The Washington Battles of a Heartland Progressive. Madison: University of Wisconsin Press, 2007. \r']

Name: OLVER, John Walter
Bio: ['a Representative from Massachusetts; born in Honesdale, Wayne \r', 'County, Pa., September 3, 1936; B.S., Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute, Troy, \r', 'N.Y., 1955; M.S., Tufts University, Medford, Mass., 1956; Ph.D., Massachusetts \r', 'Institute of Technology, Cambridge, Mass., 1961; instructor, Franklin Technical \r', 'Institute, Joplin, Mo., 1956-1958; Massachusetts Institute of Technology, \r', 'Cambridge, Mass., 1961-1962; faculty, University of Massachusetts, Amherst, \r', 'Mass., 1962-1969; member of the Massachusetts state house of representatives, \r', '1969-1972; member of the Massachusetts state senate, 1973-1991; elected as a \r', 'Democrat to the One Hundred Second Congress, by special election to fill the \r', 'vacancy caused by the death of United States Representative Silvio O. Conte, \r', 'reelected to the ten succeeding Congresses (June 4, 1991-January 3, 2013); was \r', 'not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Thirteenth Congress in 2012. \r']

Name: ORTIZ, Solomon P.
Bio:
['a Representative from Texas; born in Robstown, Nueces County, Tex., \r', 'June 3, 1937; attended Robstown High School, Robstown, Tex.; attended Del Mar \r', 'College, Corpus Christi, Tex., 1965-1967; United States Army, 1960-1962; \r', 'insurance agent; Nueces County, Tex., constable, 1965-1968; Nueces County, \r', 'Tex., commissioner, 1969-1976; Nueces County, Tex., sheriff, 1976-1982; elected \r', 'as a Democrat to the Ninety-eighth and to the thirteen succeeding Congresses \r', '(January 3, 1983-January 3, 2011); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the \r', 'One Hundred Twelfth Congress in 2010. \r', '


\r', '

Bibliography

”Solomon P. Ortiz” in \r', 'Hispanic Americans in Congress, 1822-2012. Prepared under the \r', 'direction of the Committee on House Administration by the Office of the \r', 'Historian and the Office of the Clerk, U.S. House of Representatives. \r', 'Washington: Government Printing Office, 2013.\r']

Name: OSBORNE, Thomas
Bio: ['a Representative from Nebraska; born in Hastings, Adams County, \r', 'Nebr., February 23, 1937; graduated from Hastings High School, Hastings, Nebr.; \r', 'B.S., Hastings College, Hastings, Nebr., 1959; M.A., University of Nebraska, \r', 'Lincoln, Nebr., 1963; Ph.D., University of Nebraska, Lincoln, Nebr., 1965; \r', 'Nebraska Army National Guard, 1960-1966; head football coach, University of \r', 'Nebraska, 1972-1997; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Seventh and to \r', 'the two succeeding Congresses (January 3, 2001-January 3, 2007); not a \r', 'candidate for reelection, but was an unsuccessful candidate for the Republican \r', 'nomination for Governor of Nebraska in 2006.\r']

Name: OSE, Doug
Bio: ['a Representative from California; born in Sacramento, Sacramento, \r', 'Calif., June 27, 1955; graduated from Rio Americano High School, Sacramento, \r', 'Calif.; B.S., University of California, Berkeley, Calif., 1977; elected as a \r', 'Republican to the One Hundred Sixth and to the two succeeding Congresses \r', '(January 3, 1999-January 3, 2005); was not a candidate for reelection to the \r', 'One Hundred Ninth Congress in 2004; was an unsuccessful candidate for election \r', 'to the One Hundred Fourteenth Congress in 2014.\r']

Name: OTTER, C. L. (Butch)
Bio: ['a Representative from Idaho; born in Caldwell, Canyon County, Idaho, \r', 'May 3, 1942; B.A., College of Idaho (now Alberston College of Idaho), Caldwell, \r', 'Idaho, 1967; Idaho Army National Guard, 1968-1973; member of the Idaho state \r', 'house of representatives, 1972-1976; business executive; Idaho state lieutenant \r', 'governor, 1987-2001; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Seventh and to \r', 'the two succeeding Congresses (January 3, 2001-January 3, 2007); was not a \r', 'candidate for reelection to the United States House of Representatives in 2006; \r', 'Governor of Idaho, 2007-present.\r']

Name: OWENS, Major Robert Odell
Bio:
['a Representative from New York; born in Collierville, Shelby County, \r', 'Tenn., June 28, 1936; graduated from Hamilton High School, Memphis, Tenn.; \r', 'B.A., Morehouse College, Atlanta, Ga., 1956; M.S., Atlanta University (now \r', 'Clark Atlanta), Atlanta, Ga., 1957; chair, Brooklyn Congress of Racial \r', 'Equality; vice president, Metropolitan Council of Housing, N.Y., 1964; \r', 'community coordinator, Brooklyn Public Library, Brooklyn, N.Y., 1964-1966; \r', 'executive director, Brownsville Community Council, 1966-1968; commissioner, \r', 'Community Development Agency, New York, N.Y., 1968-1973; director, community \r', 'media library program, Columbia University, New York, N.Y., 1973-1975; member \r', 'of the New York state senate, 1974-1982; served on International Commission on \r', 'Ways of Implementing Social Policy to Ensure Maximum Public Participation and \r', 'Social Justice for Minorities at The Hague, Netherlands, 1972; elected as a \r', 'Democrat to the Ninety-eighth Congress and to the eleven succeeding Congresses \r', '(January 3, 1983-January 3, 2007); not a candidate for reelection to the One \r', 'Hundred Tenth Congress in 2006; died on October 21, 2013, in New York City, \r', 'N.Y. \r', '


\r', '

Bibliography

”Major Robert Odell Owens” in \r', 'Black Americans in Congress, 1870-2007. Prepared under the \r', 'direction of the Committee on House Administration by the Office of History \r', '& Preservation, U. S. House of Representatives. Washington: Government \r', 'Printing Office, 2008.\r']

Name: OXLEY, Michael Garver
Bio: ['a Representative from Ohio; born in Findlay, Hancock County, Ohio, \r', 'February 11, 1944; B.A., Miami University, Oxford, Ohio, 1966; J.D., Ohio State \r', 'University College of Law, Columbus, Ohio, 1969; Federal Bureau of \r', 'Investigation, 1969-1972; lawyer, private practice; member of the Ohio state \r', 'house of representatives, 1972-1981; delegate to Ohio state Republican \r', 'conventions, 1972-1980; delegate to Republican National Conventions, 1976 and \r', '1984; elected as a Republican to the Ninety-seventh Congress by special \r', 'election, to fill the vacancy caused by the death of United States \r', 'Representative Tennyson Guyer, reelected to the twelve succeeding Congresses \r', '(June 25, 1981-January 3, 2007); chair, Committee on Financial Services (One \r', 'Hundred Seventh through One Hundred Ninth Congresses); not a candidate for \r', 'reelection to the One Hundred Tenth Congress in 2006; died on January 1, 2016, \r', 'in McLean, Va.\r']

Name: PALLONE, Frank, Jr.
Bio: ['a Representative from New Jersey; born in Long Branch, Monmouth \r', 'County, N.J., October 30, 1951; graduated from Long Branch High School, Long \r', 'Branch, N.J., 1969; B.A., Middlebury College, Middlebury, Vt., 1973; M.A., \r', 'Fletcher School of Law and Diplomacy, Tufts University, Medford, Mass., 1974; \r', 'J.D., Rutgers University School of Law, Camden, N.J., 1978; lawyer, private \r', 'practice; member of the Long Branch, N.J., city council, 1982-1988; member of \r', 'the New Jersey state senate, 1983-1988; elected as a Democrat to the One \r', 'Hundredth Congress, by special election, to fill the vacancy caused by the \r', 'death of United States Representative James John Howard, but was not sworn in \r', 'because Congress had adjourned; elected simultaneously to the One Hundred First \r', 'Congress and reelected to the fourteen succeeding Congresses (November 8, \r', '1988-present); unsuccessful candidate for nomination to the United States \r', 'Senate in 2013.\r']

Name: PASCRELL, William J., Jr.
Bio: ['a Representative from New Jersey; born in Paterson, Passaic County, \r', 'N.J., January 25, 1937; graduated from St. John the Baptist High School, \r', 'Paterson, N.J., 1955; B.A., Fordham University, New York, N.Y., 1959; M.A., \r', 'Fordham University, New York, N.Y., 1961; United States Army, 1961-1962; United \r', 'States Army Reserve, 1962-1967; teacher; president of the Paterson, N.J., board \r', 'of education, 1979-1982; member of the New Jersey state general assembly, \r', '1988-1996, minority leader pro tempore; mayor of Paterson, N.J., 1990-1996; \r', 'elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Fifth and to the ten succeeding \r', 'Congresses (January 3, 1997-present).\r']

Name: PASTOR, Ed
Bio: ['a Representative from Arizona; born in Claypool, Gila County, Ariz., \r', 'June 28, 1943; B.A., Arizona State University, Tempe, Ariz., 1966; J.D., \r', 'Arizona State College of Law, Tempe, Ariz., 1974; staff, Arizona Governor Raul \r', 'Castro, 1971-1972; Maricopa County, Ariz., supervisor, 1977-1991; delegate, \r', 'Democratic National Conventions, 1972-2008; elected as a Democrat to the One \r', 'Hundred Second Congress, by special election, to fill the vacancy caused by the \r', 'resignation of United States Representative Morris K. Udall, and reelected to \r', 'the eleven succeeding Congresses (September 24, 1991-January 3, 2015); was not \r', 'a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Fourteenth Congress in 2014; died \r', 'on November 28, 2018, in Phoenix, Ariz.\r']

Name: PAUL, Ronald Ernest
Bio: [' (father of Rand Paul), \r', 'a Representative from Texas; born in Pittsburgh, Allegheny County, \r', 'Pa., August 20, 1935; graduated from Dormont High School, Dormont, Pa., 1953; \r', 'B.A., Gettysburg College, Gettysburg, Pa., 1957; M.D., Duke University Medical \r', 'Center, Durham, N.C., 1961; internship and residency training, Henry Ford \r', 'Hospital, Detroit, Mich., 1961 and 1962; obstetrics and gynecology training, \r', 'University of Pittsburgh, Pittsburgh, Pa., 1965-1968; medical doctor; United \r', 'States Air Force, 1963-1965; United States Air National Guard, 1965-1968; \r', 'delegate, Texas state Republican convention, 1974; unsuccessful candidate for \r', 'election to the Ninety-fourth Congress in 1974; elected as a Republican to the \r', 'Ninety-fourth Congress, by special election to fill the vacancy created by the \r', 'resignation of United States Representative Robert R. Casey (April 3, \r', '1976-January 3, 1977); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the \r', 'Ninety-fifth Congress in 1976; elected to the Ninety-sixth and to the two \r', 'succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1979-January 3, 1985); was not a candidate \r', 'for reelection to the House of Representatives in 1984, but was an unsuccessful \r', 'candidate for nomination to the United States Senate; author; unsuccessful \r', 'Libertarian Party candidate for election for President of the United States in \r', '1988; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Fifth and to the seven \r', 'succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1997-January 3, 2013); unsuccessful candidate \r', 'for the Republican presidential nomination in 2008; unsuccessful candidate for \r', 'the Republican presidential nomination in 2012; was not a candidate for \r', 'reelection to the One Hundred Thirteenth Congress in 2012. \r']

Name: PAYNE, Donald Milford
Bio:
['(father of Donald Payne, Jr.), a Representative from New Jersey; \r', 'born in Newark, Essex County, N.J., July 16, 1934; graduated from Barringer \r', 'High School, Newark, N.J., 1952; B.A., Seton Hall University, South Orange, \r', 'N.J., 1957; teacher; insurance executive; president, Young Men’s Christian \r', 'Association of the United States (YMCA), 1970-1973; member, Essex County, N.J., \r', 'board of chosen freeholders, 1972-1978; unsuccessful candidate for nomination \r', 'to the Ninety-seventh Congress in 1980; member of the Newark, N.J., Municipal \r', 'Council, 1982-1988; chairman, Essex county Democratic committee, 2003-2004; \r', 'unsuccessful candidate for nomination to the One Hundredth Congress in 1986; \r', 'elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred First and to the eleven succeeding \r', 'Congresses (January 3, 1989-March 6, 2012); died on March 6, 2012, in \r', 'Livingston, N.J. \r', '


\r', '

Bibliography

”Donald M. Payne” in \r', 'Black Americans in Congress, 1870-2007. Prepared under the \r', 'direction of the Committee on House Administration by the Office of History \r', '& Preservation, U.S. House of Representatives. Washington: Government \r', 'Printing Office, 2008.\r']

Name: PELOSI, Nancy
Bio: [" (daughter of Thomas D'Alesandro, Jr.), \r", 'a Representative from California; born Nancy D’Alesandro in \r', 'Baltimore, Md., March 26, 1940; graduated from the Institute of Notre Dame, \r', 'Baltimore, Md., 1958; A.B., Trinity College, 1962; chair, California state \r', 'Democratic Party, 1981-1983; finance chairman, Democratic Senatorial Campaign \r', 'Committee, 1985-1986; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundredth Congress, by \r', 'special election, to fill the vacancy caused by the death of United States \r', 'Representative Sala Burton of California, and reelected to the fifteen \r', 'succeeding Congresses (June 2, 1987-present); minority whip (One Hundred \r', 'Seventh Congress); minority leader (One Hundred Eighth, One Hundred Ninth, and \r', 'One Hundred Twelfth through One Hundred Fifteenth Congresses); Speaker of the \r', 'House (One Hundred Tenth and One Hundred Eleventh Congresses). \r']

Name: PENCE, Mike
Bio: ['a Representative from Indiana and a Vice President of the United \r', 'States; born in Columbus, Bartholomew County, Ind., June 7, 1959; graduated \r', 'from Hanover College, Hanover, Ind., 1981; J.D., Robert H. McKinney School of \r', 'Law, Indiana University, Indianapolis, Ind., 1986; unsuccessful candidate for \r', 'election to the United States House of Representatives in 1988 and 1990; \r', 'elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Seventh and to the five succeeding \r', 'Congresses (January 3, 2001-January 3, 2013); House Republican Conference Chair \r', '(One Hundred Eleventh Congress); was not a candidate for reelection to the One \r', 'Hundredth Thirteenth Congress in 2012; Governor of Indiana, 2013-2017; elected \r', 'Vice President of the United States on the Republican ticket headed by Donald \r', 'Trump, and was inaugurated on January 20, 2017.\r']

Name: PETERSON, Collin Clark
Bio: ['a Representative from Minnesota; born in Fargo, Cass County, N.D., \r', 'June 29, 1944; B.A., Moorhead State University, Moorhead, Minn., 1966; United \r', 'States Army National Guard, 1963-1969; certified public accountant; member of \r', 'the Minnesota state senate, 1977-1986; unsuccessful candidate for election to \r', 'the Ninety-ninth Congress in 1984 and to the One Hundredth Congress in 1986; \r', 'unsuccessful candidate for nomination to the One Hundred First Congress in \r', '1988; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Second and to the thirteen \r', 'succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1991-present); chair, Committee on \r', 'Agriculture (One Hundred Tenth and One Hundred Eleventh \r', 'Congresses).\r']

Name: PETERSON, John
Bio: ['a Representative from Pennsylvania; born in Titusville, Crawford \r', 'County, Pa., December 25, 1938; graduated from Titusville High School, \r', 'Titusville, Pa.; attended Pennsylvania State University; United States Army, \r', '1958-1964; member of the Pleasantville Borough, Pa., city council, 1969-1977; \r', 'member of the Pennsylvania state house of representatives, 1977-1984; member of \r', 'the Pennsylvania state senate, 1985-1996; elected as a Republican to the One \r', 'Hundred Fifth and to the five succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1997-January 3, \r', '2009); was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Eleventh Congress \r', 'in 2008.\r']

Name: PETRI, Thomas Evert
Bio: ['a Representative from Wisconsin; born in Marinette, Marinette County, Wis., May 28, 1940; graduated from Lowell P. Goodrich High School, Fond du Lac, Wis., 1958; A.B., Harvard University, Cambridge, Mass., 1962; J.D., Harvard Law School, Cambridge, Mass., 1965; clerk to United States Judge James Doyle of the Western District of Wisconsin, 1965; lawyer, private practice; Peace Corps volunteer, 1966-1967; White House aide, 1969-1970; member of the Wisconsin state senate, 1973-1979; delegate to the Republican state conventions, 1973 to present; unsuccessful candidate for election to the United States Senate in 1974; elected as a Republican to the Ninety-sixth Congress, by special election, to fill the vacancy caused by the death of United States Representative William A. Steiger, and reelected to the seventeen succeeding Congresses (April 3, 1979-January 3, 2015); was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Fourteenth Congress in 2014. \r']

Name: PHELPS, David Dwain
Bio: ['a Representative from Illinois; born in Eldorado, Saline County, Illinois,  October 26, \r', '1947;  attended Eldorado Township High School, Eldorado, Ill.;  B.S., Southern Illinois University, \r', '1969;  teacher;  school administrator;  clerk and recorder of Saline County, Ill., 1980-1984;  member \r', 'of the Illinois state general assembly, 1984-1998;  elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Sixth \r', 'Congress and to the succeeding Congress (January 3, 1999-January 3, 2003);  unsuccessful candidate \r', 'for reelection to the One Hundred Eighth Congress in 2002.\r']

Name: PICKERING, Charles W. (Chip), Jr.
Bio: ['a Representative from Mississippi; born in Laurel, Jones County, \r', 'Miss., August 10, 1963; graduated from R.H. Watkins High School, Laurel, Miss.; \r', 'B.A., University of Mississippi, University, Miss., 1986; M.B.A., Baylor \r', 'University, Waco, Tex., 1989; staff for United States Senator Trent Lott of \r', 'Mississippi, 1992-1996; United States Department of Agriculture, 1989-1990; \r', 'elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Fifth and to the five succeeding \r', 'Congresses (January 3, 1997-January 3, 2009); was not a candidate for \r', 'reelection to the One Hundred Eleventh Congress in 2008.\r']

Name: PITTS, Joseph R.
Bio: ['a Representative from Pennsylvania; born in Lexington, Fayette \r', 'County, Ky., October 10, 1939; B.A., Asbury College, Wilmore, Ky., 1961; M.Ed., \r', 'West Chester University of Pennsylvania, West Chester, Pa., 1972; United States \r', 'Air Force, 1963-1969; business owner; teacher; member of the Pennsylvania state \r', 'house of representatives, 1973-1997; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred \r', 'Fifth and to the nine succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1997-January 3, 2017); \r', 'was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Fifteenth Congress in \r', '2016.\r']

Name: PLATTS, Todd
Bio: [' a Representative from Pennsylvania; born in York, York County, Pa., \r', 'March 5, 1962; attended York Suburban High School, York, Pa., 1980; B.S., \r', 'Shippensburg University, Shippensburg, Pa., 1984; J.D., Pepperdine University \r', 'School of Law,Pepperdine University, Malibu, Calif., 1991; member of the \r', 'Pennsylvania state house of representatives, 1992-2000; elected as a Republican \r', 'to the One Hundred Seventh and to the five succeeding Congresses (January 3, \r', '2001-January 3, 2013); was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred \r', 'Thirteenth Congress in 2012; judge, Common Pleas Court, York County, Pa., \r', 'nineteenth district, 2014-present.\r']

Name: POMBO, Richard William
Bio: ['a Representative from California; born in Tracy, San Joaquin County, \r', 'Calif., January 8, 1961; attended California State Polytechnic University, \r', 'Pomona, Calif., 1979-1982; farmer; rancher; co-founder, San Joaquin County \r', 'Citizens Land Alliance; member of the Tracy, Calif., city council, 1991-1992; \r', 'elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Third and to the six succeeding \r', 'Congresses (January 3, 1993-January 3, 2007); chair, Committee on Resources \r', '(One Hundred Eighth and One Hundred Ninth Congress); unsuccessful candidate for \r', 'reelection to the One Hundred Tenth Congress in 2006; unsuccessful candidate \r', 'for the Republican nomination for the U.S. House of Representatives, 2010. \r']

Name: POMEROY, Earl Ralph, III
Bio: ['a Representative from North Dakota; born in Valley City, Barnes \r', 'County, N.Dak., September 2, 1952; B.A., University of North Dakota, Grand \r', 'Folks, N.Dak., 1974, attended the University of Durham, Durham, England, \r', '1975-1976; J.D., University of North Dakota School of Law, Grand Folks, N.Dak., \r', '1979; lawyer, private practice; member of the North Dakota state house of \r', 'representatives, 1981-1985; North Dakota state insurance commissioner, \r', '1985-1992; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Third and to the eight \r', 'succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1993-January 3, 2011); unsuccessful candidate \r', 'for reelection to the One Hundred Twelfth Congress in 2010.\r']

Name: PORTMAN, Robert Jones (Rob)
Bio: ['a Senator and a Representative from Ohio; born in Cincinnati, \r', 'Hamilton County, Ohio, December 19, 1955; graduated from the Cincinnati Country \r', 'Day School, Cincinnati, Ohio; graduated Dartmouth College, Hanover, N.H., B.A., \r', '1979; graduated University of Michigan School of Law, Ann Arbor, Mich., J.D., \r', '1984; associate counsel to President George H. W. Bush 1989; deputy assistant \r', 'and director, Office of Legislative Affairs, White House Office 1989-1991; \r', 'elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Third Congress, by special election, \r', 'to fill the vacancy caused by the resignation of United States Representative \r', 'Willis D. Gradison, Jr.; reelected to the six succeeding Congresses until his \r', 'resignation on April 29, 2005 (May 4, 1993-April 29, 2005); U.S. Trade \r', 'Representative, in the cabinet of President of George W. Bush 2005-2006; \r', 'Director, Office of Management and Budget, in the cabinet of President George \r', 'W. Bush 2006-2007; elected as a Republican to the United States Senate in 2010; \r', 'reelected in 2016 for the term ending January 3, 2023. \r']

Name: PRICE, David Eugene
Bio: ['a Representative from North Carolina; born in Erwin, Unicoi County, \r', 'Tenn., August 17, 1940; graduated from Unicoi County High School, Erwin, Tenn., \r', '1957; attended Mars Hill College, Mars Hill, N.C., 1957-1959; B.A., University \r', 'of North Carolina, Chapel Hill, N.C., 1961; B.D., Yale University, New Haven, \r', 'Conn., 1964; Ph.D., Yale University, New Haven, Conn., 1969; faculty, Yale \r', 'University, New Haven, Conn., 1967-1973; staff, United States Senator Edward \r', 'Lewis Bartlett of Alaska, 1963-1967; professor, Duke University, Durham, N.C., \r', '1973-1986 and 1995-1996; staff director, commission on presidential nomination, \r', 'Democratic National Committee, 1981-1982; chairman, North Carolina Democratic \r', 'Party, 1983-1984; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundredth and to the three \r', 'succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1987-January 3, 1995); unsuccessful candidate \r', 'for reelection to the One Hundred Fourth Congress in 1994; elected as a \r', 'Democrat to the One Hundred Fifth and to the ten succeeding Congresses (January \r', '3, 1997-present). \r']

Name: PRYCE, Deborah D.
Bio:
["a Representative from Ohio; born in Warren, Trumbull County, Ohio, July 29, 1951; graduated from Champion High School, Warren, Ohio, 1969; B.A., Ohio State University, Columbus, Ohio, 1973; J.D., Capital University, Columbus, Ohio, 1976; lawyer; administrative law judge, Ohio state department of insurance, 1976-1978; first assistant city prosecutor, senior assistant city attorney, Columbus City Attorney's Office, Ohio, 1978-1985; judge, Franklin County, Ohio, Municipal Court, 1986-1992; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Third and to the seven succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1993-January 3, 2009); was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Eleventh Congress in 2008; House Republican Conference Chair (One Hundred Eighth Congress through One Hundred Ninth Congress). \r", '


\r', '

Bibliography

”Deborah D. Pryce” in \r', 'Women in Congress, 1917-2006. Prepared under the direction of the Committee on House Administration by the Office of History & Preservation, U. S. House of Representatives. Washington: Government Printing Office, 2006. \r']

Name: PUTNAM, Adam
Bio: [' a Representative from Florida; born in Bartow, Polk County, Fla., \r', 'July 31, 1974; B.S., University of Florida, Gainesville, Fla., 1995; farmer; \r', 'rancher; member of the Florida state house of representatives, 1996-2001; \r', 'elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Seventh and to the four succeeding \r', 'Congresses (January 3, 2001-January 3, 2011); House Republican Conference Chair \r', '(One Hundred Tenth Congress); not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred \r', 'Twelfth Congress in 2010; Commissioner of Agriculture, Florida Department of \r', 'Agriculture and Consumer Services, 2011-present.\r']

Name: QUINN, John Francis (Jack)
Bio: ['a Representative from New York; born in Buffalo, Erie County, N.Y., \r', 'April 13, 1951; B.A., Siena College, Loudonville, N.Y., 1973, M.A., State \r', 'University of New York, Buffalo, 1983; teacher in the public schools of Orchard \r', 'Park, N.Y., 1973-1983; member, Hamburg, N.Y., town council, 1982-1984; Hamburg, \r', 'N.Y., town supervisor, 1985-1993; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred \r', 'Third and to the five succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1993-January 3, 2005); \r', 'not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Ninth Congress in 2004; \r', 'professional advocate; president, Erie Community College, Buffalo, N.Y. \r']

Name: RADANOVICH, George P.
Bio: ['a Representative from California; born in Mariposa, Mariposa County, \r', 'Calif., June 20, 1955; B.S., California State Polytechnic University, San Luis \r', 'Obispo, Calif., 1978; bank executive; business owner; member of the Mariposa \r', 'County, Calif., planning commission, 1982-1986, chair, 1985-1986; member of the \r', 'Mariposa County, Calif., board of supervisors, 1988-1992, chair, 1991; \r', 'unsuccessful candidate for nomination to the One Hundred Third Congress in \r', '1992; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Fourth and to the seven \r', 'succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1995-January 3, 2011); was not a candidate \r', 'for reelection to the One Hundred Twefth Congress in 2010.\r']

Name: RAHALL, Nick Joe, II
Bio: ['a Representative from West Virginia; born in Beckley, Raleigh \r', 'County, W.Va., May 20, 1949; graduated from Woodrow Wilson High School, \r', 'Beckley, W.Va.; A.B., Duke University, Durham, N.C., 1971; attended graduate \r', 'school, George Washington University, Washington, D.C., 1972; staff, Office of \r', 'the Majority Whip, United States Senate, 1971-1974; business owner; delegate, \r', 'Democratic National Conventions, 1972 and 1976; elected as a Democrat to the \r', 'Ninety-fifth and to the eighteen succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1977-January \r', '3, 2015); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Fourteenth \r', 'Congress in 2014; chair, Committee on Natural Resources (One Hundred Tenth and \r', 'One Hundred Eleventh Congresses).\r']

Name: RAMSTAD, James (Jim)
Bio: ['a Representative from Minnesota; born in Jamestown, Stutsman County, \r', 'N.D., May 6, 1946; B.A., University of Minnesota, 1968; J.D., George Washington \r', 'University Law School, Washington, D.C., 1973; United States Army Reserve, \r', '1968-1975; staff for the speaker of the Minnesota state house of \r', 'representatives, 1969-1970; staff, United States Representative Thomas S. \r', 'Kleppe of North Dakota, 1970; adjunct professor, American University, \r', 'Washington, D.C., 1974-1978; deputy campaign manager for United States \r', 'Representative William E. Frenzel of Minnesota, 1978; member of the Minnesota \r', 'state senate, 1981-1990; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Second and \r', 'to the eight succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1991-January 3, 2009); was not a \r', 'candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Eleventh Congress in \r', '2008.\r']

Name: RANGEL, Charles B.
Bio: ['a Representative from New York; born in New York, New York County, N.Y., June 11, 1930; attended DeWitt Clinton High School; B.S., New York University School of Commerce, New York, N.Y., 1957; LL.B. (J.D.), St. John’s Law School, Brooklyn, N.Y., 1960; United States Army, 1948-1952; lawyer, private practice; assistant United States Attorney, Southern District of New York, 1963; counsel to speaker of the New York state assembly, 1965; counsel to the President’s Commission to Revise the Draft Laws, 1966; secretary, New York State Penal Law and Code Revision Commission; member of the New York state assembly, 1966-1970; elected as a Democrat to the Ninety-second and to the twenty-two succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1971-January 3, 2017); censured by the U.S. House of Representatives on December 2, 2010, for misuse of congressional letterhead and financial impropriety; was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Fifteenth Congress in 2016; chairman, Select Committee on Narcotics Abuse and Control (Ninety-eighth through One Hundred Third Congresses); chairman, Committee on Ways and Means (One Hundred Tenth and One Hundred Eleventh Congresses); chairman, Joint Committee on Taxation (One Hundred Eleventh Congress). \r']

Name: REGULA, Ralph Straus
Bio: ['a Representative from Ohio; born in Beach City, Stark County, Ohio, December 3, 1924; B.A., Mount Union College, Alliance, Ohio, 1948; LL.B., William McKinley School of Law, Canton, Ohio, 1952; United States Navy, 1944-1946; lawyer, private practice; member of the Ohio state board of education, 1960-1964; member of the Ohio state house of representatives, 1965-1966; member of the Ohio state senate, 1967-1972; delegate, Republican National Convention, 1972; elected as a Republican to the Ninety-third and to the seventeen succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1973-January 3, 2009); was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Eleventh Congress in 2008; died on July 19, 2017, in Bethlehem Township, Ohio. \r']

Name: REHBERG, Denny
Bio: ['a Representative from Montana; born in Billings, Yellowstone County, \r', 'Mont., October 5, 1955; graduated from West High School, Billings, Mont.; \r', 'attended Montana State University, Billings, Mont., 1973-1974; B.A., Washington \r', 'State University, Pullman, Wash., 1977; rancher; staff, United States \r', 'Representative Ron Marlenee of Montana, 1979-1982; member, Montana state house \r', 'of representatives, 1984-1991; Montana lieutenant governor, 1991-1996; \r', 'unsuccessful candidate for the United States Senate in 1996; elected as a \r', 'Republican to the One Hundred Seventh and to the five succeeding Congresses \r', '(January 3, 2001-January 3, 2013); not a candidate for reelection in 2012, but \r', 'was an unsuccessful candidate for election to the United States \r', 'Senate.\r']

Name: REYES, Silvestre
Bio:
['a Representative from Texas; born in Canutillo, El Paso County, \r', 'Tex., November 10, 1944; graduated from Canutillo High School, Canutillo, Tex., \r', '1964; associate degree, El Paso Community College, El Paso, Tex., 1976; \r', 'attended University of Texas, Austin, Tex., 1964-1965; attended University of \r', 'Texas, El Paso, Tex., 1965-1966; United States Army, 1966-1968; Immigration and \r', 'Naturalization Service, 1969-1995; member of the Canutillo, Tex., school board, \r', '1968-1969; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Fifth and to the seven \r', 'succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1997-January 3, 2013); chair, Permanent \r', 'Select Committee on Intelligence (One Hundred Tenth and One Hundred Eleventh \r', 'Congresses); unsuccessful candidate for nomination to the One Hundred \r', 'Thirteenth Congress in 2012. \r', '


\r', '

Bibliography

”Silvestre Reyes” in \r', 'Hispanic Americans in Congress, 1822-2012. Prepared under the \r', 'direction of the Committee on House Administration by the Office of the \r', 'Historian and the Office of the Clerk, U.S. House of Representatives. \r', 'Washington: Government Printing Office, 2013.\r']

Name: REYNOLDS, Thomas M.
Bio: ['a Representative from New York; born in Belfonte, Centre County, \r', 'Pa., September 3, 1950; graduated from Springville-Griffith Institute, \r', 'Springville, N.Y.; attended Kent State University, Kent, Ohio; New York \r', 'National Guard, 1970-1976; elected to Concord, N.Y., town board, 1974-1982; \r', 'elected to Erie County, N.Y., legislature, 1982-1988; member of the New York \r', 'state assembly, 1988-1998; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Sixth and \r', 'to the four succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1999-January 3, 2009); was not a \r', 'candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Eleventh Congress in \r', '2008.\r']

Name: RILEY, Robert
Bio: ['a Representative from Alabama; born in Ashland, Clay County, Ala., \r', 'October 3, 1944; graduated, Clay County High School, Mo., 1962; B.A., \r', 'University of Alabama, Tuscaloosa, 1965; member, Ashland City Council, \r', '1972-1976; business owner; rancher; real estate agent; elected as a Republican \r', 'to the One Hundred Fifth and two succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1997-January \r', '3, 2003); was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Eighth Congress \r', 'in 2002; Governor of Alabama, 2003-2011. \r']

Name: RIVERS, Lynn Nancy
Bio:
['a Representative from Michigan; born in Au Gres, Arenac County, \r', 'Mich., December 19, 1956; graduated Au Gres-Sims High School, Arenac, Mich.., \r', '1975; B.A., University of Michigan, 1987; J.D., Wayne State University, \r', 'Detroit, Mich., 1992; trustee of Ann Arbor, Mich., board of education, \r', '1984-1992; member of the Michigan state house of representatives, 1993-1994; \r', 'elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Fourth and to the three succeeding \r', 'Congresses (January 3, 1995-January 3, 2003); unsuccessful candidate for \r', 'nomination to the One Hundred Eighth Congress in 2002. \r', '


\r', '

Bibliography

”Lynn Nancy Rivers” in \r', 'Women in Congress, 1917-2006. Prepared under the direction of \r', 'the Committee on House Administration by the Office of History & \r', 'Preservation, U. S. House of Representatives. Washington: Government Printing \r', 'Office, 2006.\r']

Name: RODRIGUEZ, Ciro D.
Bio:
['a Representative from Texas; born in Piedras Negras, Mexico, \r', 'December 9, 1946; attended Harlandale High School, San Antonio, Tex.; B.A., St. \r', 'Mary’s University, San Antonio, Tex., 1973; M.S.W., Our Lady of the Lake \r', 'University, San Antonio, Tex., 1978; member of the Texas state house of \r', 'representatives, 1987-1997; member, Harlandale Independent School District \r', 'School Board, San Antonio, Tex., 1975-1987; consultant; caseworker, Our Lady of \r', 'the Lake University’s Worden School of Social Work, San Antonio, Tex., \r', '1987-1996; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Fifth Congress, by special \r', 'election to fill the vacancy caused by the death of United States \r', 'Representative Frank Tejeda, reelected to the One Hundred Sixth and to the two \r', 'succeeding Congresses (April 12, 1997-January 3, 2005); unsuccessful candidate \r', 'for renomination in 2004; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Tenth and to \r', 'the succeeding Congress (January 3, 2007-January 3, 2011); unsuccessful \r', 'candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Twelfth Congress in 2010; \r', 'unsuccessful candidate for nomination to the One Hundred Thirteenth Congress in \r', '2012. \r', '


\r', '

Bibliography

”Ciro D. Rodriguez” in \r', 'Hispanic Americans in Congress, 1822-2012. Prepared under the \r', 'direction of the Committee on House Administration by the Office of the \r', 'Historian and the Office of the Clerk, U.S. House of Representatives. \r', 'Washington: Government Printing Office, 2013.\r']

Name: ROEMER, Timothy John
Bio: [' (son-in-law of John Bennett Johnston, Jr.), \r', 'a Representative from Indiana; born in South Bend, St. Joseph \r', 'County, Ind., October 30, 1956; graduated from Penn High School, Mishawaka, \r', 'Ind.; B.A., University of California, San Diego, Calif., 1979; M.A., Notre Dame \r', 'University, Notre Dame, Ind., 1982; Ph.D., Notre Dame University, Notre Dame, \r', 'Ind., 1986; staff, United States Representative John Brademas of Indiana, \r', '1978-1979; instructor, American University, Washington, D.C., 1988; staff, \r', 'United States Senator Dennis DeConcini of Arizona, 1985-1989; elected as a \r', 'Democrat to the One Hundred Second and to the five succeeding Congresses \r', '(January 3, 1991-January 3, 2003); not a candidate for reelection to the One \r', 'Hundred Eighth Congress in 2002; commissioner, National Commission on Terrorist \r', 'Attacks Upon the United States. \r']

Name: ROGERS, Harold Dallas (Hal)
Bio: ['a Representative from Kentucky; born in Barrier, Wayne County, Ky., \r', 'December 31, 1937; graduated from Wayne County High School, Monticello, Ky., \r', '1955; attended Western Kentucky University, Bowling Green, Ky., 1956-1957; \r', 'A.B., University of Kentucky, Lexington, Ky., 1962; LL.B., University of \r', 'Kentucky, Lexington, Ky., 1964; staff sergeant, Kentucky and North \r', 'Carolina Army National Guard, 1956-1963; lawyer, private practice; commonwealth \r', 'attorney, Pulaski and Rockcastle Counties, Ky., 1969-1980; Delegate, Republican \r', 'National Conventions, 1976, 1980, 1984, 1988, 1992, 1996, 2000, 2004, and 2008; \r', 'elected as a Republican to the Ninety-seventh and to the eighteen succeeding \r', 'Congresses (January 3, 1981-present); chair, Committee on Appropriations (One \r', 'Hundred Twelfth through One Hundred Fourteenth Congresses).\r']

Name: ROGERS, Mike
Bio: [' a Representative from Michigan; born in Livingston County, Mich., \r', 'June 2, 1963; graduated from Howell High School, Howell, Mich., 1981; B.S., \r', 'Adrian College, Adrian, Mich., 1985; United States Army, 1985-1989; Federal \r', 'Bureau of Investigation, 1989-1994; member of the Michigan state senate, \r', '1995-2000, and majority floor leader, 1999-2000; elected as a Republican to the \r', 'One Hundred Seventh and to the six succeeding Congresses (January 3, \r', '2001-January 3, 2015); was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred \r', 'Fourteenth Congress in 2014; chair, Permanent Select Committee on Intelligence \r', '(One Hundred Twelfth and One Hundred Thirteenth Congresses).\r']

Name: ROHRABACHER, Dana
Bio: ['a Representative from California; born in Coronado, San Diego \r', 'County, Calif., June 21, 1947; graduated from Palos Verdes High School, Palos \r', 'Verdes Estates, Calif., 1965; attended Los Angeles Harbor College, Los Angeles, \r', 'Calif., 1965-1967; B.A., California State University, Long Beach, Calif., 1969; \r', 'M.A., University of Southern California, Los Angeles, Calif., 1971; journalist; \r', 'assistant press secretary to the Ronald Reagan presidential campaigns of 1976 \r', 'and 1980; speechwriter and special assistant to President Ronald Reagan, \r', '1981-1988; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred First and to the fourteen \r', 'succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1989-present). \r']

Name: ROS-LEHTINEN, Ileana

Pepper, and reelected to the fourteen succeeding Congresses (August 29, \r', '1989-present); chair, Committee on Foreign Affairs (One Hundred Twelfth \r', 'Congress).\r']

Name: ROSS, Michael Avery

Name: ROTHMAN, Steven
Bio: ['a Representative from New Jersey; born in Englewood, Bergen County, \r', 'N.J., October 14, 1952; graduated from Tenafly High School, Tenafly, N.J., \r', '1970; B.A., Syracuse University, Syracuse, N.Y., 1974; J.D., Washington \r', 'University School of Law, St. Louis, Mo., 1977; mayor, Englewood, N.J., \r', '1983-1989; Bergen County, N.J., surrogate court judge, 1993-1996; elected as a \r', 'Democrat to the One Hundred Fifth and to the seven succeeding Congresses \r', '(January 3, 1997-January 3, 2013); unsuccessful candidate for nomination to the \r', 'One Hundred Thirteenth Congress in 2012.\r']

Name: ROUKEMA, Margaret Scafati
Bio:
['a Representative from New Jersey; born in Newark, Essex County, \r', 'N.J., September 19, 1929; graduated from West Orange High School, West Orange, \r', 'N.J., 1947; B.A., Montclair State College, Montclair, N.J., 1951; graduate \r', 'work, Montclair State College, Montclair, N.J., 1951-1953, and Rutgers \r', 'University, New Brunswick, N.J., 1975; teacher; Ridgewood, N.J., board of \r', 'education, 1970-1973; unsuccessful candidate for election to the United States \r', 'House of Representatives in 1978; elected as a Republican to the Ninety-seventh \r', 'and to the ten succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1981-January 3, 2003); not a \r', 'candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Eighth Congress in 2002; died on \r', 'November 12, 2014, in Wyckoff, N.J. \r', '

Name: ROYBAL-ALLARD, Lucille

Roybal), \r', 'a Representative from California; born in Boyle Heights, Los Angeles \r', 'County, Calif., June 12, 1941; graduated from Ramona Convent Secondary School, \r', 'Alhambra, Calif., 1959; B.A., California State University, Los Angeles, Calif., \r', '1965; community relations and nonprofit executive; member of the California \r', 'state assembly, 1987-1992; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Third and \r', 'to the twelve succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1993-present). \r']

Name: ROYCE, Edward Randall

Name: RYAN, Paul D.
Bio: ['a Representative from Wisconsin; born in Janesville, Rock County, \r', 'Wis., January 29, 1970; graduated from Joseph A. Craig High School, Janesville, \r', 'Wis., 1988; B.A., Miami University, Oxford, Ohio, 1992; construction business; \r', 'staff, United States Senator Robert Walter Kasten, Jr., of Wisconsin, 1992; \r', 'staff assistant, Empower America, 1993-1995; staff, United States Senator Sam \r', 'Dale Brownback of Kansas, 1995-1997; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred \r', 'Sixth and to the nine succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1999-present); chair, \r', 'Committee on the Budget (One Hundred Twelfth and One Hundred Thirteenth \r', 'Congresses); chair, Committee on Ways and Means (One Hundred Fourteenth \r', 'Congress); chair, Joint Committee on Taxation (One Hundred Fourteenth \r', 'Congress); unsuccessful Republican candidate for Vice President of the United \r', 'States in 2012; Speaker of the House (One Hundred Fourteenth and One Hundred \r', 'Fifteenth Congresses).\r']

Name: RYUN, Jim
Bio: ['a Representative from Kansas; born in Wichita, Sedgewick County, \r', 'Kans., April 29, 1947; graduated from Wichita East High School, Wichita, Kans., \r', '1965; B.A., University of Kansas, Lawrence, Kans., 1970; president, Jim Ryun \r', 'Sports, Inc.; member of the United States Olympic Team in 1968; product \r', 'consultant; motivational speaker; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred \r', 'Fifth Congress; became a Member of the One Hundred Fourth Congress under the \r', 'provisions of Kansas State Law (K.S.A. 25-3503[d]) on November 27, 1996, to \r', 'fill the vacancy caused by the resignation of United States Representative Sam \r', 'Brownback; reelected to the One Hundred Sixth Congress and to the three \r', 'succeeding Congress (November 27, 1996-January 3, 2007); unsuccessful candidate \r', 'for reelection to the One Hundred Tenth Congress in 2006. \r']

Name: SABO, Martin Olav
Bio: ['a Representative from Minnesota; born in Crosby, Divide County, \r', 'N.D., February 28, 1938; graduated from Alkabo High School, Alkabo, N.D., 1955; \r', 'B.A., Augsburg College, Minneapolis, Minn., 1959; graduate studies, University \r', 'of Minnesota, Minneapolis, Minn., 1960; member of the Minnesota state house of \r', 'representatives, 1960-1978, minority leader, 1969-1972, speaker of the house, \r', '1973-1978; presidential appointee on the National Advisory Commission on \r', 'Intergovernmental Relations; president, National Conference of State \r', 'Legislatures; president, National Legislative Conference; elected as a Democrat \r', 'to the Ninety-sixth and to the thirteen succeeding Congresses (January 3, \r', '1979-January 3, 2007); chair, Committee on the Budget (One Hundred Third \r', 'Congress); not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Tenth Congress in \r', '2006; died on March 13, 2016, in Minneapolis, Minn. \r']

Name: SANCHEZ, Loretta
Bio: [' (sister of Linda T. Sánchez), \r', 'a Representative from California; born in Lynwood, Los Angeles \r', 'County, Calif., January 7, 1960; graduated from Katella High School, Anaheim, \r', 'Calif.; B.A., Chapman University, Orange, Calif., 1982; M.B.A., American \r', 'University, Washington, D.C., 1984; financial analyst; elected as a Democrat to \r', 'the One Hundred Fifth and to the nine succeeding Congresses (January 3, \r', '1997-January 3, 2017); was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred \r', 'Fifteenth Congress in 2016, but was an unsuccessful candidate for election to \r', 'the United States Senate.\r']

Name: SANDERS, Bernard
Bio: ['a Senator and a Representative from Vermont; born in Brooklyn, Kings County, N.Y., September 8, 1941; graduated from Madison High School, Brooklyn, N.Y.; B.S., University of Chicago, Chicago, Ill., 1964; faculty, Harvard University, Cambridge, Mass., 1989; faculty, Hamilton College, Clinton, N.Y., 1990; carpenter; journalist; unsuccessful independent candidate for election to the United States Senate in 1972 and 1974; unsuccessful independent candidate for election for governor of Vermont in 1972, 1976 and 1986; mayor of Burlington, Vt., 1981-1989; unsuccessful independent candidate to the One Hundred First Congress in 1988; elected as an independent to the One Hundred Second and to the seven succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1991-January 3, 2007); was not a candidate for reelection to the House of Representatives but was elected as an Independent to the United States Senate in 2006 for the term commencing January 3, 2007; reelected in 2012 for the term ending January 3, 2019; chair, Committee on Veterans Affairs (One Hundred Thirteenth Congress); was an unsuccessful candidate for the Democratic presidential nomination in 2016.  \r']

Name: SANDLIN, Max A.
Bio: [' (husband of Stephanie Herseth Sandlin), \r', 'a Representative from Texas; born in Texarkana, Miller County, Ark., \r', 'September 29, 1952; graduated from Atlanta High School, Atlanta, Tex.; B.A., \r', 'Baylor University, Waco, Tex., 1975; J.D., Baylor University School of Law, \r', 'Waco, Tex., 1978; judge, Harrison County, Tex., 1986-1989; judge, County Court \r', 'at Law, Harrison County, Tex., 1989-1996; lawyer, private practice; business \r', 'executive; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Fifth and to the three \r', 'succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1997-January 3, 2005); unsuccessful candidate \r', 'for reelection in 2004. \r']

Name: SAWYER, Thomas Charles

Forsythe, reelected to the \r', 'twelve succeeding Congresses (November 6, 1984-January 3, 2009); was not a \r', 'candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Eleventh Congress in \r', '2008.\r']

Kent, judge of the United States District Court for the Southern \r', 'District of Texas.\r']

Nixon, judge of the United States District Court \r', 'for the District Court of Mississippi; one of the managers appointed by the \r', 'House of Representatives in 1998 to conduct the impeachment proceedings of \r', 'President William Jefferson Clinton; one of the managers appointed by the House \r', 'of Representatives in 2009 to conduct the impeachment proceedings of Samuel B. \r', 'Kent, judge of the United States District Court for the Southern District of \r', 'Texas; one of the managers appointed by the House of Representatives in 2010 to \r', 'conduct the impeachment proceedings of G. Name: SERRANO, José E.

Name: SHAW, Eugene Clay, Jr.
Bio: ['a Representative from Florida; born in Miami, Dade County, Fla., \r', 'April 19, 1939; graduated from Miami Edison Senior High School, Miami, Fla., \r', '1957; B.S., Stetson University, Deland, Fla., 1961; M.B.A., University of \r', 'Alabama, Tuscaloosa, Ala., 1963; J.D., Stetson University College of Law, \r', 'Deland, Fla., 1966; lawyer, private practice; assistant city attorney, Fort \r', 'Lauderdale, Fla., 1968; chief city prosecutor, Fort Lauderdale, Fla., \r', '1968-1969; associate municipal judge, Fort Lauderdale, Fla., 1969-1971; city \r', 'commissioner, Fort Lauderdale, Fla., 1971-1973; vice mayor, Fort Lauderdale, \r', 'Fla., 1973-1975; mayor, Fort Lauderdale, Fla., 1975-1980; elected as a \r', 'Republican to the Ninety-seventh and to twelve succeeding Congresses (January \r', '3, 1981-January 3, 2007); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One \r', 'Hundred Tenth Congress in 2006; died on September 10, 2013, in Fort Lauderdale, \r', 'Fl. \r']

Name: SHAYS, Christopher H.

McKinney and reelected to the ten succeeding \r', 'Congresses (August 18, 1987-January 3, 2009); unsuccessful candidate for \r', 'reelection to the One Hundred Eleventh Congress in 2008; unsuccessful candidate \r', 'for nomination to the United States Senate in 2012.\r']

Name: SHERMAN, Brad

Name: SHERWOOD, Don

Name: SHIMKUS, John M.
Bio: ['a Representative from Illinois; born in Collinsville, Madison \r', 'County, Ill., February 21, 1958; graduated from Collinsville High School, \r', 'Collinsville, Ill.; B.S., United States Military Academy, West Point, N.Y., \r', '1980; teaching certificate, Christ College, Irvine, Calif., 1990; M.B.A., \r', 'Southern Illinois University, Edwardsville, Ill., 1997; United States Army, \r', '1980-1986; United States Army Reserve, 1986-2008; Collinsville Township, Ill., \r', 'trustee, 1989-1993; Madison County, Ill., treasurer, 1990-1996; elected as a \r', 'Republican to the One Hundred Fifth and to the ten succeeding Congresses \r', '(January 3, 1997-present).\r']

Name: SHOWS, Clifford Ronald
Bio: ['a Representative from Mississippi; born in Moselle, Jones County, \r', 'Miss., January 26, 1947; graduated from Moselle High School, Moselle, Miss., \r', '1965; B.S., University of Southern Mississippi, Hattiesburg, 1971; farmer; \r', 'teacher; elected circuit clerk, Jefferson Davis County, Miss., 1976; member of \r', 'the Mississippi state senate, 1980-1988; elected as Mississippi state Southern \r', 'District Highway Commissioner, 1988-1998; elected as a Democrat to the One \r', 'Hundred Sixth and to the succeeding Congress (January 3, 1999-January 3, 2003); \r', 'unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Eighth Congress in \r', '2002; is a resident of Bassfield, Miss.\r']

Name: SHUSTER, E. G. (Bud)
Bio: [' (father of William Shuster), \r', 'a Representative from Pennsylvania; born in Glassport, Allegheny \r', 'County, Pa., January 23, 1932; B.S., University of Pittsburgh, Pa., 1954; \r', 'M.B.A., Duquesne University, Pittsburgh, Pa., 1960; Ph.D., American University, \r', 'Washington, D.C., 1967; United States Army, 1954-1956; delegate, Republican \r', 'National Conventions, 1976, 1980, 1984, and 1988; elected as a Republican to \r', 'the Ninety-third and to the fourteen succeeding Congresses, served until his \r', 'resignation on February 3, 2001 (January 3, 1973-February 3, 2001); chairman, \r', 'Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure (One Hundred Fourth through One \r', 'Hundred Sixth Congresses).\r']

Name: SHUSTER, William (Bill)
Bio: [' (son of E. G. "Bud" Shuster), \r', 'a Representative from Pennsylvania; born in McKeesport, Allegheny \r', 'County, Pa., January 10, 1961; graduated from Everett High School, Everett. \r', 'Pa.; B.A., Dickinson College, Carlisle, Pa., 1983; M.B.A., American University, \r', 'Washington, D.C.; business owner; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred \r', 'Seventh Congress, by special election, to fill the vacancy caused by the \r', 'resignation of United States Representative E. G. “Bud” Shuster of Pennsylvania \r', 'and reelected to the eight succeeding Congresses (May 15, 2001-present); chair, \r', 'Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure (One Hundred Thirteenth through \r', 'One Hundred Fifteenth Congresses).\r']

Name: SIMMONS, Robert (Rob)
Bio: [' a Representative from Connecticut; born in New York, N.Y., February \r', '11, 1943; graduated from Haverford College, Haverford, Pa., 1965; M.P.A., \r', 'Harvard University, Cambridge, Mass., 1979; United States Army, 1965-1968; \r', 'United States Army Reserves, 1969-2000; professor; operations officer, Central \r', 'Intelligence Agency, 1969-1979; staff for United States Senator John Chafee of \r', 'Rhode Island, 1979-1981; staff, Select Committee on Intelligence, 1981-1985; \r', 'member of the Connecticut general assembly, 1990-2000; elected as a Republican \r', 'to the One Hundred Seventh and to the two succeeding Congresses (January 3, \r', '2001-January 3, 2007); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One Hundred \r', 'Tenth Congress in 2006.\r']
