Name: SKEEN, Joseph Richard
Bio: ['a Representative from New Mexico; born in Roswell, Chaves County, \r', 'N.Mex., June 30, 1927; graduated from O’Dea High School, Seattle, Wash., 1944; \r', 'B.S., Texas A&M University, College Station, Tex., 1950; United States \r', 'Navy, 1945-1946; United States Air Force Reserve, 1949-1952; rancher; member of \r', 'the New Mexico state senate, 1960-1970; chairman, New Mexico Republican Party, \r', '1962-1965; delegate, New Mexico state Republican conventions, 1960-1970; \r', 'delegate, Republican National Convention, 1964; elected as a Republican in 1980 \r', 'as a write-in candidate to the Ninety-seventh Congress, and reelected to the \r', 'ten succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1981-January 3, 2003); not a candidate \r', 'for reelection to the One Hundred Eighth Congress in 2002; died on December 7, \r', '2003, in Roswell, N.M; interment in Skeen Ranch Cemetery, Picacho, \r', 'N.M.\r']

Name: SKELTON, Isaac Newton, IV (Ike)
Bio: ['a Representative from Missouri; born in Lexington, Lafayette County, \r', 'Mo., December 20, 1931; attended the Wentworth Military Academy, Lexington, \r', 'Mo.; graduated from Lexington High School, Lexington, Mo., 1949; attended the \r', 'University of Edinburgh, Scotland, 1953; A.B., University of Missouri, \r', 'Columbia, Mo., 1953; LL.B., University of Missouri, Columbia, Mo., 1956; \r', 'lawyer, private practice; Lafayette County, Mo., prosecuting attorney, \r', '1957-1960; special assistant attorney general, Missouri state attorney general, \r', '1961-1963; member of the Missouri state senate, 1971-1977; elected as a \r', 'Democrat to the Ninety-fifth and to the sixteen succeeding Congresses (January \r', '3, 1977-January 3, 2011); chair, Committee on Armed Services (One Hundred Tenth \r', 'and One Hundred Eleventh Congresses); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to \r', 'the One Hundred Twelfth Congress in 2010; died in Arlington, Va., October 28, \r', '2013.\r']

Name: SLAUGHTER, Louise McIntosh
Bio: ['a Representative from New York; born Louise McIntosh in Harlan \r', 'County, Ky., August 14, 1929; graduated from Somerset High School, Somerset, \r', 'Ky., 1947; B.S., University of Kentucky, Lexington, Ky., 1951; M.S., University \r', 'of Kentucky, Lexington, Ky., 1953; elected to the Monroe County, N.Y., \r', 'legislature, 1976-1979; regional coordinator for New York department of state, \r', '1976-1979; coordinator, regional office of New York lieutenant governor, \r', '1979-1982; member of the New York state assembly, 1982-1986; elected as a \r', 'Democrat to the One Hundredth and to the fifteen succeeding Congresses; served \r', 'until her death on March 16, 2018 (January 3, 1987-March 16, 2018); chair, \r', 'Committee on Rules (One Hundred Tenth and One Hundred Eleventh Congresses); \r', 'died on March 16, 2018, in Washington, D.C.\r']

Name: SMITH, Adam
Bio: ['a Representative from Washington; born in Washington, D.C., June 15, \r', '1965; graduated from Tyee High School, Seattle, Wash. 1983; B.A., Fordham \r', 'University, New York, N.Y., 1987; J.D., University of Washington, \r', 'Seattle, Wash., 1990; lawyer, private practice; city prosecutor, Seattle, \r', 'Wash., 1993-1995; member of the Washington state senate, 1991-1996; elected as \r', 'a Democrat to the One Hundred Fifth and to the ten succeeding Congresses \r', '(January 3, 1997-present). \r']

Name: SMITH, Christopher Henry
Bio: ['a Representative from New Jersey; born in Rahway, Union County, \r', 'N.J., March 4, 1953; graduated from St. Mary’s High School, Perth Amboy, \r', 'N.J., 1971; B.S., Trenton State College, Ewing, N.J., 1975; attended Worcester \r', 'College, Worcester, England, 1974; businessman, family sporting goods company; \r', 'nonprofit executive; unsuccessful \r', 'candidate for election to the Ninety-sixth Congress in 1978; elected as a \r', 'Republican to the Ninety-seventh and to the eighteen succeeding Congresses \r', '(January 3, 1981-present); chair, Committee on Veterans Affairs (One Hundred \r', 'Seventh through One Hundred Eighth Congresses).\r']

Name: SMITH, Lamar Seeligson
Bio: ['a Representative from Texas; born in San Antonio, Bexar County, \r', 'Tex., November 19, 1947; graduated from Texas Military Institute, San Antonio, \r', 'Tex., 1965; B.A., Yale University, New Haven, Conn., 1969; J.D., Southern \r', 'Methodist University School of Law, Dallas, Tex., 1975; journalist; lawyer, \r', 'private practice; member of the Texas state house of representatives, \r', '1981-1982; Bexar County, Tex., commissioner, 1982-1985; elected as a Republican \r', 'to the One Hundredth and to the fifteen succeeding Congresses (January 3, \r', '1987-present); chair, Committee on Standards of Official Conduct (One Hundred \r', 'Sixth Congress); chair, Committee on the Judiciary (One Hundred Twelfth \r', 'Congress); chair, Committee on Science, Space, and Technology (One Hundred \r', 'Thirteenth through One Hundred Fifteenth Congresses).\r']

Name: SMITH, Nick H.
Bio: ['a Representative from Michigan;  born in Addison, Hillsdale County, Mich., \r', 'November 5, 1934;  B.A., Michigan State University, East Lansing, Mich., 1957;  M.S., University of \r', 'Delaware, Newark, Del., 1959;  United States Air Force, 1959-1961;  trustee, Somerset Township, \r', 'Mich., board, 1962-1968, and supervisor, 1966-1968;  member of the Hillsdale County, Mich., \r', 'board of supervisors, 1966-1968;  assistant deputy administrator and director of energy, United States \r', 'Department of Agriculture, 1972-1974;  chair, Michigan Agricultural Stabilization and Conservation \r', 'Service;  delegate to the American Assembly on World Population and Hunger, Washington, D.C., \r', '1973;  member of the Michigan state house of representative, 1978-1982;  member of the Michigan \r', 'state senate, 1983-1993;  elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Third and to the five succeeding \r', 'Congresses (January 3, 1993-January 3, 2005);  not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred \r', 'Ninth Congress in 2004. \r']

Name: SNYDER, Victor F.
Bio: ['a Representative from Arkansas; born in Medford, Jackson County, \r', 'Oreg., September 27, 1947; B.A., Willamette University, Salem, Oreg., 1975; \r', 'M.D., University of Oregon, Portland, Oreg., 1979; J.D., University of \r', 'Arkansas, Little Rock, Ark., 1988; United States Marine Corps, 1967-1969; \r', 'physician; member of the Arkansas state senate, 1991-1996; elected as a \r', 'Democrat to the One Hundred Fifth and to the six succeeding Congresses (January \r', '3, 1997-January 3, 2011); was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred \r', 'Twelfth Congress in 2010.\r']

Name: SOLIS, Hilda L.
Bio:
[' a Representative from California; born in Los Angeles, Los Angeles \r', 'County, Calif, October 20, 1957; B.A., California Polytechnic University, \r', 'Pomona, Calif., 1979; M.A., University of Southern California, Los Angeles, \r', 'Calif., 1981; White House Office of Hispanic Affairs; analyst, Office of \r', 'Management and Budget; member of the Rio Hondo, Calif., Community College board \r', 'of trustees, 1985-1992; member of the California state assembly, 1992-1994; \r', 'member of the California state senate, 1994-2001; elected as a Democrat to the \r', 'One Hundred Seventh and to the four succeeding Congresses until her resignation \r', 'on February 24, 2009 (January 3, 2001-February 24, 2009); Secretary of Labor in \r', 'the Cabinet of President Barack Obama, 2009-2013; member of the Los Angeles \r', 'County, Calif. board of supervisors, 2014-present.\r', '


\r', '

Bibliography

”Hilda L. Solis” in \r', 'Hispanic Americans in Congress, 1822-2012. Prepared under the \r', 'direction of the Committee on House Administration by the Office of the \r', 'Historian and the Office of the Clerk, U. S. House of Representatives. \r', 'Washington: Government Printing Office, 2013.\r']

Name: SOUDER, Mark Edward
Bio: ['a Representative from Indiana; born in Fort Wayne, Allen County, \r', 'Ind., July 18, 1950; graduated from Leo High School, Leo, Ind., 1968; B.S., \r', 'Indiana University, Fort Wayne, Ind., 1972; M.B.A., University of Notre Dame, \r', 'Notre Dame, Ind., 1974; aide for United States Representative Dan Coats of \r', 'Indiana, 1983-1984; minority staff director, House Select Committee on \r', 'Children, Youth and Families, 1985-1988; aide for United States Representatives \r', 'Dan Coats of Indiana, 1988-1989; aide for United States Senator Dan Coats of \r', 'Indiana, 1989-1993; business owner; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred \r', 'Fourth and to the seven succeeding Congresses until his resignation on May 21, \r', '2010 (January 3, 1995-May 21, 2010).\r']

Name: SPENCE, Floyd Davidson
Bio: ['a Representative from South Carolina; born in Columbia, Richland \r', 'County, S.C., April 9, 1928; graduated from Lexington High School, Lexington, \r', 'S.C.; B.A., University of South Carolina, Columbia, S.C., 1952; LL.B., \r', 'University of South Carolina, Columbia, S.C., 1956; United States Naval \r', 'Reserve, 1947-1988; admitted to the South Carolina state bar, 1956; member of \r', 'the South Carolina state house of representatives, 1956-1962; member of the \r', 'South Carolina state senate, 1966-1970, and served as minority leader \r', '1966-1970; delegate, South Carolina State Republican conventions; delegate, \r', 'Republican National Conventions, 1964-1984; elected as a Republican to the \r', 'Ninety-second and to the fifteen succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1971-August \r', '16, 2001); chairman, Committee on National Security (One Hundred Fourth and One \r', 'Hundred Fifth Congresses); chairman, Committee on Armed Services (One Hundred \r', 'Sixth Congress); died on August 16, 2001, in Jackson, Miss.; interment in St. \r', "Peter's Lutheran Church Cemetery, Lexington, S.C. \r"]

Name: SPRATT, John McKee, Jr.
Bio: ['a Representative from South Carolina; born in Charlotte, Mecklenburg \r', 'County, N.C., November 1, 1942; graduated from York High School, York, S.C., \r', '1960; A.B., Davidson College, Davidson, N.C., 1964; M.A., Marshall Scholar, \r', 'Corpus Christi College, Oxford University, Oxford, England, 1966; LL.B., Yale \r', 'Law School, New Haven, Conn., 1969; United States Army, 1969-1971; lawyer, \r', 'private practice; banker; business owner; delegate, South Carolina state \r', 'Democratic convention, 1972-1980; delegate, Democratic National Convention, \r', '1964; elected as a Democrat to the Ninety-eighth and to the thirteen succeeding \r', 'Congresses (January 3, 1983-January 3, 2011); unsuccessful candidate for \r', 'reelection to the One Hundred Twelfth Congress in 2010; chair, Committee on the \r', 'Budget (One Hundred Tenth and One Hundred Eleventh Congresses).\r']

Name: STARK, Fortney Hillman (Pete), Jr.
Bio: ['a Representative from California; born in Milwaukee, Wis., November \r', '11, 1931; B.S., Massachusetts Institute of Technology, Cambridge, Mass., 1953; \r', 'M.B.A., University of California, Berkeley, Calif., 1960; United States Air \r', 'Force, 1955-1957; bank executive; alternate delegate, Democratic National \r', 'Convention, 1972; elected as a Democrat to the Ninety-third and to the nineteen \r', 'succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1973-January 3, 2013); chair, Committee on \r', 'the District of Columbia (One Hundred Third Congress); unsuccessful candidate \r', 'for reelection to the One Hundred Thirteenth Congress in 2012.\r']

Name: STEARNS, Clifford Bundy
Bio: ['a Representative from Florida; born in Washington, D.C., April 16, \r', '1941; attended Hearst Elementary School, 1946-1952; graduated from Woodrow \r', 'Wilson High School, Washington, D.C., 1959; B.S., George Washington University, \r', 'Washington, D.C., 1963; attended the University of California, Los Angeles, \r', 'Calif., 1965; United States Air Force, 1963-1967; businessman; elected as a \r', 'Republican to the One Hundred First and to the eleven succeeding Congresses \r', '(January 3, 1989-January 3, 2013); unsuccessful candidate for nomination to the \r', 'One Hundred Thirteenth Congress in 2012. \r']

Name: STENHOLM, Charles Walter
Bio: ['a Representative from Texas; born in Stamford, Jones County, Tex., \r', 'October 26, 1938; graduated from Stamford High School, Stamford, Tex., 1957; \r', 'A.S., Tarleton State Junior College, Stephenville, Tex., 1959; B.S., Texas Tech \r', 'University, Lubbock, Tex., 1961; M.S., Texas Tech University, Lubbock, Tex., \r', '1962; farmer; teacher; business executive; delegate, Democratic National \r', 'Convention, 1972; elected as a Democrat to the Ninety-sixth and twelve \r', 'succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1979-January 3, 2005); unsuccessful candidate \r', 'for reelection in 2004.\r']

Name: STRICKLAND, Ted
Bio: ['a Representative from Ohio; born in Lucasville, Scioto County, Ohio, August 4, 1941; B.A., Asbury College, Wilmore, Ky., 1963; M.A., University of Kentucky, Lexington, Ky., 1966; M.A., Asbury Theological Seminary, Wilmore, Ky., 1967; Ph..D., University of Kentucky, Lexington, Ky., 1980; professor, Shawnee State College, Portsmouth, Ohio; unsuccessful candidate for election to the Ninety-fourth Congress in 1976, to the Ninety-fifth Congress in 1978, and to the Ninety-sixth Congress in 1980; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Third Congress (January 3, 1993-January 3, 1995); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Fourth Congress; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Fifth and to the five succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1997-January 3, 2007); was not a candidate for reelection to the United States House of Representatives in 2006; Governor of Ohio, 2007-2011; unsuccessful candidate for election to the United States Senate in 2016. \r']

Name: STUMP, Robert Lee
Bio: ['a Representative from Arizona; born in Phoenix, Maricopa County, \r', 'Ariz., April 4, 1927; graduated from Tolleson High School, Tolleson, Ariz., \r', '1947; B.S., Arizona State University, Tempe, Ariz., 1951; United States Navy, \r', '1943-1946; farmer; member of the Arizona state house of representatives, \r', '1959-1967; member of the Arizona state senate, 1967-1976; elected as a Democrat \r', 'to the Ninety-fifth and to the two succeeding Congresses; reelected as a \r', 'Republican to the Ninety-eighth and nine succeeding Congresses (January 3, \r', '1977-January 3, 2003); chair, Committee on Veterans’ Affairs (One Hundred \r', 'Fourth through One Hundred Sixth Congresses); chair, Committee on Armed \r', 'Services (One Hundred Seventh Congress); not a candidate for reelection to the \r', 'One Hundred Eighth Congress in 2002; died on June 20, 2003, in Phoenix, Ariz.; \r', 'interment in Greenwood Memorial Cemetery, Phoenix, Ariz. .\r']

Name: STUPAK, Bart T.
Bio: ['a Representative from Michigan; born in Milwaukee, Milwaukee County, \r', 'Wis., February 29, 1952; graduated from Gladstone High School, Gladstone, \r', 'Mich., 1970; A.A., Northwestern Michigan Community College, 1972; B.S., Saginaw \r', 'Valley State College, University Center, Mich., 1977; J.D., Thomas M. Cooley \r', 'Law School, Lansing, Mich., 1981; patrolman, Escanaba, Mich., police \r', 'department, 1972-1973; trooper, Michigan department of state police, 1973-1984; \r', 'member of the Michigan state house of representatives, 1989-1990; elected as a \r', 'Democrat to the One Hundred Third and to the eight succeeding Congresses \r', '(January 3, 1993-January 3, 2011); was not a candidate for reelection to the \r', 'One Hundred Twelfth Congress in 2010. \r']

Name: SULLIVAN, John
Bio: ['a Representative from Oklahoma; born in Tulsa, Tulsa County, Okla., \r', 'January 1, 1965; graduated from Bishop Kelley High School, Tulsa, Okla.; \r', 'B.B.A., Northeastern State University, Tahlequah, Okla., 1992; real estate \r', 'broker; member of the Oklahoma state house of representatives, 1995-2002; \r', 'elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Seventh Congress, by special \r', 'election (January 8, 2002) in anticipation of the vacancy caused by the \r', 'resignation of United States Representative Steve Largent, and reelected to the \r', 'five succeeding Congresses (February 15, 2002-January 3, 2013); unsuccessful \r', 'candidate for nomination to the One Hundred Thirteenth Congress in \r', '2012.\r']

Name: SUNUNU, John E.
Bio: ['a Representative and a Senator from New Hampshire; born in Boston, \r', 'Suffolk County, Mass., September 10, 1964; graduated from Salem High School, \r', 'Salem, N.H. 1982; B.S., M.S., Massachusetts Institute of Technology 1987; \r', 'M.B.A., Harvard Graduate School of Business 1991; elected as a Republican to \r', 'the House of Representatives for the One Hundred Fifth and the two succeeding \r', 'Congresses (January 3, 1997-January 3, 2003); was not a candidate for \r', 'reelection in 2002; elected as a Republican to the U.S. Senate in 2002, and \r', 'served from January 3, 2003, to January 3, 2009; was an unsuccessful candidate \r', 'for reelection in 2008. \r']

Name: SWEENEY, John E.
Bio: ['a Representative from New York; born in Troy, Rensselaer County, \r', 'N.Y., August 9, 1955; B.A., Russell Sage College, Troy, N.Y., 1981; J.D., \r', 'Western New England Law School, Springfield, Mass., 1990; New York state \r', 'commissioner of Labor; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Sixth and to \r', 'the three succeeding Congress (January 3, 1999-January 3, 2007); unsuccessful \r', 'candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Tenth Congress in 2006.\r']

Name: TANCREDO, Thomas G.
Bio: ['a Representative from Colorado; born in Denver, Denver County, \r', 'Colo., December 20, 1945; graduated from Holy Family High School, Broomfield, \r', 'Colo., 1964; B.A., University of Northern Colorado, Greeley, Colo., 1968; \r', 'member of the Colorado state legislature, 1976-1981; appointed by President \r', 'Reagan and re-appointed by President Bush as Secretary of Education Regional \r', 'Representative, 1981-1992; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Sixth \r', 'Congress and to the four succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1999-January 3, \r', '2009); was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Eleventh Congress \r', 'in 2008; unsuccessful candidate for the Republican presidential nomination in \r', '2008; unsuccessful American Constitution Party candidate for governor of \r', 'Colorado in 2010; unsuccessful nominee for governor of Colorado in \r', '2014.\r']

Name: TANNER, John S.
Bio: ['a Representative from Tennessee; born in Halls, Lauderdale County, Tenn., September 22, 1944; graduated from Union City High School, Union City, 1962; B.S., University of Tennessee, Knoxville, Tenn., 1966; J.D., University of Tennessee, Knoxville, Tenn., 1968; United States Navy, 1968-1972; Tennessee Army National Guard, 1974-2000; lawyer, private practice; member of the Tennessee state house of representatives, 1976-1986; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred First and to the ten succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1989-January 3, 2011); not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Twelfth Congress in 2010.  \r']

Name: TAUSCHER, Ellen O'Kane
Bio:
['a Representative from California; born in Newark, Essex County, \r', 'N.J., November 15, 1951; B.S., Seton Hall University, South Orange, N.J., 1974; \r', 'investment banker, New York Stock Exchange, 1977-1979; founder, Child Care \r', 'Registry, Inc., 1992; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Fifth and to the \r', 'six succeeding Congresses until her resignation on June 26, 2009 (January 3, \r', '1997-June 26, 2009); Under Secretary for Arms Control and International \r', 'Security, U. S. Department of State, 2009-2012; Special Envoy for Strategic \r', 'Stability and Missile Defense, U. S. Department of State, 2012-present. \r', '


\r', '

Bibliography

”Ellen O’Kane Tauscher” in \r', 'Women in Congress, 1917-2006. Prepared under the direction of \r', 'the Committee on House Administration by the Office of History & \r', 'Preservation, U. S. House of Representatives. Washington: Government Printing \r', 'Office, 2006.\r']

Name: TAUZIN, Wilbert Joseph (Billy)
Bio: ['a Representative from Louisiana; born in Chackbay, Lafourche Parish, \r', 'La., June 14, 1943; B.A., Nicholls State University, Thibodaux, La.,1964; J.D., \r', 'Louisiana State University, Baton Rouge, La., 1967; legislative aide, Louisiana \r', 'senate, 1963-1967; admitted to the Louisiana bar, 1967; member of the Louisiana \r', 'house of representatives, 1972-1980; elected as a Democrat, by special election \r', 'to the Ninety-sixth Congress to fill the vacancy caused by the resignation of \r', 'United States Representative David C. Treen, and reelected to the eight \r', 'succeeding Congresses; changed party affiliation to Republican, August 8, 1995; \r', 'elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Fifth and to the three succeeding \r', 'Congresses (May 22, 1980- January 3, 2005); not a candidate for reelection to \r', 'the One Hundred Ninth Congress in 2004; chair, Committee on Energy and Commerce \r', '(One Hundred Seventh and One Hundred Eighth Congresses). \r']

Name: TAYLOR, Charles Hart
Bio: ['a Representative from North Carolina; born in Brevard, Transylvania \r', 'County, N.C., January 23, 1941; graduated from Brevard High School, Brevard, \r', 'N.C.; B.A., Wake Forest University, Winston-Salem, N.C., 1963; J.D., Wake \r', 'Forest University, Winston-Salem, N.C., 1966; member of the North Carolina \r', 'state house of representatives, 1967-1973; member of the North Carolina state \r', 'senate, 1973-1975; unsuccessful candidate for election to the One Hundred First \r', 'Congress in 1988; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Second and to the \r', 'seven succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1991-January 3, 2007); unsuccessful \r', 'candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Tenth Congress in 2006. \r']

Name: TAYLOR, Gary Eugene (Gene)
Bio: ['a Representative from Mississippi; born in New Orleans, Orleans \r', 'Parish, La., September 17, 1953; graduated from De LaSalle High School, New \r', 'Orleans, La., 1971; B.A., Tulane University, New Orleans, La., 1976; graduate \r', 'work, University of Southern Mississippi, Hattiesburg, Miss.; United States \r', 'Coast Guard Reserve, 1971-1984; member, Bay St. Louis, Miss., city council, \r', '1981-1983; member, Mississippi state senate, 1984-1989; unsuccessful candidate \r', 'for election to the One Hundred First Congress in 1988; elected as a Democrat \r', 'to the One Hundred First Congress, by special election, to fill the vacancy \r', 'caused by the death of United States Representative Larkin I. Smith, and \r', 'reelected to the ten succeeding Congresses (October 17, 1989-January 3, 2011); \r', 'unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Twelfth Congress in \r', '2010; member, Hancock County, Miss., port and harbor commission, 2012 to \r', 'present; unsuccessful candidate for nomination to the One Hundred Fourteenth \r', 'Congress in 2014; is a resident of Bay St. Louis, Miss. \r']

Name: TERRY, Lee Raymond
Bio: ['a Representative from Nebraska; born in Omaha, Douglas County, Nebr., January 29, 1962; graduated from Omaha Northwest High School, Omaha, Nebr., 1980; B.A., University of Nebraska, Lincoln, Nebr., 1984; J.D., Creighton Law School, Omaha, Nebr., 1987; member of the Omaha, Nebr., city council, 1991-1998; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Sixth and to the seven succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1999-January 3, 2015); was an unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Fourteenth Congress in 2014. \r']

Name: THOMAS, William Marshall
Bio: ['a Representative from California; born in Wallace, Shoshone County, \r', 'Idaho, December 6, 1941; A.A., Santa Ana Community College, 1961; B.A., San \r', 'Francisco State University, San Francisco, Calif., 1963; M.A., San Francisco \r', 'State University, San Francisco, Calif., 1965; faculty, Bakersfield Community \r', 'College, Bakersfield, Calif., 1965-1974; member of the California state \r', 'assembly, 1974-1978; elected as a Republican to the Ninety-sixth and to the \r', 'thirteen succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1979-January 3, 2007); chair, \r', 'Committee on House Oversight (One Hundred Fourth and One Hundred Fifth \r', 'Congresses); chair, Committee on House Administration (One Hundred Sixth \r', 'Congress); chair, Committee on Ways and Means (One Hundred Seventh through One \r', 'Hundred Ninth Congresses); not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred \r', 'Tenth Congress in 2006.\r']

Name: THOMPSON, Bennie
Bio: ['a Representative from Mississippi; born in Bolton, Hinds County, \r', 'Miss., January 28, 1948; B.A., Tougaloo College, Tougaloo, Miss., 1968; M.S., \r', 'Jackson State University, Jackson, Miss., 1972; teacher; member of the Bolton, \r', 'Miss., board of aldermen, 1969-1973; Mayor of Bolton, Miss., 1973-1979; member \r', 'of the Hinds County, Miss., board of supervisors, 1980-1993; elected as a \r', 'Democrat to the One Hundred Third Congress, by special election, to fill the \r', 'vacancy caused by the resignation of United States Representative Alphonso \r', 'Michael (Mike) Espy, and reelected to the twelve succeeding Congresses (April \r', '13, 1993-present); chair, Committee on Homeland Security (One Hundred Tenth and \r', 'One Hundred Eleventh Congresses).\r']

Name: THOMPSON, Michael
Bio: ['a Representative from California; born in St. Helena, Napa County, \r', 'Calif., January 24, 1951; graduated from St. Helena High School, St. Helena, \r', 'Calif.; B.A., California State University, Chico, Calif., 1982; M.A., \r', 'California State University, Chico, Calif., 1996; United States Army, \r', '1969-1972; California state assembly fellow, 1982-1983; member of the \r', 'California state senate, 1990-1998; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred \r', 'Sixth and to the nine succeeding Congresses (January 3, \r', '1999-present).\r']

Name: THORNBERRY, William McClellan (Mac)
Bio: ['a Representative from Texas; born in Clarendon, Donley County, Tex., \r', 'July 15, 1958; graduated from Clarendon High School, Clarendon, Tex., 1976; \r', 'B.A., Texas Tech University, Lubbock, Tex., 1980; J.D., University of Texas \r', 'School of Law, Austin, Tex., 1983; staff, United States Representative Thomas \r', 'Gilbert Loeffler of Texas, 1983-1985; staff, United States Representative Larry \r', 'Ed Combest of Texas, 1985-1988; deputy assistant Secretary of State for \r', 'Legislative Affairs, United States Department of State, 1988-1989; rancher; \r', 'lawyer, private practice; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Fourth and \r', 'to the eleven succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1995-present); chair, Committee \r', 'on Armed Services (One Hundred Fourteenth and One Hundred Fifteenth \r', 'Congresses).\r']

Name: THUNE, John
Bio: [' a Senator and a Representative from South Dakota; born in Pierre, \r', 'Hughes County, S. Dak., January 7, 1961; graduated from Jones County High \r', 'School, S. Dak., 1979; B.S., Biola University, La Mirada, Calif., 1983; M.B.A., \r', 'University of South Dakota, Vermillion, S. Dak., 1984; executive director, \r', 'South Dakota state municipal league; board of directors, National League of \r', 'Cities; staff, United States Senator James Abdnor of South Dakota 1985-1986; \r', 'South Dakota state Republican party executive director 1989-1991; director, \r', 'South Dakota state railroad division 1991-1993; director, South Dakota state \r', 'municipal league 1993-1996; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Fifth \r', 'and to the two succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1997-January 3, 2003); was not \r', 'a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Eighth Congress in 2002, but was \r', 'an unsuccessful candidate for the United States Senate; elected as a Republican \r', 'to the U.S. Senate in 2004; reelected in 2010, and again in 2016 for the term \r', 'ending January 3, 2023; vice-chair, Republican Conference (2009); chair, \r', 'Republican Policy Committee (2009-2012); chair, Republican Conference (2012-); \r', 'chair, Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation (One Hundred \r', 'Fourteenth and One Hundred Fifteenth Congresses). \r']

Name: THURMAN, Karen L.
Bio:
['a Representative from Florida; born in Rapid City, Pennington \r', 'County, S.Dak., January 12, 1951; A.A., Santa Fe Community College, Starke, \r', 'Fla., 1970; B.A., University of Florida, Gainesville, Fla., 1973; member of the \r', 'Dunnellon, Fla., city council, 1974-1982; mayor of Dunnellon, Fla., 1979-1981; \r', 'member of the Florida state senate, 1983-1993; elected as a Democrat to the One \r', 'Hundred Third and to the four succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1993-January 3, \r', '2003); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Eighth Congress \r', 'in 2002. \r', '


\r', '

Bibliography

”Karen L. Thurman” in \r', 'Women in Congress, 1917-2006. Prepared under the direction of \r', 'the Committee on House Administration by the Office of History & \r', 'Preservation, U. S. House of Representatives. Washington: Government Printing \r', 'Office, 2006.\r']

Name: TIAHRT, Todd
Bio: ['a Representative from Kansas; born in Vermillion, Clay County, \r', 'S.Dak., June 15, 1951; attended South Dakota School of Mines and Technology, \r', 'Rapid City, S.Dak.; B.A., Evangel College, Springfield, Mo., 1975; M.B.A., \r', 'Southwest Missouri State, Springfield, Mo., 1989; teacher, Kansas Newman \r', 'College and Evangel College, Wichita, Kans.; proposal manager, Boeing Company; \r', 'unsuccessful candidate for election for the Kansas state house of \r', 'representatives in 1990; member of the Kansas state senate, 1993-1995; elected \r', 'as a Republican to the One Hundred Fourth and to the seven succeeding \r', 'Congresses (January 3, 1995-January 3, 2011); was not a candidate for \r', 'reelection to the One Hundred Eleventh Congressin 2010, but was an unsuccessful \r', 'candidate for nomination to the United States Senate; was an unsuccessful \r', 'candidate for nomination to the United States House of Representatives in \r', '2014.\r']

Name: TIBERI, Patrick (Pat)
Bio: ['a Representative from Ohio; born in Columbus, Franklin County, Ohio, \r', 'October 21, 1962; graduated from Northland High School, Columbus, Ohio, 1981; \r', 'B.A., Ohio State University, Columbus, Ohio, 1985; member of the Ohio state \r', 'house of representatives, 1992-2001; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred \r', 'Seventh and to the eight succeeding Congresses until his resignation on January 15, 2018 (January 3, 2001-January 15, 2018); \r', 'chair, Joint Economic Committee (One Hundred Fifteenth Congress).\r']

Name: TIERNEY, John F.
Bio: ['a Representative from Massachusetts; born in Salem, Essex County, \r', 'Mass., September 18, 1951; graduated from Salem High School, Salem, Mass.; \r', 'B.A., Salem State College, Salem, Mass., 1973; J.D., Suffolk University, \r', 'Boston, Mass., 1976; member of the Salem, Mass., chamber of commerce, \r', '1976-1996; President, Salem, Mass. chamber of commerce, 1995; trustee, Salem \r', 'State College, Salem, Mass., 1992-1997; elected as a Democrat to the One \r', 'Hundred Fifth and to the eight succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1997-January \r', '3, 2015); unsuccessful candidate for renomination to the One Hundred Fourteenth \r', 'Congress in 2014.\r']

Name: TOOMEY, Patrick Joseph
Bio: ['a Senator and a Representative from Pennsylvania; born in \r', 'Providence, Providence County, R.I., November 17, 1961; graduated from LaSalle \r', 'Academy, Providence, R.I.; graduated Harvard University, Cambridge, Mass., \r', 'B.A., 1984; elected to Allentown, Pa., Government Study Commission 1994; \r', 'elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Sixth and to the two succeeding \r', 'Congresses (January 3, 1999-January 3, 2005); was not a candidate for \r', 'reelection in 2004, but was an unsuccessful candidate for nomination to the \r', 'United States Senate; elected as a Republican to the United States Senate in \r', '2010; reelected in 2016 for the term ending January 3, 2023.\r']

Name: TOWNS, Edolphus
Bio: ['a Representative from New York; born in Chadbourn, Columbus County, \r', 'N.C., July 21, 1934; graduated from West Side High School, Chadbourn, N.C., \r', '1952; B.S., North Carolina Agricultural and Technical State University, \r', 'Greensboro, N.C., 1956; M.S.W., Adelphi University, Garden City, N.Y., 1973; \r', 'United States Army, 1956-1958; teacher, Fordham University, New York, N.Y.; \r', 'deputy president, borough of Brooklyn, N.Y., 1976-1982; elected as Democrat to \r', 'the Ninety-eighth and to the fourteen succeeding Congresses (January 3, \r', '1983-January 3, 2013); chair, Committee on Oversight and Government Reform (One \r', 'Hundred Eleventh Congress); was not a candidate for reelection to the One \r', 'Hundred Thirteenth Congress in 2012.\r']

Name: TRAFICANT, James A., Jr.
Bio: ['a Representative from Ohio; born in Youngstown, Mahoning County, \r', 'Ohio, May 8, 1941; graduated from Cardinal Mooney High School, Youngstown, \r', 'Ohio, 1959; B.S., University of Pittsburgh, Pittsburgh, Pa., 1963; M.S., \r', 'University of Pittsburgh, Pittsburgh, Pa., 1973; M.S., Youngstown State \r', 'University, Youngstown, Ohio, 1976; executive director, Mahoning County, Ohio, \r', 'Drug Program, Inc., 1971-1981; sheriff, Mahoning County, Ohio, 1981-1985; \r', 'elected as a Democrat to the Ninety-ninth and to the eight succeeding \r', 'Congresses (January 3, 1985-July 24, 2002); expelled from the U.S. House of \r', 'Representatives on July 25, 2002, for conspiracy to commit bribery, defraud the \r', 'U.S., receipt of illegal gratuities, obstruction of justice, filing false tax \r', 'returns, and racketeering; unsuccessful candidate as an Independent for the One \r', 'Hundred Eighth Congress in 2002; died on September 27, 2014, in Poland, Ohio. \r']

Name: TURNER, Jim
Bio: ['a Representative from Texas; born in Fort Lewis, Pierce County, \r', 'Wash., February 6, 1946; graduated from Crockett High School, Crockett, Tex; \r', 'B.A., University of Texas, Austin, Tex., 1968; M.B.A., University of Texas, \r', 'Austin, Tex., 1971; J.D., University of Texas, Austin, Tex., 1971; United \r', 'States Army, 1970-1978; member of the Texas state house of representatives, \r', '1981-1984; special counsel for legislative affairs and executive assistant to \r', 'the governor of Texas, 1984-1985; mayor, Crockett, Tex., 1989-1991; member of \r', 'the Texas state senate, 1991-1997; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred \r', 'Fifth and to the three succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1997-January 3, 2005); \r', 'not a candidate for reelection in 2004. \r']

Name: UDALL, Mark
Bio: [' (son of Morris K. Udall; cousin of Thomas Udall; nephew \r', 'of Stewart Lee Udall; cousin of Gordon H. Smith), \r', 'a Senator and a Representative from Colorado; born in Tucson, Pima \r', 'County, Ariz., July 18, 1950; graduated from Canyon del Oro High School, \r', 'Tucson, Ariz., 1968; B.A., Williams College, Williamstown, Mass., 1972; field \r', 'coordinator, Morris K. Udall for President, 1974; executive director, Colorado \r', 'Outward Bound School, 1985-1995; member of the Colorado state house of \r', 'representatives, 1996-1998; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Sixth and \r', 'to the four succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1999-January 3, 2009); not a \r', 'candidate for reelection to the House of Representatives but was elected as a \r', 'Democrat to the United States Senate in 2008, and served from January 3, 2009, \r', 'to January 3, 2015; unsuccessful candidate for reelection in 2014.\r']

Name: UDALL, Thomas (Tom)
Bio: [' (son of Stewart Lee Udall; nephew of Morris K. Udall; \r', 'cousin of Mark Udall; cousin of Gordon H. Smith), \r', 'a Senator and a Representative from New Mexico; born in Tucson, Pima \r', 'County, Ariz., May 18, 1948; graduated from Prescott College, Prescott, Ariz., \r', '1970; Bachelor of Law, Cambridge University, England, 1975; J.D., University of \r', 'New Mexico School of Law, Albuquerque, N.M., 1977; appointed Assistant United \r', 'States Attorney for the District of New Mexico, criminal division 1978-1981; \r', 'served as Chief Counsel to the New Mexico Department of Health and Environment; \r', 'Attorney General, State of New Mexico, 1990-1998; elected as a Democrat to the \r', 'One Hundred Sixth and to the four succeeding Congresses (January 3, \r', '1999-January 3, 2009); not a candidate for reelection to the House of \r', 'Representatives but was elected as a Democrat to the United States Senate in \r', '2008; reelected in 2014 for the term ending January 3, 2021.\r']

Name: UPTON, Frederick Stephen
Bio: ['a Representative from Michigan; born in St. Joseph, Berrien County, \r', 'Mich., April 23, 1953; graduated from Shattuck School, Fairbault, Minn.; A.B., \r', 'University of Michigan, Ann Arbor, Mich., 1975; staff, United States \r', 'Representative David Stockman of Michigan, 1976-1980; staff, United States \r', 'Office of Management and Budget, 1981-1985; elected as a Republican to the One \r', 'Hundredth and to the fifteen succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1987-present); \r', 'chair, Committee on Energy and Commerce (One Hundred Twelfth through One \r', 'Hundred Fourteenth Congresses). \r']

Name: VELÁZQUEZ, Nydia M.
Bio: ['a Representative from New York; born in Yabucoa, P.R., March 28, \r', '1953; B.A., University of Puerto Rico, Rio Piedras, 1974; M.A., New York \r', 'University, New York, N.Y., 1976; faculty, University of Puerto Rico, Humacao, \r', 'P.R., 1976-1981; adjunct professor, Hunter College, City University of New \r', 'York, N.Y., 1981-1983; staff, United States Representative Edolphus Towns of \r', 'New York, 1983; member of the New York, N.Y., city council, 1984; national \r', 'director, Migration Division Office, Puerto Rico department of labor and human \r', 'resources, 1986-1989; director, department of Puerto Rican community affairs in \r', 'the United States for the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico, 1989-1992; elected as a \r', 'Democrat to the One Hundred Third and to the twelve succeeding Congresses \r', '(January 3, 1993-present); chair, Committee on Small Business (One Hundred \r', 'Tenth and One Hundred Eleventh Congresses).\r']

Name: VISCLOSKY, Peter
Bio: ['a Representative from Indiana; born in Gary, Lake County, Ind., \r', 'August 13, 1949; graduated from Andrean High School, Merrillville, Ind.; B.S., \r', 'Indiana University Northwest, Gary, Ind., 1970; J.D., University of Notre Dame \r', 'School of Law, Notre Dame, Ind., 1973; LL.M., Georgetown University Law Center, \r', 'Washington, D.C., 1982; lawyer, private practice; staff, United States House of \r', 'Representatives Committee on Appropriations, 1977-1980; staff, United States \r', 'House of Representatives Committee on the Budget, 1980-1982; elected as a \r', 'Democrat to the Ninety-ninth and to the sixteen succeeding Congresses (January \r', '3, 1985-present).\r']

Name: VITTER, David
Bio: ['a Senator and a Representative from Louisiana; born in New Orleans, \r', 'Orleans Parish, La., May 3, 1961; A.B., Harvard University, Cambridge, Mass., \r', '1983; Rhodes Scholar; B.A., Oxford University, Oxford, England, 1985; J.D., \r', 'Tulane University School of Law, New Orleans, La., 1988; member of the \r', 'Louisiana state house of representatives, 1992-1999; elected as a Republican to \r', 'the One Hundred Sixth Congress by special election, to fill the vacancy caused \r', 'by the resignation of United States Representative Robert L. Livingston, Jr.; \r', 'reelected to the two succeeding Congresses (May 29, 1999-January 3, 2005); was \r', 'not a candidate for reelection to the House of Representatives, but was elected \r', 'to the United States Senate in 2004; reelected in 2010, and served from January 3, 2005, to January 3, 2017; chair, Committee on Small Business and Entrepreneurship (One \r', 'Hundred Fourteenth Congress); was not a candidate for reelection to the Senate  in \r', '2016. \r']

Name: WALDEN, Greg
Bio: ['a Representative from Oregon; born in The Dalles, Wasco County, \r', 'Ore., January 10, 1957; B.S., University of Oregon, Eugene, Ore., 1981; member \r', 'of the Oregon state house of representatives, 1989-1995; member of the Oregon \r', 'state senate, 1995-1997; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Sixth and \r', 'to the nine succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1999-present); chair, Committee \r', 'on Energy & Commerce (One Hundred Fifteenth Congress).\r']

Name: WALSH, James T.
Bio: [' (son of William F. Walsh), \r', 'a Representative from New York; born in Syracuse, Onondaga County, \r', 'N.Y., June 19, 1947; graduated from Christian Brothers Academy, Syracuse, N.Y., \r', '1966; B.A., St. Bonaventure University, St. Bonaventure, N.Y., 1970; United \r', 'States Peace Corps, 1970-1972; business executive; member of the Syracuse, \r', 'N.Y., common council, 1977-1985, president, 1985-1988; elected as a Republican \r', 'to the One Hundred First and to the nine succeeding Congresses (January 3, \r', '1989-January 3, 2009); was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred \r', 'Eleventh Congress in 2008.\r']

Name: WAMP, Zachary Paul
Bio: ['a Representative from Tennessee; born in Fort Benning, Chattahoochee \r', 'County, Ga., October 28, 1957; graduated from the McCallie School, Chattanooga, \r', 'Tenn., 1976; attended University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill, N.C. and \r', 'University of Tennessee; real estate broker; unsuccessful candidate for \r', 'election to the One Hundred Third Congress in 1992; elected as a Republican to \r', 'the One Hundred Fourth and to the seven succeeding Congresses (January 3, \r', '1995-January 3, 2011); not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred \r', 'Twelfth Congress in 2010, but was an unsuccessful candidate for Governor of \r', 'Tennessee.\r']

Name: WATERS, Maxine
Bio: ['a Representative from California; born Maxine (Moore) Carr, in St. \r', 'Louis, St. Louis County, Mo., August 15, 1938; B.A., California State \r', 'University, Los Angeles, Calif., 1970; teacher; Head Start volunteer \r', 'coordinator; Delegate, Democratic National Conventions, 1972-1988; member of \r', 'the California state assembly, 1977-1991; elected as a Democrat to the One \r', 'Hundred Second and to the thirteen succeeding Congresses (January 3, \r', '1991-present). \r']

Name: WATKINS, Wesley Wade
Bio: ['a Representative from Oklahoma; born in DeQueen, Sevier County, \r', 'Ark., December 15, 1938; graduated from Bennington High School, Bennington, \r', 'Okla., 1956; B.S., Oklahoma State University, Stillwater, Okla., 1960; M.S., \r', 'Oklahoma State University, Stillwater, Okla., 1961; Oklahoma Air National \r', 'Guard, 1960-1967; United States Department of Agriculture, Washington, D.C., \r', '1961-1963; administrator, Oklahoma State University, Stillwater, Okla., \r', '1963-1966; business executive; member of the Oklahoma state senate, 1975-1976; \r', 'delegate, Oklahoma State Democratic Convention, 1972; delegate, Democratic \r', 'National Convention, 1972; elected as a Democrat to the Ninety-fifth and to the \r', 'six succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1977-January 3, 1991); was not a \r', 'candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Second Congress in 1990, but was an \r', 'unsuccessful candidate for nomination for Governor of Oklahoma; unsuccessful \r', 'candidate for Governor of Oklahoma in 1994; elected as a Republican to the One \r', 'Hundred Fifth and to the two succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1997-January 3, \r', '2003); not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Eighth Congress in \r', '2002. \r']

Name: WATSON, Diane Edith
Bio:
['a Representative from California; born in Los Angeles, Los Angeles \r', 'County, Calif., November 12, 1933; graduated from Susan Miller Dorsey High \r', 'School, Los Angeles, Calif.; B.A., University of California, Los Angeles, \r', 'Calif., 1956; M.S., California State University, Los Angeles, Calif., 1967; \r', 'attended the Kennedy School of Government, Harvard University, Cambridge, \r', 'Mass.; Ph.D., Claremont Graduate University, Claremont, Calif., 1987; \r', 'psychologist; faculty, California State University, Los Angeles, Calif., \r', '1969-1971; health occupation specialist, Bureau of Industrial Education, \r', 'California Department of Education, 1971-1973; member of the Los Angeles, \r', 'Calif., unified school board, 1975-1978; member of the California state senate, \r', '1978-1998; United States Ambassador to the Federated States of Micronesia, \r', '1999-2000; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Seventh Congress, by \r', 'special election, to fill the vacancy caused by the death of United States \r', 'Representative Julian Dixon, and reelected to the four succeeding Congresses \r', '(June 5, 2001-January 3, 2011); was not a candidate for reelection to the One \r', 'Hundred Twelfth Congress in 2010.\r', '


\r', '

Bibliography

”Diane Edith Watson” in \r', 'Black Americans in Congress, 1870-2007. Prepared under the \r', 'direction of the Committee on House Administration by the Office of History \r', '& Preservation, U. S. House of Representatives. Washington: Government \r', 'Printing Office, 2008.\r']

Name: WATT, Melvin L.
Bio: ['a Representative from North Carolina; born in Steele Creek, \r', 'Mecklenburg County, N.C., August 26, 1945; York Road High School, Charlotte, \r', 'N.C., 1963; B.S., University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill, N.C., 1967; J.D., \r', 'Yale University School of Law, New Haven, Conn., 1970; lawyer, private \r', 'practice; member of the North Carolina state senate, 1985-1987; elected as a \r', 'Democrat to the One Hundred Third and to the ten succeeding Congresses until \r', 'his resignation on January 6, 2014 (January 3, 1993-January 6, 2014); Director, \r', 'Federal Housing Finance Agency, 2014-present. \r']

Name: WATTS, Julius Caesar, Jr. (J. C.)
Bio:
['a Representative from Oklahoma; born in Eufaula, McIntosh County, \r', 'Okla., November 18, 1957; graduated from Eufaula High School, Eufaula, Okla, \r', '1976; B.A., University of Oklahoma, Norman, 1981; member of the Oklahoma \r', 'Corporation Commission, 1990-1995, and chairman, 1993-1995; elected as a \r', 'Republican to the One Hundred Fourth and to the three succeeding Congresses \r', '(January 3, 1995-January 3, 2003); House Republican Conference Chair (One \r', 'Hundred Sixth Congress through One Hundred Seventh Congress); was not a \r', 'candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Eighth Congress in 2002. \r', '


\r', '

Bibliography

Watts, J. C. Jr., with Chriss Watson. \r', 'What Color is a Conservative?: My Life and My Politics. New \r', 'York: HarperCollins, 2002.\r']

Name: WAXMAN, Henry Arnold
Bio: ['a Representative from California; born in Los Angeles, Los Angeles \r', 'County, Calif., September 12, 1939; attended Los Angeles public schools; B.A., \r', 'University of California, Los Angeles, Calif., 1961; J.D., University of \r', 'California, Los Angeles, Calif., 1964; lawyer, private practice; member of the \r', 'California state assembly, 1969-1974; elected as a Democrat to the \r', 'Ninety-fourth and to the nineteen succeeding Congresses (January 3, \r', '1975-January 3, 2015); was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred \r', 'Fourteenth Congress in 2014; chair, Committee on Oversight and Government \r', 'Reform (One Hundred Tenth Congress); chair, Committee on Energy and Commerce \r', '(One Hundred Eleventh Congress).\r']

Name: WEINER, Anthony D.
Bio: ['a Representative from New York; born in New York City, N.Y., \r', 'September 4, 1964; graduated from Brooklyn Tech High School, Brooklyn, N.Y.; \r', 'B.A., State University of New York, Plattsburgh, N.Y., 1985; staff for United \r', 'States Representative Charles Schumer of New York, 1985-1991; member of the New \r', 'York, N.Y., city council, 1992-1998; unsuccessful candidate for mayor of New \r', 'York City, 2005; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Sixth and to the six \r', 'succeeding Congresses until his resignation on June 21, 2011 (January 3, \r', '1999-June 21, 2011).\r']

Name: WELDON, David Joseph
Bio: ['a Representative from Florida; born in Amityville, Suffolk County, \r', 'N.Y., August 31, 1953; graduated from Farmingdale High School, Farmingdale, \r', 'N.Y., 1971; B.S., State University of New York, Stony Brook, N.Y., 1978; M.D., \r', 'State University of New York, Buffalo, N.Y., 1981; United States Army, \r', '1981-1987; United States Army Reserve, 1987-1992; physician, internal medicine; \r', 'elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Fourth and to the six succeeding \r', 'Congresses (January 3, 1995-January 3, 2009); was not a candidate for \r', 'reelection to the One Hundred Eleventh Congress in 2008.\r']

Name: WELDON, Wayne Curtis (Curt)
Bio: ['a Representative from Pennsylvania; born in Marcus Hook, Delaware \r', 'County, Pa., July 22, 1947; B.A., West Chester State College, West Chester, \r', 'Pa., 1969; teacher; volunteer fire chief; mayor of Marcus Hook, Pa., 1977-1982; \r', 'member of the Delaware County, Pa., county council, 1981-1986; unsuccessful \r', 'candidate for election to the Ninety-Ninth Congress in 1984; elected as a \r', 'Republican to the One Hundredth and to the nine succeeding Congresses (January \r', '3, 1987-January 3, 2007); unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the One \r', 'Hundred Tenth Congress in 2006. \r']

Name: WELLER, Gerald C. (Jerry)
Bio: ['a Representative from Illinois; born in Streator, La Salle County, \r', 'Ill., July 7, 1957; graduated from Dwight High School, Ill., 1975; attended \r', 'Joliet Junior College, Romeoville, Ill., 1976; B.S., University of Illinois, \r', '1979; aide to United States Representative Tom Corcoran of Illinois, 1980-1981; \r', 'assistant to the director, Illinois state department of agriculture; aide to \r', 'United States Secretary of Agriculture, John R. Block, 1981-1985; member of the \r', 'Illinois state house of representatives, 1988-1994; founder and past president, \r', 'Grundy County Young Republicans; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred \r', 'Fourth and to the six succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1995-January 3, 2009); \r', 'was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Eleventh Congress in \r', '2008.\r']

Name: WEXLER, Robert
Bio:
['a Representative from Florida; born in Queens, Queens County, N.Y., \r', 'January 2, 1961; graduated from Hollywood Hills High School, Hollywood, Fla.; \r', 'B.A., University of Florida, Gainesville, Fla., 1982; J.D., George Washington \r', 'University Law School, Washington, D.C., 1985; lawyer, private practice; member \r', 'of the Florida state senate, 1990-1996; elected as a Democrat to the One \r', 'Hundred Fifth Congress and to the six succeeding Congresses until his resignation on January 4, 2010 (January 3, \r', '1997-January 4, 2010); president, Center for Middle East Peace, Washington, D.C., 2010-present. \r', '


\r', '

Bibliography

Wexler, Robert, with David Fisher. \r', 'Fire-Breathing Liberal: How I Learned to Survive (and Thrive) in the \r', 'Contact Sport of Congress. New York: Thomas Dunne Books, \r', '2008.\r']

Name: WHITFIELD, Wayne Edward (Ed)
Bio: ['a Representative from Kentucky; born in Hopkinsville, Christian \r', 'County, Ky., May 25, 1943; graduated from Madisonville High School, \r', 'Madisonville, Ky., 1961; B.S., University of Kentucky, Lexington, Ky., 1965; \r', 'attended Wesley Theological Seminary and American University, Washington, D.C.; \r', 'J.D., University of Kentucky School of Law, Lexington, Ky., 1969; United States \r', 'Army Reserve, 1967-1973; lawyer, private practice; business executive; business \r', 'owner; attorney adviser to Chairman Edward J. Philbin of the Interstate \r', 'Commerce Commission, 1991-1993; member of the Kentucky state house of \r', 'representatives, 1973-1975; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Fourth \r', 'and to the ten succeeding Congresses until his resignation on September 6, 2016 (January 3, 1995-September 6, 2016). \r']

Name: WICKER, Roger F.
Bio: ['a Senator and a Representative from Mississippi; born in Pontotoc, \r', 'Pontotoc County, Miss., July 5, 1951; graduated Pontotoc High School, Pontotoc, \r', 'Miss., 1969; B.A., University of Mississippi, University, Miss., 1973; J.D., \r', 'University of Mississippi, University, Miss. 1975; Air Force Reserve Officer \r', 'Training Corps; United States Air Force 1976-1980; United States Air Force \r', 'Reserve 1980-2003; staff for United States Representative Trent Lott of \r', 'Mississippi, House Committee on Rules 1980-1982; Tupelo, Miss., judge pro tem; \r', 'Lee County, Miss., public defender 1984-1987; member of the Mississippi state \r', 'senate 1988-1994; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Fourth and to the \r', 'six succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1995-December 31, 2007); resigned on \r', 'December 31, 2007, to accept appointment to the Senate; appointed to the U.S. \r', 'Senate on December 31, 2007, to fill the seat left vacant by the resignation of \r', 'Chester Trent Lott; took oath of office on December 31, 2007; elected in 2008 \r', 'in a special election for the term ending January 3, 2013; reelected in 2012 \r', 'for the term ending January 3, 2019; chair, National Republican Senatorial \r', 'Committee (2015-2017). \r']

Name: WILSON, Addison Graves (Joe)
Bio: ['a Representative from South Carolina; born in Charleston, S.C., July \r', '31, 1947; graduated from the High School of Charleston, Charleston, S.C.; B.A., \r', 'Washington and Lee University, Lexington, Va., 1969; J.D., University of South \r', 'Carolina, Columbia, S.C., 1972; United States Army Reserve, 1972-1975; South \r', 'Carolina Army National Guard, 1975-2003; lawyer, private practice; deputy \r', 'general counsel, United States Department of Energy, 1981-1982; staff, United \r', 'States Senator Strom Thurmond of South Carolina; staff, United States \r', 'Representative Floyd Spence of South Carolina; member of the South Carolina \r', 'state senate, 1984-2001; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Seventh \r', 'Congress, by special election, to fill the vacancy caused by the death of \r', 'United States Representative Floyd Spence, and reelected to the eight \r', 'succeeding Congresses (December 18, 2001-present). \r']

Name: WILSON, Heather
Bio:
[' a Representative from New Mexico; born in Keene, Cheshire County, \r', 'N.H., December 30, 1960; graduated from Keene High School, Keene, N.H.; B.S. \r', 'United States Air Force Academy, Colorado Springs, Colo., 1982; Rhodes Scholar, \r', 'M.Phil., Oxford University, Oxford, England, 1984; D.Phil., Oxford University, \r', 'Oxford, England, 1985; United States Air Force, 1978-1989; cabinet secretary of \r', 'the New Mexico Children, Youth and Families Department, 1995-1998; director for \r', 'European Defense Policy and Arms Control, National Security Council, 1989-1991; \r', 'elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Fifth Congress by special election, \r', 'to fill the vacancy caused by the death of United States Representative Steven \r', 'Schiff, reelected to the five succeeding Congresses (June 23, 1998-January 3, \r', '2009); not a candidate for reelection in 2008, but was an unsuccessful \r', 'candidate for nomination for the United States Senate; Secretary of the Air \r', 'Force, 2017-present.\r', '

Name: WOLF, Frank Rudolph

Morton, 1971-1974; deputy \r', 'assistant secretary, United States Department of the Interior, 1974-1975; \r', 'unsuccessful candidate for nomination to the United States House of \r', 'Representative in 1976; unsuccessful candidate for election to the United \r', 'States House of Representative in 1978; elected as a Republican to the \r', 'Ninety-seventh and to the sixteen succeeding Congresses (January 3, \r', '1981-January 3, 2015); was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred \r', 'Fourteenth Congress in 2014.\r']

Name: WOOLSEY, Lynn C.
Bio:
['a Representative from California; born in Seattle, King County, \r', 'Wash., November 3, 1937; graduated from Lincoln High School, Seattle, Wash.; \r', 'attended the University of Washington, Seattle, Wash., 1955-1957; B.S., \r', 'University of San Francisco, San Francisco, Calif., 1980; human resources \r', 'manager and personnel service owner; teacher, Marin Community College, Indian \r', 'Valley, Calif.; instructor, Dominican College of San Rafael, Calif.; member, \r', 'Petaluma, Calif., city council, 1984-1992; vice mayor, Petaluma, Calif., 1989 \r', 'and 1992; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Third and to the nine \r', 'succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1993-January 3, 2013); was not a candidate \r', 'for reelection to the One Hundred Thirteenth Congress in 2012.\r', '

Name: WU, David
Bio: ['a Representative from Oregon; born in Taiwan, April 8, 1955; B.S., Stanford University, Stanford, Calif., 1977; attended Harvard Medical School, Cambridge, Mass.; J.D., Yale University, New Haven, Conn., 1982; lawyer, private practice; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Sixth and to the six succeeding Congresses until his resignation on August 3, 2011 (January 3, 1999-August 3, 2011).\r']

Name: WYNN, Albert Russell
Bio:
['a Representative from Maryland; born in Philadelphia, Montgomery \r', 'County, Pa., September 10, 1951; graduated from DuVal High School, Lanham, Md., \r', '1969; B.S., University of Pittsburgh, Pittsburgh, Pa., 1973; attended Howard \r', 'University Graduate School of Political Science, Washington, D.C.; J.D., \r', 'Georgetown University School of Law, Washington, D.C., 1977; director, Prince \r', 'George’s County, Md., consumer protection commission, 1977-1982; member of the \r', 'Maryland state house of delegates, 1983-1987; member of the Maryland state \r', 'senate, 1987-1993; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Third and to the \r', 'seven succeeding Congresses until his resignation May 31, 2008 (January 3, \r', '1993-May 31, 2008). \r', '


\r', '

Bibliography

”Albert R. Wynn” in \r', 'Black Americans in Congress, 1870-2007. Prepared under the \r', 'direction of the Committee on House Administration by the Office of History \r', '& Preservation, U. S. House of Representatives. Washington: Government \r', 'Printing Office, 2008.\r']

Name: YOUNG, Charles William (Bill)
Bio: ['a Representative from Florida; born in Harmarville, Allegheny \r', 'County, Pa., December 16, 1930; Army National Guard, 1948-1957; member of the \r', 'Florida state senate, 1960-1970, and minority leader, 1966-1970; member, \r', 'Florida Constitution Revision Commission, 1965-1967; delegate to Republican \r', 'National Convention, 1968, 1972, 1976, and 1984; elected as a Republican to the \r', 'Ninety-second and to the twenty-one succeeding Congresses; served until his \r', 'death on October 18, 2013 (January 3, 1971-October 18, 2013); chair, Committee \r', 'on Appropriations (One Hundred Sixth through One Hundred Eighth Congresses); \r', 'died on October 18, 2013, in Bethesda, Md. \r']

Name: YOUNG, Donald Edwin
Bio: ['a Representative from Alaska; born in Meridian, Sutter County, \r', 'Calif., June 9, 1933; A.A., Yuba Junior College, Marysville, Calif., 1952; \r', 'B.A., California State University, Chico, Calif., 1958; United States Army, \r', '1955-1957; teacher; Mayor of Fort Yukon, Alaska, 1960-1968; riverboat captain, \r', '1968-1972; member of the Fort Yukon, Alaska, city council, 1960-1968; member of \r', 'the Alaska state house of representatives, 1966-1970; member of the Alaska \r', 'state senate, 1970-1973; delegate, Alaska state Republican conventions, 1964, \r', '1966, 1968, and 1972; elected as a Republican to the Ninety-third Congress, by \r', 'special election, to fill the vacancy caused by the death of United States \r', 'Representative Nick Begich, and reelected to the twenty-two succeeding \r', 'Congresses (March 6, 1973-present); chair, Committee on Resources (One Hundred \r', 'Fourth through One Hundred Sixth Congresses); chair, Committee on \r', 'Transportation and Infrastructure (One Hundred Seventh through One Hundred \r', 'Ninth Congresses).\r']
